tvShows.teaserText:
As a global battle against the COVID-19 pandemic spills into cyberspace, the world is grappling with an information explosion on social media. In our hyper-connected lives, the �infodemic� ignites fear and confusion in the real world.

An unprecedented wave of misinformation is driving discrimination against Asian-looking people. Viral fake remedies online come with deadly consequences. Social media posts of panic buying fuel more stockpiling, depriving essential supplies from those who need it most.

But the cyberspace also empowers people to harness the internet as a force for good, galvanising powerful movements to help those affected with a click of the mouse.

We explore how social media has helped or hurt our fight against this new coronavirus and ask, which is the mightier enemy � the pandemic or the �infodemic�?

teaserVideo.caption: As a global battle against the COVID-19 pandemic spills into cyberspace, the world is grappling with an information explosion on social media. In our hyper-connected lives, the "infodemic" ignites fear and confusion in the real world. We explore how social media has helped or hurt our fight against this new coronavirus and ask, which is the mightier enemy - the pandemic or the "infodemic"?
teaserVideo.title: #COVID19: The Social Media Pandemic: Fighting A Virus On The Digital Front

tvShows.description: A global battle against the COVID-19 pandemic spills into cyberspace, as the world grapples with an �infodemic�. Is social media helping or hurting our fight against this deadly virus?
tvShows.title: #COVID19: The Social Media Pandemic

tvShows.teaserText:
Singapore's elderly - one of the most forgotten and overlooked group - are completely left out by the new, ultra-connected world we live in.

If we take the simple step of introducing them to the technology of our day � Facebook, Instagram, and even virtual reality � can they be empowered to change the world?

Three group of seniors gamely take on the challenge, and Channel NewsAsia has assembled Singapore�s hippest social media stars to help them out.

Viral video makers, SGAG, train a team of helpless elderly home residents to film and star in their very own fund-raising video.

Hip Instagram photographers, the Yusman twins, teach four lonely seniors how to use Instagram and gather 'likes' for a legacy of life well lived.

And finally, famous geek artist Eugene Soh team up with four senior tech ambassadors to create Singapore's first VR game for immobile and sickly nursing home residents.

teaserVideo.caption: At 79, she's got cancer and is all alone. He's 80 and can't connect with his granddaughters. Enter the Yusman twins of Instagram fame, to help them tell their stories to the world and feel less lonely. More on the series #DontForgetMe here, about helping the elderly bridge the digital divide.
teaserVideo.title: #DontForgetMe - S1: Can Instagram ease the loneliness of being old in Singapore?

tvShows.description: When forgotten and overlooked seniors are taught how to make use of Facebook, Instagram and even virtual reality by Singapore's hippest social media stars, can they be empowered to change the world?
tvShows.title: #DontForgetMe

tvShows.teaserText:
Singapore's historical narratives often revolve around the well-known storylines. This show is different. This show is a ride through the stories we don�t often talk about.

Bringing us along for the ride, is young, tech-savvy and multi-talented GovTech computer engineer, Preston Lim - the man behind Colourise.sg. He goes on a mission to colourise Singapore�s black and white photos, and discovers snatches of Singapore�s history he didn�t know about. With his colouring app as his inspiration, he tries to bring these lesser known stories to life with a little help from technology.

teaserVideo.caption: #Throwback to when Singaporeans rebelled through rock & roll, cabaret girls were the epitome of women power, and how these "frivolous" stories of entertainment added to the story of Singapore.
teaserVideo.title: #HuntingHistory - S1E2: Glitz & Glam

tvShows.description: Join computer engineer, Preston Lim, as he goes on a mission to colourise Singapore�s black and white photos, and discover lesser known stories of Singapore�s history.
tvShows.title: #HuntingHistory

tvShows.teaserText:
Social media�s impact on travel today is undeniable. This documentary, shot entirely on mobile phones, looks at new ways we�re connecting with places and people both online and offline. Satisfy your wanderlust with our host Rozz as she travels across five cities in Asia - Singapore, Hong Kong, Jakarta, Mumbai and Seoul - and experiences how digital tools have transformed the travel experience.

For more insider travel tips and to a get a local's perspective on some of our favourite cities in Asia, head to Check In.

teaserVideo.caption: How has social media changed the way we travel? We look at new ways we�re connecting with places and people both online and offline. For more insider travel tips and to a get a local's perspective on some of our favourite cities in Asia, head to Check In.
teaserVideo.title: #Wanderlust - S1: Travelling In The Social Media Age

tvShows.description: Social media�s impact on travel today is undeniable. This documentary, shot entirely on iPhoneXS, looks at the new ways we�re connecting with places and people both online and offline.

tvShows.teaserText:
This July marks the 100th anniversary of the Communist Party of China.

We look back at the party�s history, from the 1920�s, to the Civil War, the Great Leap Forward, the Great Famine, the Cultural Revolution and the reforms by Mao Zedong and Deng Xiaoping.

Did the Great Famine cost more than 15 million lives? How does the Cultural Revolution continue to shape Chinese politics today? What was capitalism like after Mao�s death?

Through rare and never-before-seen historical footage, expert interviews and eyewitness accounts of the Great Famine, Tiananmen incident, and the Cultural Revolution, get to know how one party has so profoundly shaped China.

teaserVideo.caption: As the Communist Party of China celebrates its 100th anniversary, we reflect on the Mao Zedong and Deng Xiaoping eras, and the changes the party brought to China.
teaserVideo.title: 100 Years: Its Mark On Modern China

tvShows.description: As the Communist Party of China celebrates its 100th anniversary, we reflect on the Mao Zedong and Deng Xiaoping eras, and the changes the party brought to China.
tvShows.title: 100 Years

tvShows.teaserText: Hong Kong was handed back to China in 1997 under a promise of autonomy for 50 years. That year, 59,250 babies were born in the city. Now at 23, five people of the handover generation embark on individual journeys to pursue dreams, love and careers. In a period of turbulence, each through their own way, strive to build a better future for themselves and the city they call home. Set amidst key political events occurring 23 years after the handover, in 2020, this documentary is an intimate and revealing portrait of people grappling with change sweeping across their city, and their lives.

teaserVideo.caption: Hong Kong was handed back to China in 1997 under a promise of autonomy for 50 years. That year, 59,250 babies were born in the city. Now at 23, five people of the handover generation embark on individual journeys to pursue dreams, love and careers and a better future for themselves and the city they call home.
teaserVideo.title: 23: Born In The Year Of Hong Kong Handover To China, What Will Their Future Hold?

tvShows.description: Five Hong Kongers born in 1997 navigate a period of turbulent change as they pursue dreams, love, careers and a better future for the city they call home.

tvShows.teaserText:
In 2010, longtime Beijing correspondent for The New Yorker, Peter Hessler, published the book "Country Driving". It became a classic known for its keen observations of China at a time of monumental change.

It was also one of the few books by western observers focusing on the ordinary people. Hessler spent seven years in China, and he wrote lovingly of the lives of farmers, migrant workers, and entrepreneurs transformed by the massive changes. Inspired by the book, this series revisits some of the protaganists 10 years later.

Retracing four unique routes - along the Great Wall, riding the railways running north-to-south, across the Hu Line, and following the flow of the Yangtze River - host Zhou Yijun traverses this massive country to probe the meaning of home and happiness; the result of economic growth; the rich-poor divide; and the issue of sustainable development as the people seek to define their Chinese dream.

teaserVideo.caption: The Yangtze River passes through 11 provinces in China and gives life to 400 million Chinese. Along this route from west to east, what do ordinary Chinese think about sustainable development?
teaserVideo.title: A Billion Chinese Dreams - S1E4: Sustainable Development

tvShows.description: Focusing on ordinary people along four unique routes across China, this documentary series explores their differing experiences of the Chinese dream.
tvShows.title: A Billion Chinese Dreams

tvShows.teaserText:
This is the untold story of the 2019 Mount Everest tragedy, where 11 people died trying to scale the world�s highest summit. An image that went viral showed a glimpse of what happened that day - a long, continuous line of hundreds of climbers bottlenecked on the summit ridge of Everest, all trying to take advantage of a narrow window to get to the top.

Weaving first-hand accounts from alpinists, sherpas and those who lost loved ones, find out how and why things went awry. Was the mountain too crowded, and were there too many inexperienced climbers, lured by the magic of the mountain by exploitative companies. And what is the environmental impact caused by the influx of climbers?

teaserVideo.caption: A Deadly Ascent_2020_0_2_Exploiting The Summit
teaserVideo.title: A Deadly Ascent - S1: A Deadly Ascent 2020 0 2 Exploiting The Summit

tvShows.description: In 2019, 11 people died on Mt. Everest in one of the deadliest climbing seasons. This is the untold story with firsthand accounts of exploitation that led to overcrowding and its environmental effects.
tvShows.title: A Deadly Ascent

tvShows.teaserText:
In Season 2 of A Frame In Time, we continue to tell stories of Singapore�s past, pausing at poignant moments in the 1970s and 80s.

Film auteur, Kelvin Tong helms the series again, interweaving fiction and non-fiction for a unique approach to documentary story-telling.

In Ong Kim Seng�s �Night Calligrapher�, we see a man seated and presumably at work in a long alleyway. The narrative spurs an exploration into the past world of letter-writing.

Widely regarded as one of Singapore�s most important artists, Liu Kang�s painting of a �Young Girl with Discus� is infused with a playful energy. This portraiture initiates our conversation about women in sports, featuring Patricia Chan, Glory Barnabas, K Jayamani, among other sporting icons.

The last episode features a mixed media abstract collage, �Hunting Elephants in the Batik Forest� by artist Tumadi B. Patri. We trace the origins of wayang kulit puppetry in Singapore and explore its eventual demise to the likes of radio, cinema, and television.

teaserVideo.caption:
Painted by Tumadi Patri in 1988, Memburu Gajah Di Hutan Batik is both traditional and modern.

It features a mixed media abstract collage of wayang kulit characters set against a backdrop of nature motifs and it invites us to imagine different narratives.

We trace the origins of wayang kulit puppetry in Singapore, and explore its eventual demise to the likes of radio, cinema, and television.
teaserVideo.title: A Frame In Time - S2E3: Hunting Elephants In The Batik Forest

tvShows.description: Helmed by Singaporean filmmaker Kelvin Tong, the second season of A Frame In Time paints an intimate portrait of days gone by in Singapore focusing on post-independence events.
tvShows.title: A Frame In Time

tvShows.teaserText:
In 2008, Aarushi Talwar, a 14-year-old schoolgirl is found murdered in her bedroom. A day later, the body of the prime suspect - the family�s 45-year-old Nepalese help - is discovered on the terrace of the same flat. Who wanted them dead and why?

5 � years later, a Trial Court sentences Aarushi�s parents to life imprisonment. It becomes one of India�s most controversial verdicts. "Aarushi � Beyond Reasonable Doubt" is a 4-part documentary series that reopens the Aarushi Case diaries to separate fact from fiction. The murders. The motive. The media. The murder weapon. The blood on the stairs.

The series draws on the voices of investigators, lawyers, family and friends, crucial witnesses, and journalists who give their versions of truth. It pitches the prosecution against the defence, and the believers against the skeptics. Produced in over more than one year, what emerges is a fascinating story of loss, anger, rivalry, helplessness, justice and retribution.

teaserVideo.caption: The Talwars are serving a life sentence for the double murder of their daughter and house-help. As they appeal against their conviction in the High Court, the producers of this documentary track down former suspects, and speak with international experts. What will they find?
teaserVideo.title: Aarushi - Beyond Reasonable Doubt - S1E4: Separating Facts From Fiction

tvShows.description: 14-year-old Aarushi Talwar is found dead in her house. The next day, the body of the family's 45-year- old Nepalese help is found on the terrace. This becomes one of India's most controversial court cases. Are Aarushi's parents - the accused - truly guilty beyond reasonable doubt?
tvShows.title: Aarushi - Beyond Reasonable Doubt

tvShows.teaserText: ASEAN is an organisation that brings together nations. Connections are forged at the country level but what about those at the individual, personal level? This series features five very different relationships that span across the various ASEAN countries. Each episode will profile a bond between individuals from two different ASEAN countries, exploring the dynamics between them and the factors that have drawn them to each other. From the unlikely to the heartwarming to the charming, each relationship will give viewers insight into the ties that can form between people from different backgrounds with different life stories, the discoveries they make about themselves and each other.

teaserVideo.caption: Adi Prayo Sambodo is a rocker from Indonesia with hit band 6ixth Sense. Hazizah Rahman is a 73-year-old grandma from Malaysia. Together, they make an unexpected mother-and-son pair - and the subject of a beautiful song, on Across Asean.
teaserVideo.title: Across ASEAN - S1: 'The world's best Mak': A rocker and his adoptive mum

tvShows.description: ASEAN is an organisation that brings together nations but what about personal connections? This series features five very different relationships that span across the various ASEAN countries, profiling the dynamics between individuals.
tvShows.title: Across ASEAN

tvShows.teaserText: This four-part series shot in stunning 4K captures the history and culture of this extraordinary continent and reveals a spectacular view of Asia that has never been seen before.

teaserVideo.caption: Aerial India takes an epic aerial journey across this vast nation to showcase its dramatic landscape and enormous population in all its myriad colors, shapes and intrigues. An explosion of color, cultures, and majestic sights that will rivet the eye and the mind.
teaserVideo.title: Aerial Asia - S1E4: India

tvShows.description: Aerial Asia offers a rare glimpse of Asia's most treasured landmarks, all seen from breath-taking heights.
tvShows.title: Aerial Asia

tvShows.teaserText:
When 12 boys and their football coach were trapped in a flooded cave in northern Thailand, the nation launched a massive rescue mission that grew to involve 10,000 people.

Think you already know the story? Think again. In exclusive interviews, we hear how experienced Navy SEALs braved unfamiliar conditions that turned 5-hour dives into 23-hour ones. How teams of young men and bird's nest collectors helped scour the mountain for any cracks in the earth that might lead to where the boys waited. How geologists and ordinary Thais alike came together to control the rising waters in the cave. And how the leaders of the rescue mission coped with the pressures of the unprecedented mission.

Coupled with high-end animation, this documentary unpacks how events unfolded over 17 dramatic days in Tham Luang Cave.

teaserVideo.caption: When 13 people became trapped in a flooded cave in northern Thailand, the nation launched one of the biggest rescue operations involving 10,000 people. We bring you an exclusive documentary that unpacks how events unfolded over 17 dramatic days.
teaserVideo.title: Against The Elements: Tham Luang Cave Rescue

tvShows.description: When 13 people became trapped in a flooded cave in northern Thailand, the nation launched one of the biggest rescue operations involving 10,000 people. We bring you an exclusive documentary that unpacks how events unfolded over 17 dramatic days.
tvShows.title: Against The Elements

tvShows.teaserText: Age of Innovation explores incredible innovations that have shaped Singapore. Digitally remastered and coloured archive brings this metropolis to life. From electricity to communications, construction to connectivity, travel by land air and sea, we follow a nation hundreds of years in the making.

teaserVideo.caption: "Age of Innovation" follows Singapore's incredible connections to the American car revolution, Europe's battlefields, daredevil aviation pioneers, and dazzling entertainment icons. This is a Technicolour Singapore as you've never seen it before.
teaserVideo.title: Age Of Innovation - S1: Episode 2

tvShows.description: Age of Innovation travels through time, showing Singapore's evolution from ancient trading hub to colonial port city, and finally a dynamic modern nation at the forefront of change.
tvShows.title: Age Of Innovation

tvShows.teaserText: Get exclusive insights from the founders of The Lonely Planet and Airbnb. They were trailblazers in the travel industry who went against the grain. Garmin and Fitbit: took fantasy ideas of wearables and turned them into reality. Trailblazers like Rude Health and Vitasoy who transformed alternative milk from yuck to yum. And trendsetters F45 and Zumba who instigated new movements in fitness and wellness.

teaserVideo.caption: The fitness industry is always serving up a new fad, but few have made it to the status of fitness phenomenon, like Zumba�s dance fitness movement and F45, the latest worldwide HIIT franchise.
teaserVideo.title: Ahead Of Their Time - S2E4: F45 & Zumba

tvShows.description: The way we keep fit, the beverages we drink, how we travel and take care of ourselves - these influential products and services have paved the way for the habits that define how we live today.
tvShows.title: Ahead Of Their Time

tvShows.teaserText: There are quiet codes weaved into the fabric of modern life, silently crunching mountains of big data, and helping us solve problems based on the results they derive. They are known as Algorithms - complex webs of code that can determine anything. From whether you should watch this show, to telling police departments if you're going to commit a crime, and where. But can math, and the computers that calculate it, be wrong?

teaserVideo.caption: We look at how humans are trying to wrestle back control. And use algorithms to change the world in good ways rather than bad. How are humans trying to survive in the age of algorithms? Tracking - Algorithms-Ep2
teaserVideo.title: Algorithms - S1E2: Surviving The Algorithm Age

tvShows.description: Should we leave life changing decisions in the hands of codes we don't fully understand? Algorithms: How They Rule Our World finds out.
tvShows.title: Algorithms

tvShows.teaserText:
Altered Lives is about loneliness, disconnect and how circumstances change lives.

The documentary follows 18-year-old Sam in the Philippines as he embarks on a long journey to meet his family for the first time in many years. In India, 28-year-old actress Rytasha deals with public and personal pressures as she seeks companionship and emotional support.

44-year-old Chinese divorcee Pei Li has Parkinson�s disease and is father to an eight-year-old but he wants to do more as he feels time is running out.

In Singapore, 37-year-old Nadia resigned from a promising job to look after her mother, who suffered a stroke and is feeling the brunt of being a full-time caregiver.

teaserVideo.caption: A year into the most challenging chapters of their lives, our four profiles try to find closure amidst their struggles. They do their best taking on new adventures, heartbreaks and surprises.
teaserVideo.title: Altered Lives - S1E4: No More Resistance Now

tvShows.description: Altered Lives is about loneliness and disconnect. Filmed over a year during the COVID pandemic, four individuals face life-changing events and confront the consequences of the choices they make.
tvShows.title: Altered Lives

tvShows.teaserText: How 9/11 ushered in an era of fear, mistrust, and division in America. The compromises and consequences for American democracy--from the terror attacks, through four presidencies, wars abroad, and ultimately insurrection at home.
tvShows.description: How 9/11 ushered in an era of fear, mistrust, and division in America.
tvShows.title: America After 9/11

The creative community has been hit hard with COVID-19 pulling the rug out from under their planned events. How are our artists and entertainers paying their bills and keeping their creative edge when their gigs have dried up, they have no outlet and their audience staying at home?

We get 8 artists - across genres from classical to the popular arts - to record themselves as they try to stay inspired and creatively productive, even as they juggle their art, family, lack of space, HBL...

This revealing programme will serve as a digital diary of a slice of our creative community, as it reacts to and copes with the effects of the circuit breaker.

How are our artists and entertainers paying their bills and keeping their creative edge when their gigs have dried up, they have no outlet and their audience is all staying at home?     We get 8 artists - across the genres and from classical to popular arts - to record themselves as they try to stay inspired and creatively productive, even as they juggle their art, family, lack of space, HBL...    This revealing programme will serve as a digital diary of a slice of our creative community, as it reacts to and copes with the effects of the circuit breaker.

Ten young individuals, from royal princess, to pop icon, puppet artist and a scientist who�s turning science fiction into reality. Innovative, engaging and amazing under 40-year-olds who are primed to be ASEAN�s Next Generation Leaders (ANGeLs).
Produced in each of the 10 nations of ASEAN, this half-hour series is a story of change that�s being brought about by young Southeast Asian men and women.
Starting in the Philippines and ending in Indonesia, each episode delves into the person�s psyche to understand the inspiration, struggles and impact of their work, with insights as well into the cities, towns and communities that they are changing.
This series will give a first-hand look into the life of each ANGeL and how each is bringing change to society, ASEAN and even the world, in a different way.

teaserVideo.caption: Rampant drug use, HIV prejudice, gender inequality. Get into the mind of the woman who has dedicated her life to eradicating issues that plague Vietnam. Dr. Khuat Thi Hai Oanh, a trailblazer, giving a voice to those marginalised by society.

tvShows.teaserText:
Over 100 years ago, nearly two million men in Asia were recruited to fight in the greatest war humanity has ever witnessed.

They were Indian soldiers from remote communities, Chinese farmers from rural outposts, Vietnamese fishermen participating on behalf of their French colonial masters, and Japanese sailors in service of their emperor.

Today, few remember their sacrifice. But their participation in World War I heralded the start of great change in their homelands.

In India, it was the first time Punjabis and Tamils from Hindustan became aware of their shared Indian identity. In China, the war had a role in the formation of the Chinese Communist Party. In Vietnam, it created entrepreneurial opportunities in industries then firmly controlled by the French. And in Japan, it brought the country even closer to the perils of empire.

In 2018, as the world commemorates the centenary of the end of WWI, this series will examine Asia�s contribution to the war, and how the war changed Asia forever.

teaserVideo.caption: In WWI, Japan fought on the side of the Allies, engaged in the only war in Asia, and protecting sea routes and combating enemy submarines. How did the war impact their imperialist ambitions?
teaserVideo.title: Asia in the Great War - S1E4: Japan: An Ambitious Ally

tvShows.description: The contribution of two million Asians who participated in the First World War is almost entirely forgotten today. This series will explore Asia�s forgotten role, and how the conflict shaped the continent.
tvShows.title: Asia in the Great War

tvShows.teaserText: In this landmark 4-part series, Channel NewsAsia deconstructs the pivotal events that have made the Asian Century. With rare archival footage and personal eyewitness testimony, we shed light on the pivotal events of the past.

teaserVideo.caption: 70 Years ago British India was divided into two countires, India and Pakistan. The repercussions of that event last till this day. Through the modern day victims of partition, we explore its legacy.
teaserVideo.title: Asian Century - S1E4: Partition Of India

tvShows.description: In this landmark 4-part series, Channel NewsAsia deconstructs the pivotal events that have made the Asian Century. With rare archival footage and personal eyewitness testimony, we shed light on the pivotal events of the past.

tvShows.teaserText:
Once the industry of large nations with deep pockets, innovations in space-tech are enabling unlikely entrepreneurs to go from laptop to space player. The space industry is expected to be worth a trillion dollars by 2040, and is now open for business to everyone, including six unlikely entrepreneurs based in Singapore. A former secondary school teacher, a banker, an academic and a student at the National University of Singapore are reshaping global conventions with potential game changers birthed in a nation with little space heritage.

These Singapore startups are building low-cost rockets to increase access to space, space lasers to revolutionise communications infrastructure, small launchers to turn Southeast Asia into a spaceport and plasma thrusters adapted from nuclear fusion technology. How far can they go?

teaserVideo.caption: Once the industry of large nations with deep pockets, space is now open for business to everyone, including six unlikely entrepreneurs based in Singapore with potential game changers.
teaserVideo.title: Astropreneurs: To The Stars & Beyond: Seeking Space Mavericks

tvShows.description: Once the industry of large nations with deep pockets, space is now open for business to everyone, including six unlikely entrepreneurs based in Singapore with potential game changers.
tvShows.title: Astropreneurs: To The Stars & Beyond

tvShows.teaserText:
At the start of Term 3 in 2017, 5 struggling secondary school students receive the most unlikely help for the next 10 weeks - they are each paired up with 5 ordinary retirees, all in their 70s & 80s.

Channel NewsAsia wants to find out if a simple friendship can make the old healthier, and the young more confident... But at the very first meeting, problems arise.

83-year-old Bill is disdainful of youngsters - will he warm up to meek but cheerful 14-year-old Kieryon?

And although 79-year-old Nonie is incredibly chatty, will 15-year-old Junhao, who is painfully shy, ever open up to her?

And when all the seniors are so out of touch with school life, how will they find a way to help their young partners?

teaserVideo.caption: We're nearing the end of our intergenerational experiment, our seniors and teenagers have become firm friends. But will they show improvements in their mental, physical and emotional health? Will a cross-generational friendship truly pay off?
teaserVideo.title: Back to School - S1E4: Back To School

tvShows.description: 5 ordinary seniors try and befriend 5 struggling teenagers over one school term.   But problems arise in the very first meeting. Can they get past the awkward gap? Would the teenagers open up at all? And would simply being old get in the way of our seniors' best efforts?
tvShows.title: Back to School

tvShows.teaserText: Once a key entrepot serving regional trading networks, Singapore has evolved into a leading global city � a premier trade, technology and innovation hub. How did Singapore develop into such an economically vibrant city? Why are more and more multinationals keen to base their operations here, and how have they impacted the economy? What pressing challenges posed by the pandemic and other global headwinds do foreign and local firms in Singapore grapple with today? We glean insights from economists and industry experts as well as the experiences of diverse foreign and local companies to uncover Singapore�s success in achieving and keeping its global hub status.

teaserVideo.caption:
A global innovation hotspot, Singapore is grooming creative talents from diverse fields. What exciting projects can we find in this future-ready city?

Produced in partnership with Ministry of Trade and Industry (MTI), Singapore
teaserVideo.title: Becoming A Global Hub - S1E3: Innovating For The Future

tvShows.description: An in-depth look at how Singapore evolved into a premier global trade, technology and innovation hub and how it plans to sharpen its competitive edge.
tvShows.title: Becoming A Global Hub

tvShows.teaserText: In �Becoming Human� zany presenter Chua Enlai journeys with A.I. & robots to rediscover elements of our humanity.

teaserVideo.caption: Will AI lighten our workload or take over our jobs? What skills help us stay relevant? As AI-powered talent emerges, Enlai reviews his resume, reflects on his work and reconsiders his future.
teaserVideo.title: Becoming Human - S3E2: Will AI Lighten Our Workload Or Take Our Jobs?

tvShows.description: Comedic actor Chua Enlai embarks on a zany exploration of artificial intelligence. He examines how A.I. is becoming human as it is shaped by our love, intelligence, ethics and power.
tvShows.title: Becoming Human

tvShows.teaserText:
Eunice Olsen explores Singapore�s � and her own � forgotten past. Tracing back hundreds of years, this is an insightful and emotional journey into the faded histories of our ancestors.

Over two episodes, the series takes us on an evocative journey through Singapore�s landscapes to meet a variety of people with rich and diverse stories to tell. The series reflects that there�s not just one singular Singapore narrative, but a meeting of many tales.

We explore bustling streets, excavation sites, mangrove swamps and lush green parks, galleries and museums teeming with national treasures, in search of fading stories that reveal where we came from and just how far we�ve come. Eunice takes a bold step into understanding her own roots � and discovers far more than she ever expected. How does her own personal family history mirror that of Singapore�s story?

teaserVideo.caption: We've been taught that Sir Stamford Raffles founded Singapore in 1819. But what was life in Singapore like before the colonial era?
teaserVideo.title: Becoming Singapore - S1: A thriving Singapore - even before Stamford Raffles

tvShows.description: Eunice Olsen explores Singapore�s forgotten past in an insightful and emotional journey into the faded histories of our ancestors.
tvShows.title: Becoming Singapore

tvShows.teaserText: Two 1-hour episodes take a look back at the year of COVID-19, the lessons learned and the road ahead. We get insights from the decision-makers (including government ministers), frontline healthcare workers and regular Singaporeans affected by the pandemic. The series acknowledges the tough times, but ultimately it�s a story of resilience. It shows how Singaporeans from all walks of life have got through this period together, and are working to make the country better equipped to handle future challenges.

teaserVideo.caption: COVID-19 spreads into migrant-worker dormitories, causing alarm but also sparking Singaporeans to help out. The pandemic also results in economic fallout and speeds up a digital transformation.
teaserVideo.title: Believe - S1E2: The Road Ahead

tvShows.description: An insightful look at COVID-19�s impact. Government ministers, frontline healthcare workers and regular Singaporeans share sometimes emotional stories of challenges they�ve faced, and the road ahead.
tvShows.title: Believe

tvShows.teaserText:
Parent-child, husband-wife, friends, siblings. Hawkers come in all shapes and sizes.

Belly of a Nation steps into the lives of a handful of Singapore hawkers of different generations. Get a glimpse first-hand of their camaraderie, their quarrels and through it all, their unwavering support for each other. The legacies and obstacles faced while trying to sustain their businesses. We pay homage to their mouthwatering treats.

In the first season, we trace how ethnic lines were blurred by roving hawkers in the past. As the first generation stallholders pass on, who is going to carry their torch? We profile some of the brave and intrepid hawkerpreneurs, who despite the odds, believe that they can keep the hawker culture alive.

The second season coincides with the arrival of COVID-19. For 9 months, we track the hawkers� shock, dismay and determination to weather through this storm. But initial optimism turns to worry, and fear as the months drag out. Will some of them end up folding for good?

teaserVideo.caption: Though food, we witness life�s ups and downs. In the finale episode, meet Weijie, the third generation in a family of fishball makers. He ventures into selling fishball noodles but COVID-19 forced him to hunker down. He re-emerged 3 months later only to be axed once again. Other hawkers in the CBD have to make critical decisions, and one impacts a career that spanned more than half a century.
teaserVideo.title: Belly Of A Nation - S1E4: Finding Closure

tvShows.description: Belly Of A Nation season 1 is a 2-parter documentary about the trials and tribulations of Singapore�s hawker culture from past to present day. We get into the hearts, minds of hawkers, while paying homage to their amazing dishes. In Season 2, we step into the lives of Singapore hawkers over the past 9 months. Despite COVID-19, they endeavor to cook up salivating dishes of Oyster Omelette, Nasi Briyani, Appam and Charcoal Bun Barbeque Burgers.
tvShows.title: Belly Of A Nation

tvShows.teaserText:
Dogs, cats, babies, TikTok trends� we scroll through them mindlessly. But what if viral videos are doing more to our world than we realise?

In episode one, we examine the propagator-in-chief of silly viral videos - TikTok. It has gained traction in at least 140 countries, but why would a platform for dumb videos suddenly get the attention of political leaders in the United States and India? Is there more to TikTok than we presume?

In episode two, we turn our attention to the most 'harmless' videos out there - animals and kids. We watch them for giggles, sometimes to be amazed. But are these video as harmless as they seem to be? We explore the dark side of viral videos and the science behind why we share them.

In the final episode, we follow up on the ordinary folks after they've struck Internet fame. How long does the glitter last? What happens after?

teaserVideo.caption: Which would you choose, feline friends or canine companions? As pets, dogs outnumber cats by 100 million. However, cat videos generate almost four times more views online than dog videos. Why does this happen?
teaserVideo.title: Beyond the Viral Video - S1: Why Cats Make More Viral Videos Than Dogs

tvShows.description: Dogs, cats, babies, TikTok trends, overnight Internet sensations� we are happy to scroll through these viral videos mindlessly. But are viral videos doing more to our world than we realise?
tvShows.title: Beyond the Viral Video

tvShows.teaserText: "Blueprint for Survival" is a three-part documentary series showcasing crises that threatened Singapore�s survival and how rising to meet these challenges strengthened and sharpened the mettle of Singaporeans. 1985 - the first economic recession since independence, the urgent need to find a new source of water for its people and the unexpected nose-dive of a booming tourism industry were serious enough to knock Singapore off its feet. But instead of tearing the nation apart, it united the people, created a strong public-private sector partnership fuelled by a "never-say-die" spirit and the sheer willpower not to go under. In facing these dangers, Singapore was irrevocably transformed. It chartered new paths for economic and tourism development, and turned over-cautious government agencies into nimble organisations. The debates and decisions that led to these changes are vividly recounted by key players who shaped Singapore into what it is today.

teaserVideo.caption: With Singapore threatening to become a tourism backwater at the start of the millenium, this episode explores the Government's masterplan that transformed Singapore into a fun place to visit.
teaserVideo.title: Blueprint For Survival - S1E3: Tourism Revival

tvShows.description: Singapore was almost knocked off its feet by three recent crises since 1985. "Blueprint for Survival" shows how a united Singapore fought back to emerge stronger from the first economic recession since independence, rescue a flailing tourism industry and tap technology to create NEWater.
tvShows.title: Blueprint For Survival

tvShows.teaserText: A 4-part 1-hour documentary series that takes a powerful and intimate look at the people who are living at little known, mysterious borders between two countries, both on land and at sea.

teaserVideo.caption: The story of the porous Bangladesh-Indian border and the stateless in enclave areas, and how a land swap between both countries in 2015 changed everything.
teaserVideo.title: Borderlands - S1E4: The Displaced People Of Kurigram

tvShows.description: A 4-part 1-hour documentary series that takes a powerful and intimate look at the people who are living at little known, mysterious borders between two countries, both on land and at sea.
tvShows.title: Borderlands

tvShows.teaserText:
In the spring of 2021, a devastating second wave of COVID-19 sweeps India. A highly transmissible mutation of the virus emerges. Daily cases soar to over 400,000 at its peak, setting global records.

As the demand for oxygen, hospital beds and medicines escalate, Indians from different parts of the country come together to help: youths set up an online resource bank of medical essentials, people provide free oxygen supplies to villages, friends start a hospital for the needy, and ambulance companies ferry the deceased for their last rights. This is the story of a nation coming together to fight an unseen enemy.

teaserVideo.caption: In early 2021, India is hit by a cataclysmic wave of COVID-19. The virus cripples the medical infrastructure. As the death toll rises, Indians must do whatever it takes to survive the catastrophe.
teaserVideo.title: Breathe Again: India's Battle With COVID

tvShows.description: In early 2021, India is hit by a cataclysmic wave of COVID-19. The virus cripples the medical infrastructure. As the death toll rises, Indians must do whatever it takes to survive the catastrophe.
tvShows.title: Breathe Again

tvShows.teaserText: In a remote Singapore lockup lies a stunning collection of Chinese bronze artefacts, unseen and forgotten for almost five decades. Over one hundred bronze pieces, believed to be from the Shang and Zhou dynasties, have remained hidden�until now. This documentary traces the mysterious journey of these potentially priceless bronzes from China to Singapore. What happens next is a present-day quest to discover their true authenticity and value. This is nail biting quest around the world from Singapore and China to Europe, using forensic scientific tests and expert analysis to reveal the real story behind this lost treasure.

teaserVideo.caption: In a remote Singapore lockup lies a stunning collection of Chinese bronze artefacts,unseen and forgotten for almost five decades - until now.
teaserVideo.title: Bronze: A Forgotten Treasure: A Quest To Uncover The Truth Behind One Man's Treasure

tvShows.description: In a remote Singapore lockup lies a stunning collection of Chinese bronze artefacts, unseen and forgotten for almost five decades - until now.
tvShows.title: Bronze: A Forgotten Treasure

tvShows.teaserText: Business Unusual asks companies where they want to be one year from now as they cope with pandemic induced disruption and economic slowdown. The series will look at business behaviour in 3 possible scenarios: a return to total lockdown, a partial lockdown and a return to normal. Uncertainty often pushes businesses to cut investment, costs and manpower. But is this always the right thing to do? Can businesses consider potential scenarios and strategise for outcomes that will allow them to thrive and survive?

teaserVideo.caption: Spending more on advertising and increasing market awareness during a slow-down. How will these so-called red ocean strategies help companies stand out from their competitors?
teaserVideo.title: Business Unusual - S1E6: Creating Demand

tvShows.description: Business Unusual asks companies where they want to be one year from now, after the pandemic induced disruptions. The series looks at the possible scenarios companies will face, and the unexpected business strategies that will allow them to thrive.
tvShows.title: Business Unusual

tvShows.teaserText:
A butterfly in flight is one of nature's most beautiful sights. But the term "butterfly children" belies a cruel reality. Those born with Epidermolysis Bullosa, or EB, are called �Butterfly Children� because their skin is as fragile as a butterfly's wings. Any slight contact or friction can lead to skin trauma. Activities as mundane as holding a pencil or walking 20 meters to catch the school bus often result in excruciating blisters and sores.

We enter the lives of four families living with EB in Singapore. Ira Jain has been struggling with the condition all through childhood and her insecure teenage years. But she is also a budding poet and scientist who wants to contribute to the pharmaceutical industry, and bring awareness to the condition. Three-year old Raed has one of the most severe cases of EB in Singapore. But just as you see his blisters, you also see his open smile. His parents share their struggle in caring for him, as well as their hopes for a kinder future.

teaserVideo.caption: A butterfly in flight is one of nature's most beautiful sights. But the term "butterfly children" belies a cruel reality. We enter the lives of 4 families in Singapore living with Epidermolysis Bullosa to hear their struggles, and their triumphs.
teaserVideo.title: Butterfly Children: Living With Extremely Fragile Skin

tvShows.description: A butterfly in flight is one of nature's most beautiful sights. But the term "butterfly children" belies a cruel reality. We enter the lives of 4 families in Singapore living with Epidermolysis Bullosa to hear their struggles, and their triumphs.
tvShows.title: Butterfly Children

tvShows.teaserText:
Climate change is a �super wicked problem�. From the richest country in the world to a small island nation, no one is spared its effects. Scientific data presents a clear picture - the earth is warming, and human actions are the cause. Excessive carbon emission from fossil fuels is the main culprit, but can we cut our ties to carbon while advancing our civilization?

Global carbon emission needs to stop increasing by 2020 in order to keep global temperature rise to less than 2 degrees Celsius within this century. Time Adaptation is no longer enough, mitigation is ever more pressing.

In this programme, we visit with climate scientists, witness the daily struggle with sea level rise on the island of Tuvalu, speak with scientists and researchers behind innovative solutions that could help reduce our reliance on carbon and learn more about how we can tap on nature � the earth�s most precious gift � to fight climate change.

The solutions are out there. It is up to us to take action, NOW.

teaserVideo.caption: The earth is warming, FAST. Human addiction to carbon is the cause of it. We speak with scientists and researchers behind innovative solutions that could help reduce our reliance on carbon and learn more about how we can tap on nature � the earth�s most precious gift � to fight climate change.
teaserVideo.title: Carbon Conundrum: Can We Reduce Our Reliance On Carbon?

tvShows.description: Climate change is a "super wicked problem".  Adaptation is not enough, we need to cut carbon emission fast to avoid catastrophic consequences. The solutions are out there, it's up to us to act now.
tvShows.title: Carbon Conundrum

tvShows.teaserText:
South Korea�s most infamous murder case involving one of the country's first known serial killers. The notorious killer plagued the rural city of Hwaseong with 10 murders in just four years, leading to the largest manhunt the country has ever seen.

Catching A Killer recaps the twists and turns of the police investigation, the vital evidence that was overlooked and the emotional trauma felt in a town where locals were scared to leave their homes.

Part one opens with a string of shocking murders but it�s not until the fifth murder in four months that police finally initiate a broad investigation. Three more women are killed before police finally make an arrest - 22-year-old Sung-yeo Yoon.

Part two sees Yoon give a first-hand account of his arrest and the police torture that led to his confession. A confession that put him in prison for 20 years. But with an anonymous tip-off and the discovery of new forensic evidence in 2019, Yoon�s guilty verdict is put to test.

teaserVideo.caption: The second part of Catching A Killer tells the story of how one man tried to clear his name after spending 20 years in prison, in the most infamous serial murder investigation South Korea has ever seen.
teaserVideo.title: Catching A Killer: The Hwaseong Murders - S1E2: Piecing The Evidence

tvShows.description: South Korea's most infamous serial murder investigation. With testimony from the man convicted of the crime, Catching A Killer recounts the original case and the new evidence that changed it all.
tvShows.title: Catching A Killer: The Hwaseong Murders

tvShows.teaserText: In "CHALLENGE TOMORROW" concerned Singaporeans embark on personal journeys to understand some of Singapore's greatest impending challenges: a slowing economy, disruptive technology that threatens thousands of jobs, a rapidly ageing citizenry, climate change and cyber threats to our security.

teaserVideo.caption: The Internet of Things brings us efficiency and convenience, but at what cost? From cybersecurity to the blurring of identity, living in a world of virtual borders can be exciting yet alarming. Host, Divian Nair goes on a journey to experience the potential and examine the risks of this new world.
teaserVideo.title: Challenge Tomorrow - S1E5: Securing Our Virtual World

tvShows.description: In "CHALLENGE TOMORROW" concerned Singaporeans embark on personal journeys to understand some of Singapore's greatest impending challenges: a slowing economy, disruptive technology that threatens thousands of jobs, a rapidly ageing citizenry, climate change and cyber threats to our security.
tvShows.title: Challenge Tomorrow S1

tvShows.teaserText:
To mark its 20th anniversary in 2019, Channel NewsAsia will celebrate 20 individuals whose imagination, talents and efforts have uplifted their communities here in Asia. These are people who have seen a situation that they wanted to improve and have committed to the necessary action to do so.

These individuals come from diverse backgrounds and work in diverse fields, affecting diverse groups. But what unifies them is the enterprising spirit, the innovative streak and the selfless trait, that is evident of a thriving and booming Asian region.

teaserVideo.caption: It sounds an impossible idea - get well-off Hong Kongers to rent their apartments at below-market rate to the poor? Which landlord would do that? It took just one man to believe.
teaserVideo.title: Champions For Change - S1: Hong Kong's charitable landlords

tvShows.description: To mark its 20th anniversary in 2019, Channel NewsAsia will celebrate 20 individuals whose imagination, talents and efforts have uplifted their communities here in Asia. These are people who have seen a situation that they wanted to improve and have committed to the necessary action to do so.
tvShows.title: Champions For Change

tvShows.teaserText: Aaron Maniam, public servant and scholar, takes on one of the biggest questions of our time: Is scarcity real? Scarcity, for so long a fundamental assumption in Economics, is due for a reassessment. The ubiquity of technology and the changing needs and wants of a generation coming into fore are the impetus; the urgency - an increasingly violent planet. We live in a time of unprecedented abundance, yet, scarcity persists. As a tool, technology has brought abundance to millions (see China) but it has also been used as a source of consumption that creates other wants. What must we do for a sustainable and equitable future? One person cannot answer every nuance of this complex question, but Aaron�s search takes him from the vast exteriors of Mongolia to the narrow interiors of the human psyche. Out of which, came a research paper, peer-reviewed, and housed online @ www.chasingscarcity.com, inviting as many people to the conversation as possible.

teaserVideo.caption: Greta who? 20 years ago, residents of Samso switched to renewables to solve a need, and the island is today energy positive. What's better than the clean sweep of wind turbines? The dividend it pays.
teaserVideo.title: Chasing Scarcity - S1E2: Unlimited Desires

tvShows.description: Videos on demand. Watch the best of CNA documentaries and current affairs programmes on Singapore, Asia-Pacific and elsewhere in the world.
tvShows.title: Chasing Scarcity

tvShows.teaserText: 10 personalities from 10 cities across Asia share about their daily lives via social streaming.

teaserVideo.caption: Traditional recipes cook-off! Watch more Check In episodes here.
teaserVideo.title: Check In - S1: Task 60 The Ultimate Recipe Swap!: Htet, The +65s, Shinichi and Saransh

tvShows.description: Channel NewsAsia Check In is a brand new concept that sees 10 personalities from 10 different cities across Asia share about their lives daily via social streaming.
tvShows.title: Check In

tvShows.teaserText: Mystery still surrounds the earliest film ever made in China � recently discovered in a shop basement in the north of England. Young men in mandarin attire laugh and joke as they glance at the camera, eyeballing the 21st century viewer from the time of the Qing Dynasty. Since those gentlemen were recorded on celluloid, China has experienced nearly 120 years of momentous change. These first fleeting images are part of a unique collection of early films at the British Film Institute (BFI), covering every facet of Chinese life from the time of the Boxer Rebellion to the Communist victory in 1949. With unique access to the BFI National Archive, this 2-part documentary shows films never seen before this outside the UK. The best of these extraordinary images are worked into a compelling narrative to reveal new insights into this period of tremendous change and turmoil in China. Voiced by renowned cinematographer Christopher Doyle, the films capture a pre-CCP China in vivid motion.

teaserVideo.caption: This episode flaunts the first-ever colour film of China - capturing a unique moment in Beijing's history. Other films show Shanghai in the jazz age, the new middle class enjoying a funfair, and mission schools and hospitals set up in the countryside. All before the war years descend on China.
teaserVideo.title: China on Film - S1E2: The War Years

tvShows.description: Renowned cinematographer Christopher Doyle voices this 2-part documentary about China from the late Qing dynasty to the pre-CCP period - told through exclusive, never-seen-before films from the British Film Institute.
tvShows.title: China on Film

tvShows.teaserText: China. It's home to 1.4 billion people. Hundreds of millions of Chinese are joining the global middle class - with more money to spend on eating more, and eating better. Calorie intake has doubled over the past decades, and China is set to account for nearly half of the global rise in food demand by 2050. With its meteoric rise, comes a new challenge: With a fifth of the world�s population, but less than a tenth of the world�s arable land, how will it feed its increasingly affluent population? Just how far will China's eating habits dictate politics and economies around the world? CNA correspondent Wei Du, born and raised in China, undertakes a journey to the source of China's food supply to find out.

teaserVideo.caption: Would you eat a rat the size of a small dog? The bamboo rat is apparently delicious, good for your skin and can help reduce your carbon footprint on the planet.
teaserVideo.title: China's Growing Appetite - S1: Eating bamboo rats in China

tvShows.description: CNA correspondent Wei Du undertakes a journey to find out how China's changing eating habits affect the world.
tvShows.title: China's Growing Appetite

tvShows.teaserText: Like human beings, cities have a spectrum of personality traits. They can be soulmates for some, and complete mismatches for others. City DNA unearths fascinating aspects of living in 5 of the region�s most popular cities. Our host explores Shanghai, Tokyo, Hong Kong, Taipei and Seoul like never before.

teaserVideo.caption: Quality of life is the holy grail in the 21st century.And Joanna continues her exploration on the question of liveability in Tokyo. From artificial intelligence and unusual services to quirky characters in mainstream society, we'll find out how good the biggest metropolis on earth is to live in.
teaserVideo.title: City DNA - S1E5: Tokyo

tvShows.description: Like human beings, cities have a spectrum of personality traits. They can be soulmates for some, and complete mismatches for others. City DNA unearths fascinating aspects of living in 5 of the region�s most popular cities. Our host explores Shanghai, Tokyo, Hong Kong, Taipei and Seoul like never before.
tvShows.title: City DNA

tvShows.teaserText:
We are witnessing the dawn of a new era in Singapore where passion counts just as much as pragmatism.

This series follows a diverse group of people who have pursued their passions relentlessly - food artist Janice Wong, comedian Fakkah Fuzz, professional wrestler Andruew Tang, educator Kuik Shiao-Yin and orchestra conductor Kahchun Wong - and finds out what fuels their drive.

teaserVideo.caption: A trained sculptor who became one of the country�s leading sound artists. Learn more about his journey through the eyes of his close friends and family.
teaserVideo.title: City of Opportunities - S1: #DIAL of Zul Mahmod

tvShows.description: With Singapore as a muse, home-grown talents are inspiring a new passionate era.  Artists, entertainers, inventors and more are furthering Singapore�s reputation as a truly global city, creating a City of Opportunities.
tvShows.title: City of Opportunities

tvShows.teaserText:
The skies are bluer, carbon emissions are falling, and it appears we�re giving the environment a much-needed break.

The thing is - have we really moved the needle on climate change, or is this just a comfortable illusion?

In this four-part series, we confront a global threat � climate change � with host Janil Puthucheary. He hits the ground to investigate what Singapore is doing to combat climate change. Are we too small to make a difference.

We use future tense when we talk about climate change, but it�s already affecting communities all over the world. And the effects are not missed on us either. From plastics to electricity to food, he breaks down the little things that�d make up unique solutions for a unique nation. Solutions that we have to start on, NOW.

And in a final war cry, he rallies Singaporeans to fix it with personal responsibility.

teaserVideo.caption: Dr Janil Puthucheary confronts the toughest challenge so far � getting Singapore to confront how our favourite foods can cause climate change.
teaserVideo.title: Climate Change: A Wicked Problem - S1E4: Our Food Problem

tvShows.description: Confront a global threat � climate change � with host Janil Puthucheary. From plastics to electricity to food, he breaks down the little things that�d make up unique solutions for a unique nation.
tvShows.title: Climate Change: A Wicked Problem

tvShows.teaserText:
Clean energy isn�t just a great challenge. It�s a great opportunity.

With clean energy, even small countries like Singapore can make an outsized impact on the world by exporting solutions to the region. This is a Climate for Change.

This two-part documentary series tells the story of daring people and enterprises venturing to bring cleaner energy to new frontiers and new customers through pioneering projects.

Filmed in Singapore, China, Cambodia, Vietnam & Finland, the documentary features groundbreaking projects in solar, wind, biofuels and natural gas. Discover the companies behind the world�s largest floating solar energy testbed in the sea, the first wind energy project in Cambodia, the first foreign-owned wind farms in Vietnam, the expansion of one of the world�s largest renewable biodiesel refineries to make renewable jet fuel and the commissioning and delivery of the first LNG (liquified natural gas) bunkering vessel in Singapore.

teaserVideo.caption: Daring people and enterprises take wind and solar energy to new frontiers across Asia through groundbreaking projects. Renewable energy is challenging but it�s transforming the region for good.
teaserVideo.title: Climate For Change - S1E2: Renewing Energy

tvShows.description: Meet individuals and enterprises pioneering projects that will bring cleaner energy to new frontiers. Clean energy will take courage but those who dare could change the world.
tvShows.title: Climate For Change

tvShows.teaserText:
Waste is generated on an epic scale. As humans, we have adopted a linear approach to food, plastic and clothes in our daily lives. We take, we make, and we dispose.

Each time we do this, we eat into a finite supply of resources and produce toxic waste, which cannot work long-term unless we go circular. The Circular Economy? It is a buzzword nowadays, but its principles are based on pearls of wisdom. Circularity is production and consumption to create as little waste as possible. Where there is waste, it becomes a new resource. Ultimately, circularity, or zero waste, will significantly move the needle on climate change.

However, the circular economy is more than an environmental concept. It is also about economics.

This series examines how Singapore, with its green plan and sustainable practices, is driving change, while other forward-thinking countries are unlocking economic opportunities by closing the resource loop. Meet the smart, motivated entrepreneurs who are making it happen.

teaserVideo.caption: How can a Circular Economy reduce tonnes of food, fashion, electronics and construction waste from ending up in landfills? How can cities unlock lucrative opportunities in closing the resource loop?
teaserVideo.title: Climate For Change: Closing The Loop - S2E2: The Circular City

tvShows.description:
Waste is generated on an epic scale. Unless we go �circular,� it's game over for the planet.

How can waste from one industry become another�s resource? And how do we unlock the economic benefits?
tvShows.title: Climate For Change: Closing The Loop

tvShows.teaserText:
Exciting new technologies have emerged, setting the gears in motion for a new industrial revolution. This documentary series, comprising 3 short episodes, examines new production approaches that decouple social and economic growth from carbon emissions. The series is a showcase of innovations from 25 companies across the world, who have developed new approaches to producing energy, materials and food. These new approaches, if adopted at scale, could move the needle on climate change. Their business models also prove that sustainability is good for business, as consumers and whole industries alike look towards playing their part in slowing the damage and creating a more sustainable future for generations to come.

Produced in partnership with Temasek�s Ecosperity platform.

teaserVideo.caption:
A new industrial revolution is gathering pace. New technologies already in our midst will change how the world makes energy, materials, and food.

Produced in partnership with Temasek�s Ecosperity platform.
teaserVideo.title: Climate Trailblazers: Reimagining Our Future - S1E1: Climate Trailblazers: Reimagining Our Future

tvShows.title: Climate Trailblazers: Reimagining Our Future

tvShows.teaserText: Highlights of news stories and features by CNA's network of Correspondents based in major cities across the region.

teaserVideo.caption: 2021 - another year ravaged by COVID-19. As the world started recovering, an outbreak of variants dampened any early optimism. We recap some major themes of 2021 that are likely to continue in 2022.
teaserVideo.title: CNA Correspondent - S1: One Step Forward, Two Steps Back

tvShows.description: Highlights of news stories and features by CNA's network of Correspondents based in major cities across the region.
tvShows.title: CNA Correspondent

tvShows.teaserText:
As governments grapple with the impact of the COVID-19 pandemic, the crisis has accelerated an urgency to address strategic challenges at corporate and public levels, among these � the challenge of climate change.

Even before the pandemic, the call for a global recovery plan has dominated headlines. While talk actively revolved around issues such as renewable energy, energy-efficient buildings, a breakaway from fossil fuels, conservation, enabling citizen engagement and more, steps to take action haven�t kept pace. In effect, a �Green Recovery� plan is needed. To do so, green financing, green technology and green leadership are necessary to enable national efficacy and prosperity.

Government support and incentives for industries can not only boost economy but also help transform it. How can private investments and technology help shape sustainable solutions to complement recovery plans? What is the path forward and could this be our future�s blueprint?

teaserVideo.caption: BMW joins other private and public sector stakeholders in a timely conversation on Green Recovery at the CNA leadership Summit 2021. BMW shares views on how sustainability is a collective goal for business leaders across industries.
teaserVideo.title: CNA Leadership Summit: Green Recovery - S1E9: Sustainability as a collective goal

tvShows.description: Climate change is real. COVID-19 cannot be a reason to forget. A green recovery plan is needed. The second edition of the CNA Leadership Summit will tackle the topic and more.
tvShows.title: CNA Leadership Summit: Green Recovery

tvShows.teaserText:
The inaugural CNA Digital Economy Leadership Summit brings the region�s brightest minds and leaders to Singapore in October 2020. The Summit aims to explore new and innovative approaches for public-private collaboration to accelerate transformation in the Digital Economy and discuss how they have embedded innovation across their entire organization to bring people and ideas together, while encouraging and enabling creativity.

This event is by invitation only.

teaserVideo.caption: Just like how some companies invest in customer experience, it�s equally important to invest in employee experience! Many reports say it�s the future of the workplace. Sarah Dunn, Head of Employee Experience at Adobe Asia Pacific shares more.
teaserVideo.title: CNA Leadership Summit: Navigating a Post-Pandemic World - S1E9: CNA938 Interview With Adobe

tvShows.description: The inaugural CNA Leadership Summit 2020 aims to explore fresh approaches for public-private collaboration and to discuss how businesses have reacted to the shock of the COVID-19 pandemic.
tvShows.title: CNA Leadership Summit: Navigating a Post-Pandemic World

tvShows.teaserText:
Algorithms are everywhere today, infiltrating every aspect of our lives, and using big data to change how we live on a daily basis. And this is just the beginning of the algorithmic age. Algorithms are the building blocks for almost all advanced technology today, from Amazon shopping recommendations to the most sophisticated artificial intelligence.

Anjan Sundaram � author, journalist and mathematician � travels the world to meet with people designing this code, and people affected by this algorithmic revolution. We see how this code is making and taking away our choices, affecting the fate of nations and the freedom of individuals, being used to create virtual beings, communities and worlds, and ultimately changing who we are and what we will become in tomorrow�s world.

Are algorithms good or bad? Or just tools we have created to help us live better lives? That is part of what we will discover as Anjan explores the impact of code in our new world order.

teaserVideo.caption: How does sex figure in a marriage to a virtual spouse? Akihiko Kondo is among 3,700 people who believe that artificial intelligence can replace human relationships - and who've proven it by marrying hologram Hatsune Miku. #CodedWorld explores if a future powered by machine learning algorithms and AI could be a benefit or a threat.
teaserVideo.title: Coded World - S1: I married a hologram wife (A Japanese bachelor's tale)

tvShows.description: Algorithms are everywhere today, using big data to change how we live our lives. Mathematician and journalist Anjan Sundaram travels the world to find out what's at stake in this coded revolution.
tvShows.title: Coded World

tvShows.teaserText:
A visually-rich documentary that centres around four young individuals pursuing their dream jobs in the maritime sector, this half-hour film presents a reinvigorated maritime industry by focusing on the next generation of workers, innovation and sustainability.

Brought to you by Ministry of Transport

teaserVideo.caption: A visually-rich documentary that centres around four young individuals pursuing their dream jobs in the maritime sector, this half-hour film presents a reinvigorated maritime industry by focusing on the next generation of workers, innovation and sustainability.
teaserVideo.title: Colours Of The Sea - S1: Colours Of The Sea

tvShows.description: A visually-rich documentary that focuses on the next generation of workers, innovation and sustainability in the maritime sector.
tvShows.title: Colours Of The Sea

tvShows.teaserText:
Our planet is in trouble. Ice caps are melting, islands are drowning, and our weather is out of whack.

But there also appears to be many ways to save it. From cycling to recycling, ditching plastic to embracing electric. In our fight against climate change, we have produced more innovative solutions than ever.

But how much can they help?

Follow host Alex Yue as he travels across Asia to uncover the reality of green solutions - from sustainable fishing in Thailand, to clean coal in China.

teaserVideo.caption: Singaporeans throw out 120kg of used electronics a minute � throwing away some of the world�s scarcest minerals like gold and palladium present in our smartphones. A look at the challenges involved at 1 of the 4 phone battery recycling plants in the world in South Korea; and another plant that dismantles over 150 different TV models for minerals.
teaserVideo.title: Coming Clean About Green - S1: The wasted treasure in e-waste, and why it's tricky to recycle

tvShows.description: Our planet is in trouble. But in our fight against climate change, we have developed more innovative solutions than ever. But how much can they help? Follow host Alex Yue as he travels across Asia to uncover the reality of green solutions.
tvShows.title: Coming Clean About Green

tvShows.teaserText: The pandemic caused many around the world to return home. But in this global village, what does �home� mean? For Singaporeans who have been overseas for an extended period, what does it mean to be Singaporean? When do they feel most Singaporean? This programme tries to answer those questions from the perspectives of 4 Singaporeans and their families who are now in Singapore. Through their stories and experiences, we are reminded of the little things that makes us Singaporean.

teaserVideo.caption: The pandemic caused many around the world to return home. But what does �home� mean? Through the eyes of 4 returning Singaporeans, we are reminded of what it means to be Singaporean.
teaserVideo.title: Coming Home: Stories Of Returning Singaporeans

tvShows.description: The pandemic caused many around the world to return home. But what does �home� mean? Through the eyes of 4 returning Singaporeans, we are reminded of what it means to be Singaporean.
tvShows.title: Coming Home

tvShows.teaserText:
Singapore�s contact tracers give us unprecedented access to their modus operandi as they recount some of their biggest cases in the race to contain the spread of COVID-19. Contact tracers leap into action when the first COVID-19 case arrives from China. They have just 24 hours to track down everyone he has come in contact with on one of the most densely populated islands in the world to prevent the disease from spreading out of control.

Weeks later contact tracers are confounded by a growing cluster of infections at two churches that have no known links to China. The team scramble to uncover the source using state of the art technology and good old-fashioned detective skills. But then contact tracers are confronted by a sudden surge of infections in Singapore. With worrying reports of mutations and of people spreading the virus without ever showing symptoms, the only solution to curbing the pandemic may lie in tracing the virus back to its source � the animal kingdom.

teaserVideo.caption: Contact tracers are confronted by a sudden surge of infections in Singapore.
teaserVideo.title: Contact Tracers - S1E3: Silent Spreaders

tvShows.description: Singapore�s contact tracers give us unprecedented access to their modus operandi as they recount some of their biggest cases in the race to contain the spread of COVID-19.
tvShows.title: Contact Tracers

tvShows.teaserText: It was once a desolate, toxic, uninhabitable wasteland. Today it�s a cool, breathing liveable city. This documentary brings you inside the Tianjin Eco-city to see how this bilateral project between China and Singapore has transformed over the past decade. Home to thousands of families and businesses, it's now setting new standards for modern living in China and beyond. We offer you a sneak peak at some of the life-changing innovations that are shaping the city into a model for sustainable development in China and beyond.

teaserVideo.caption: This documentary brings you inside the Tianjin Eco-City to see how a host of life-changing innovations has transformed this former toxic wasteland into a model city for China and beyond.
teaserVideo.title: Cool Living in an Eco-city: Transforming A Former Wasteland Into Tianjin Eco-City

tvShows.description: This documentary brings you inside the Tianjin Eco-city to see how a host of life-changing innovations has transformed this former toxic wasteland into a model city for China and beyond.
tvShows.title: Cool Living in an Eco-city

tvShows.teaserText: Combining exclusive footage filmed by nurses in isolation wards and interviews with frontliners, this observational documentary tells the story of how a small community hospital in Singapore's heartland supports the country's fight against COVID-19. It follows a team of medical professionals who overcome trials, tribulations and trauma as they lead their patients on the journey to recovery.

teaserVideo.caption: Nestled in a mature estate in the HDB heartlands, Bright Vision Hospital used to be a place providing treatment and care for elderly patients with long-term chronic conditions. Almost overnight, this small community hospital transformed itself into a facility tending to COVID-19 patients.
teaserVideo.title: Corridor of Hope: A Nursing Home's Fight Against COVID-19

tvShows.description: An exclusive look at the trials, tribulations and triumphs of staff at a small community hospital transformed into a COVID-19 care facility.
tvShows.title: Corridor of Hope

tvShows.teaserText: COVID-19 cases have risen globally. Singapore has also seen a jump in locally-transmitted cases in recent weeks. The city's medical and security professionals fearlessly battle an unseen enemy, revealing daily episodes of dedication, sacrifice and courage in an intimate behind-the-scenes reveal of action on the frontlines.

teaserVideo.caption: What is it like to have a loved one on the #COVID19 frontline? These frontline fighters and their families talk about the concerns they face and support they receive.
teaserVideo.title: Courage - S1: How do families of COVID-19 frontline fighters really feel?

tvShows.description: Singapore leaves no stone unturned in the fight against COVID-19. A behind-the-scenes observation of fearless medical and security professionals on the frontlines, battling an unseen enemy.
tvShows.title: Courage

tvShows.teaserText:
School's in session in Asia, with crash courses for students of ALL ages, in ANY subject.

In Beijing, kids learn to "man up" at a boys boot camp designed for those aged 6 and up. All across India, families take crash courses to turn into Bollywood dancers on the wedding day. And in South Korea, there are cram schools to get you into yet another cram school for the civil service. You just have to be committed to study, study, study 24-7.

Do you have 15 hours, 8 days, or one year to make the grade? Then you can also matriculate to be a hip hop entrepreneur, cyber celebrity, or an ancient classics scholar.

From a supposed masculinity crisis, to the virtual realities of online celebrity-hood, to prevailing social mores about gender roles in marriage, find out what each of these crash courses tell us about contemporary Asia, and why one is never too cool for school here.

teaserVideo.caption: Hip hop is making waves in mainstream China. Many are even turning to hip hop academies to learn more than street dancing or fashion, and find out who they really are beyond the classroom.
teaserVideo.title: Cram Course Asia - S1E5: All About Hip Hop

tvShows.description: Learn to �man up� at a Beijing boot camp, become a Bollywood star dancer at your wedding, or enter South Korea�s civil service schools! Asia has crash courses for all students, in any subject!
tvShows.title: Cram Course Asia

tvShows.teaserText:
Can facial recognition stop human trafficking? Has science advanced to the stage when forensic geneticists can accurately pinpoint what a "person of interest" looks like?

Crime Science travels to Singapore, India, and the UAE to explore how technology in its various avatars can help law enforcement agencies prevent, solve and reduce crime. But where do you draw the line between security and privacy? Is digital evidence tamper-proof? How safe are biometric and DNA databases?

Crime Science is also a reality check on the �CSI effect� that projects technology as a magic bullet, giving us an up-to-date view of where technology stands in the fight against crime. With a mix of true-crime investigations, forensics casework, training exercises, and future technologies-on-trial, this non-fiction anthology series goes behind the scenes to capture investigators, scientists, and technologists innovating together, one upgrade at a time.

teaserVideo.caption: Can new forensic technologies solve a sensational murder case? Is smart policing worth the cost of sacrificing privacy? And can isotope hunters stop the proliferation of new, illicit drugs?
teaserVideo.title: Crime Science - S1E3: Murders, Drug Hunters & Smart Cops

tvShows.description: A crime science anthology that explores how technologies like AI, face recognition, 3D printing, and DNA phenotyping are helping law enforcement agencies prevent, solve and reduce crimes worldwide.
tvShows.title: Crime Science

tvShows.teaserText:
Companies, big and small, are spicing up their businesses by finding the right digital tools and solutions.

From software systems to robots, businesses are upping their game to find new customers, improve customer experiences and streamline their operational workflows by utilizing the latest in digital technology.

teaserVideo.caption: To reach new customers, a dim sum eatery opens new outlets based on delivery data. Meanwhile, a traditional TCM chain reinvents itself with a new website and mobile app to attract younger customers.
teaserVideo.title: CTRL+ALT+DEL: A Tech Restart - S1E1: Expanding Customer Base

tvShows.description: From software systems to AR and even robots, businesses are adopting the latest tech tools to up their game.
tvShows.title: CTRL+ALT+DEL: A Tech Restart

tvShows.teaserText:
The internet has connected us, enabled us and empowered us. But, it�s also made us very, very unsafe. It�s only a matter of time till we all get hacked, somehow. Local comedian Fakkah Fuzz, whose life and career revolves around the internet, would have lots to lose. So, he�s headed on a learning journey, to discover how to get smarter with smart technology.

Fuzz learns the �ins and outs� of cybercrime and cyber hygiene. He meets top cybersecurity practitioners, scholars, experts from governments, white-hat hackers, black-hat hackers and just regular people who�ve fallen victim, spectacularly, to cyber breaches.

Fakkah Fuzz hosts this fun and insightful documentary series designed to demystify Cybersecurity �a topic often thought to be too technical, or only �for the nerds�. The two-parter covers a comprehensive span of topics, including encryption, IoT, malware, password cracking and more. Tune in, and help make the internet a safer place for everyone.

teaserVideo.caption: The "Internet of things" has empowered us, and even enriched our lives. But it's also made us more vulnerable to hacks. Comedian Fakkah Fuzz discovers how to get smart when using smart devices.
teaserVideo.title: CyberPunk'D - S1E2: Bits, Bytes And Bugs!

tvShows.description: The best way to not get hacked, is to make it hard for the hacker. Comedian Fakkah Fuzz demystifies cybersecurity, and shows us what we can do to make the internet safer.
tvShows.title: CyberPunk'D
