tvShows.teaserText: Following the historic Trump-Kim Summit in Singapore, the world kept close watch as the reclusive state celebrated its 70th founding anniversary. Beneath the pomp and pageantry, was a new North Korea being presented to the world? Channel NewsAsia�s Olivia Siong was among a select group of foreign journalists invited to cover the event and records her days inside Pyongyang, as she searches for signs of change.

teaserVideo.caption: Beneath the pomp and pageantry of North Korea's 70th birthday celebrations, is a new country being presented to the world? Channel NewsAsia�s Olivia Siong records her days in Pyongyang.
teaserVideo.title: Days in Pyongyang - S1: A Correspondent's Journey

tvShows.description: Beneath the pomp and pageantry of North Korea's 70th birthday celebrations - is a new country being presented to the world? Channel NewsAsia�s Olivia Siong records her days in Pyongyang.
tvShows.title: Days in Pyongyang

tvShows.teaserText: The darkest periods of Singapore�s history were when politics and race tore communities apart; when trade unions brought the economy to a standstill; where saboteurs were bent on making this country fail; and terrorism reared its ugly head. The days of rage were dark days then, but they also helped to strengthen the country�s core beliefs, and make it the nation it is today. This series brings to the fore events and challenges in Singapore�s history and the lessons learnt.

teaserVideo.caption: Singapore is on the front line of an undeclared war with Indonesia. During the 1960s, the island endured bullets, bombs and bloodshed - climaxing in the bombing of MacDonald House on 10th March 1965.
teaserVideo.title: Days Of Rage - S1: Konfrontasi

tvShows.description: The darkest periods of Singapore�s history retold through re-enactments, interviews with the people who were involved, and analysis
tvShows.title: Days Of Rage

tvShows.teaserText: Award-winning journalist and author Anjan Sundaram comes out of war-torn Africa and sets his sights on India. Though born in India, Anjan has not lived there for more than 15 years. The India of his childhood has changed, there is stormy upheaval of the established order while issues like religion, caste, identity and even food have all become politicized weapons. With the backdrop of this changing tide, Anjan travels all corners of the country to unravel contentious issues like a skillful bomb disposer. Each episode of �Deciphering India� is dedicated to a complex topic that Anjan navigates by entering into the world of spiritual gurus, sacred cows, patriarchy and even Indian identity. Using his scalpel sharp analysis and disabling humor, Anjan is determined to get to the bottom of the truth and decipher what the country is thinking, feeling, expressing.

teaserVideo.caption: The Indian republic seems to be a remote concept in some parts of the country. In this episode Anjan travels across India to understand the concept of being Indian by meeting, erstwhile Kings, Separatists and head-hunting tribes who are redefining what it means to be Indian.
teaserVideo.title: Deciphering India - S1E4: Identity

tvShows.description: In 'Deciphering India' award-winning journalist Anjan Sundaram heads into the minefield of some of the most contentious issues of India.
tvShows.title: Deciphering India

tvShows.teaserText: For years, news anchor Cheryl Marella has reported on Indonesia from the studios and seen her birth country go through dramatic change. Now, she heads into the field to explore hot-button issues affecting contemporary Indonesia. With the largest economy in Southeast Asia and one of the strongest emerging markets worldwide, Indonesia stands as a nation in flux - where identity, the economy, politics and technology collide and converge. Channel NewsAsia�s Deciphering Indonesia travels the lengths and breadths of the world�s largest archipelagic country to discover what affects its politics and society, and uncover the issues that define the world�s fourth most populous nation. In each episode, Cheryl tackles a complex topic by speaking with the players driving this change. Harnessing her investigative prowess and a disarming smile, Cheryl leads us on a road trip to dig deep, and decipher what Indonesia is thinking, feeling and expressing.

teaserVideo.caption: Proposed amendments to Indonesia�s criminal code are polarizing the country. In this episode, Cheryl Marella explores how a new brand of conservatism is testing the nation�s tolerant way of life.
teaserVideo.title: Deciphering Indonesia - S1E1: Test Of Tolerance

tvShows.description: Cheryl Marella travels across Indonesia to explore how rising intolerance, living in the Ring of Fire, a digital revolution, and growing religiosity, are disrupting all spheres of Indonesian life.
tvShows.title: Deciphering Indonesia

tvShows.teaserText: Journalist Yumi Araki explores her home country as it enters an era of great social and political transformation. She explores the hot-button issues that have both galvanised and polarised the nation, and meets the people at the forefront of change. In the first episode, Yumi meets the women who are re-defining their roles in Japan's patriarchal society, and the men forced to re-orientate themselves in this new social order. In episode two, Yumi dives into the country's extreme work culture, visiting obsessive farmers, overworked salarymen and the therapists trying to keep them sane. Next, Yumi visits hip hop dancing grannies and other members of the nation's sunset generation to find out how this fast-ageing country is coping with unprecedented demographic change. In the final episode, Yumi hangs out with bartending Buddhist monks, psychedelic pop artists, and shunned biracial communities to explore a national identity in flux and to decipher what it means to be Japanese today.

teaserVideo.caption: Japan has always had a strong sense of national identity. Washington-based journalist Yumi Araki returns to the country of her birth to get at the heart of what it means to be Japanese today. As the country moves into a new era, some are seeking to redefine it, from the new wave of mixed race young people, to the leader of a radical ultranationalistic political party.
teaserVideo.title: Deciphering Japan - S1E4: Being Japanese

tvShows.description: Journalist Yumi Araki returns to Japan as it enters a new era. She explores the issues that have both galvanised and polarised the nation, and meets the people at the forefront of change.
tvShows.title: Deciphering Japan

tvShows.teaserText:
South Korean pop culture has grown to become a major driver of global culture, along with its blockbuster dramas and skincare products. Yet, how much do we really know about the country, its people, their passions, and their peeves?

Joi visits her motherland to understand what it takes to keep this country pulsating as it gains global adoration in recent years. She explores what is driving this success and the price South Koreans are paying for it.

teaserVideo.caption: Journalist Joi Lee gets a glimpse into our future by meeting the people who are impacting South Korea�s culture and society with tech.
teaserVideo.title: Deciphering South Korea - S1E4: Wired Nation

tvShows.description: CNA�s award-winning Deciphering series goes on an epic journey across South Korea with Journalist and Presenter, Joi Lee, to explore its unique style and affable charm.
tvShows.title: Deciphering South Korea

tvShows.teaserText: Filipino journalist Atom Araullo has reported from some of the most extreme corners of the Philippines. This time, he heads out to find a nation going through extraordinary change. From the rise of extrajudicial killings to gun-toting priests, from the obsession with beauty queens to the divisions caused by a president accused of being a misogynist, our intrepid host criss-crosses this expansive archipelago to uncover the hot button issues affecting and defining the Philippines today. In each episode, Atom navigates the complex topics of faith, gun culture, land, and women in the Duterte era - by going deep into the worlds of those driving and living with the political, social and cultural upheavals in his country.

teaserVideo.caption: Filipinos are deeply connected to the land they live on. Atom Araullo meets with natural disaster survivors and armed rebel groups to explore how this archipelago has defined the Filipino way of life.
teaserVideo.title: Deciphering The Philippines - S1E4: This Land Is My Land

tvShows.description: Atom Araullo explores the complexities of faith, gun culture, land, and women in the era of Duterte to make sense of the political and social upheavals affecting the Philippines.
tvShows.title: Deciphering The Philippines

tvShows.teaserText:
Sailor-presenter Darren Lim voyages to uncover the maritime destiny of Singapore. He learns how a dangerous harbour became a world-leading port, dives into maritime security and explores emerging trade routes that could bypass Singapore.

The documentary compares imminent world changes with parallel historic milestones.

Darren first learns how Singapore transformed from a perilous shipraiding hub to a modern free port. He discovers how the republic secures its seas from terrorism and threats with naval cooperation and international law.

He compares the historic impact of the Suez Canal with the potential of a Thai Kra Canal. He meets Thai activists keen to study and develop this trade shortcut.

With port pioneers, Darren visits key moments that made Singapore the world's busiest container port and ambitious new plans to build a highly-automated future megaport.

Darren unearths how global warming opens a new arctic sea route that could divert trade away from Singapore.

teaserVideo.caption: Sail with presenter Darren Lim on a voyage to uncover the maritime destiny of Singapore. He learns how a dangerous harbour became a world-leading port, dives into maritime security and explores new trade routes that could bypass Singapore.
teaserVideo.title: Destiny of a Maritime Nation - S1: Destiny of a Maritime Nation

tvShows.description: Sail with presenter Darren Lim on a voyage to uncover the maritime destiny of Singapore. He learns how a dangerous harbour became a world-leading port, dives into maritime security and explores new trade routes that could bypass Singapore.
tvShows.title: Destiny of a Maritime Nation

tvShows.teaserText: What may bring the next pandemic? This 3-part series features �Disease Hunters� on the frontlines as they identify, study or kill infectious diseases, vectors and microbes. It stars leading scientists from Thailand, Singapore, Cambodia, Japan, Philippines, Iceland, India, UK and USA, and highlights international collaboration and data-sharing as scientists seek to keep pace with potential pathogens. The series also connects today�s outbreaks with historical epidemics and explores factors that may accelerate future outbreaks like human-animal interactions, drug resistance, climate change, urbanisation and globalisation. Through cinematic medical animations, it shows the unseen operations of viruses, bacteria and mosquito-borne diseases, vaccines, antibiotics, bacteriophages and monoclonal antibodies. Diseases discussed include COVID-19 coronavirus, influenza, H1N1 swine flu, polio, superbugs, tuberculosis, malaria and dengue.

teaserVideo.caption: Mosquito-borne diseases such as Zika, Chikungunya and dengue kill over a million people each year, making mosquitoes the world�s deadliest creatures. Among the most dangerous species of mosquito is the Aedes aegypti, carrier of viruses that cause dengue and yellow fever.
teaserVideo.title: Disease Hunters - S1: Why are deadly mosquitoes invading the US?

tvShows.description: What may bring the next pandemic? Will new diseases crossover from animals or will an age-old plague reinvent itself? Meet the disease hunters - scientists & citizens racing to stop the next outbreak.
tvShows.title: Disease Hunters

tvShows.teaserText: In a system where academic success matters, what happens if you fail your Primary School Leaving Examinations? �Don�t Call Us Beaten� captures life in two schools that offer these kids a second chance. Over one term, we chart their struggles and triumphs with teachers who won�t be beaten by failure.

teaserVideo.caption: In the final episode, reality bites as our students face the challenges of the working world. They are on internships, where each mistake has real costs. Sin Ziyue works in a cafe but she's painfully shy, while apprentice baker Faisleena races against time to fulfil a crucial customer order.
teaserVideo.title: Don't Call Us Beaten - S1E5: Reality Bites

tvShows.description: In a system where academic success matters, what happens if you fail your Primary School Leaving Examinations? �Don�t Call Us Beaten� captures life in two schools that offer these kids a second chance.
tvShows.title: Don't Call Us Beaten

tvShows.teaserText: Don't Call Us Poor is a ground-breaking series on low-income families in Singapore. Over 4 months, 5 families in Bukit Merah allowed cameras into their lives, giving fly-on-the-wall access as they navigate the ups and downs of life on social assistance.

teaserVideo.caption: Life deals our families an unexpected twist in the final episode of Don't Call Us Poor. Maslinda runs out of milk powder, and Chew Peng Wah suffers a stroke on the cusp of a new job. How will they find a way out?
teaserVideo.title: Don't Call Us Poor - S1E5: Unexpected Crises

tvShows.description: Don't Call Us Poor is a ground-breaking series on low-income families in Singapore. Over 4-months, 5-families in Bukit Merah invited cameras into their lives, allowing fly-on-the-wall access as they navigate the ups and downs of life on social assistance.
tvShows.title: Don't Call Us Poor

tvShows.teaserText:
You see them every day.

The bus driver on your commute to work� the cleaner in your office� the construction workers labouring away. Seemingly unimportant guys with seemingly simple professions.

But do you really see them?

What does it take to do the work they do? Do they ever get bored? Do they ever wish for anything else? And what if they didn�t exist� what would our lives be like?

Many of these crucial individuals are more often not, the most invisible in our society. In this ambitious series, we tackle social invisibility by telling their stories. We spend time with them in and outside of work, meet their families, and reveal the life behind the job.

teaserVideo.caption: Bus driver, Benjamin, dreams of driving up interest in the job, while restaurant manager, Saravannan, faces his final day in a role he loves. In the final episode, our invisible heroes reveal their ambitions for the future.
teaserVideo.title: Don't Make Us Invisible - S1E5: My Ambition

tvShows.description: The bus driver on your commute to work, the cleaner in your office, the construction workers labouring away at their sites. Do you see them? The show tells the stories of some of the most crucial, but most invisible, members of Singapore�s society.
tvShows.title: Don't Make Us Invisible

tvShows.teaserText: High-rise housing may dominate Singapore�s skyline, but its homes have traditionally been more grounded. Dream Spaces brings you access to these remarkable properties, retracing their origins and transformation. Each episode explores a housing type and living ideal � the shophouse, the kampong house, the black and white bungalow, historic mansions as well as multi-generational living � to learn how they have been transformed for modern lifestyles, and continue to influence the shape and form of the Singapore house today.

teaserVideo.caption: A 1920s shophouse in Balestier is updated with contemporary furniture and interiors inspired by the neighbourhood�s vibrant history.
teaserVideo.title: Dream Spaces - S1: Dream Spaces: Breathing New Life Into A Shophouse

tvShows.description: From the humble shophouse to grand black and white bungalows, Dream Spaces brings you access to some of these remarkable properties, retracing the origins and transformation of the Singapore house.
tvShows.title: Dream Spaces

tvShows.teaserText: Local innovator Lim Seng wants to send the first Singaporean to the edge of space. Pilot Yip Chuang Xin wants to be the man. Together with a team of engineers, pilots, family, and volunteers, they build a spacecraft from scratch and launched multiple unmanned test flights, embarking on a daring mission that has lasted 6 years� and beyond. They have failed before, but they are giving their dream one more chance. Will they succeed this time?

teaserVideo.caption: Innovator Lim Seng wants to send the first Singaporean to the edge of space. Pilot Yip Chuang Xin wants to be the man. It's not their first attempt. Will they succeed this time?
teaserVideo.title: Edge of Space: The Quest Continues

tvShows.description: Innovator Lim Seng wants to send the first Singaporean to the edge of space. Pilot Yip Chuang Xin wants to be the man. It�s not their first attempt. Will they succeed this time?
tvShows.title: Edge of Space

tvShows.teaserText: Edible Wild is back for a second season - join culinary anthropologist, Nithiya Laila, as she picks, catches and digs her way through Hong Kong, Japan, Korea, China, Thailand and Indonesia - for some very surprising ingredients. From burrowing crabs in Guangzhou, to mysterious edible fungi in Seoul, and fishy-smelling tea leaves Taipei, Nithiya finds out foraging is not just a hobby, it is a passion - and a way of life. And it brings a fundamentally different attitude to food and the eco-system. In her journeys, Nithiya will be joined by local experts whose knowledge of the native treats will prove invaluable as she cooks up tasty dishes with her foraged items.

teaserVideo.caption: A city surrounded by seven mountains, Seoul provides the setting for Edible Wild's wildest foraging yet. Our steep climbs are rewarded by wonderful finds, including rare and expensive mushrooms, and the perfect ingredients to make homemade rice wine.
teaserVideo.title: Edible Wild - S2E8: Seoul

tvShows.description: Join culinary anthropologist, Nithiya Laila, as she picks, catches and digs her way through some of Asia's biggest cities for nature's most surprising ingredients. She will be joined by local experts sharing their knowledge on native treats, as she cooks up dishes with her foraged items.
tvShows.title: Edible Wild

tvShows.teaserText: A Singapore start-up charts into improbable territory as it aims to produce state-of-the-art vehicles for an electric future. Follow Vanda Electrics as they navigate the trials and tribulations of building one of the world�s fastest fully-electric hypercars, the Dendrobium. Supported by Williams Advanced Engineering, the Dendrobium makes an international splash with her debut at the Geneva Motor Show. But while the launch is a success, Vanda Electrics is beset with challenges from that point on. Lack of investment, changing regulations and unexpected weather events threaten to derail plans for the super car, as well as the company's other offerings - an electric scooter called the Motochimp and an electric logistics vehicle called the Ant Truck. Can Vanda Electrics overcome these roadblocks and help usher in a clean, zero-emissions future?

teaserVideo.caption: A Singapore start-up wants to build futuristic electric vehicles. As they navigate the trials and tribulations of producing one of the world's fastest fully-electric hyper-car, mounting challenges and lack of investment put the company under severe pressure. Can they achieve their electric dream?
teaserVideo.title: Electric Dream - S1: Electric Dream

tvShows.description: A Singapore start-up wants to build futuristic electric vehicles. As they navigate the trials and tribulations of producing one of the world's fastest fully-electric hyper-car, mounting challenges and lack of investment put the company under severe pressure. Can they achieve their electric dream?
tvShows.title: Electric Dream

tvShows.teaserText: Enemy Within is a two-part documentary series filmed from the front line of the war in Afghanistan. From Kabul to Ghazni, Channel NewsAsia obtained rare access into Taliban badlands to understand why the Taliban are gaining control of more territory 18 years since America invaded the country. On this journey, we embed with the Afghanistan Army on an operation against the Taliban and and investigate why they are fast losing soldiers to conflict and attrition. We also meet brave journalists and artistes who continue to fight for peace. Along the way, we speak to key stakeholders like former President Hamid Karzai who unveils his solution for a democratic, peaceful Afghanistan. But is this too little, too late, for a country that has failed to protect thousands of lives that have already been lost in a conflict that continues to get worse with every passing day?

teaserVideo.caption: The Battle For Kabul documents the fight between a struggling Afghan government in the face of a resurgent Taliban. Can they win the war militarily, or could dialogue be the solution?
teaserVideo.title: Enemy Within - S1E2: The Battle For Kabul

tvShows.description: Enemy Within takes us deep inside Afghanistan on a journey to investigate how and why the Afghanistan government may lose their battle in the face of a resurgent Taliban offensive.
tvShows.title: Enemy Within

tvShows.teaserText:
Today, Singaporean women can choose to climb corporate ladders, be full-time mums or even conquer the world�s steepest summits.

These achievements are a result of a collective crusade led by a series of extraordinary women in the 19th and 20th centuries.

Missionary Maria Dyer starts the first all-girls school to save the �Mui Tsai", or indentured Chinese servant girls. Post World War II, cabaret dancers band together to start a free school and lobby for tax concessions for members of their profession. Mrs George Lee and Shirin Fozdar campaign successfully to ban polygamy. By the late 1950s, Chan Choy Siong and Hoe Puay Choo become the first women in the Singapore electorate. In 1961, the Women�s Charter is passed, securing equal rights for every woman.

teaserVideo.caption: A crusade led by fearless women in the 19th and 20th centuries leads to empowered choices, voices and rights for every woman in Singapore.
teaserVideo.title: Every Woman - S1: Stories of Trailblazing Heroines

tvShows.description: A crusade led by fearless women in the 19th and 20th centuries leads to empowered choices, voices and rights for every woman in Singapore.
tvShows.title: Every Woman

tvShows.teaserText: Facing Dementia looks at one of the most pressing social and medical issues of our time. By 2030, some 90,000 Singaporeans are projected to have dementia. This series covers various aspects from diagnosis to caregiving to treatments, and debunks some misconceptions about the condition.

teaserVideo.caption: The number of people at risk of dementia is projected to rise dramatically in Singapore, due to its rapidly ageing population. Are we prepared? What hurdles must we overcome?
teaserVideo.title: Facing Dementia - S1E5: What The Future Holds

tvShows.description: Facing Dementia looks at one of the most pressing social and medical issues of our time. By 2030, some 90,000 Singaporeans are projected to have dementia. This series covers various aspects from diagnosis to caregiving to treatments, and debunks some misconceptions about the condition.
tvShows.title: Facing Dementia

tvShows.teaserText: Depression will become the leading cause of disability worldwide by 2020. And in Singapore, one in fifteen people will have depression at least once in their lifetime. What exactly is depression? People do feel sad occasionally, but such feelings are temporary. This is unlike clinical depression, which is a prolonged feeling of intense sadness, accompanied by a sense of hopelessness, social withdrawal and at times, may drive one to self-harm and suicide. Depression has the ability to destroy a person�s physical and mental health if left untreated. In this 4-part series, Facing Depression gains access to patients undergoing treatment and those who have recovered. They share their struggles, hopes and fears as they battle this invisible morbidity.

teaserVideo.caption: Depression among elderlies is on the rise in Singapore. Meet an octogenarian who suffers from dementia-induced mood swings, and a 70 year-old man who couldn�t get over the death of his spouse. How can one find meaning and stay positive in their silver years?
teaserVideo.title: Facing Depression - S1E4: An Elderly's Perspective

tvShows.description: Depression will become the leading cause of disability worldwide by 2020. And in Singapore, one in fifteen people will have depression at least once in their lifetime. What are the signs and who are susceptible? This series gains access to people undergoing treatment; with their struggles and hopes.
tvShows.title: Facing Depression

tvShows.teaserText: ISIS may be losing ground in the Middle East. But its call for Muslims in Southeast Asia to wage holy war in Marawi has been echoed by Al-Qaeda, for Muslims to take up arms on behalf of the Rohingyas. And a number from the region have responded. In Singapore, self-radicalised individuals may not be many but there are signs that there is a trust deficit between religious groups and a danger that prejudice could grow. CNA correspondent Sujadi Siswo speaks to religious leaders, experts and those who had previously fallen for extremist rhetoric to learn more about the threats, to the region and to our home; what causes people to be influenced by extremist points of view, and what can be done to mitigate that influence.

teaserVideo.caption: Global terror groups are training their sights on Southeast Asia, with calls being made for Muslims to take up arms and fight in Marawi and Rakhine. A number from the region have responded. Why are people falling for extremist rhetoric? What can be done to face the threats? Sujadi Siswo finds out.
teaserVideo.title: Facing Terror - S1: Facing Terror

tvShows.description: Global terror groups are training their sights on Southeast Asia, with calls being made for Muslims to take up arms and fight in Marawi and Rakhine. A number from the region have responded. Why are people falling for extremist rhetoric? What can be done to face the threats? Sujadi Siswo finds out.
tvShows.title: Facing Terror

tvShows.teaserText:
Ever wondered what it's like inside some of Singapore's factories? This special feature documentary looks at cutting-edge products designed and manufactured in the city-state that will impact the way people live, work, and eat.

With exclusive access to factories across the island, delve into the minds of engineers who are tackling global challenges through innovative solutions. From building the world's tallest prefabricated building in a factory to developing the country's first electric motorcycle, discover how Singapore's factories are making the future.

teaserVideo.caption: Journey through Singapore�s factories and discover how they are shaping the future and changing our lives - all the way from the food we love to the houses we call home.
teaserVideo.title: Factories: Making The Future: Inside Singapore's Factories

tvShows.description: Journey through Singapore�s factories and discover how they are shaping the future and changing our lives - all the way from the food we love to the houses we call home.
tvShows.title: Factories: Making The Future

tvShows.teaserText: At times of crisis, people often turn to faith for strength and hope. This was true during COVID-19, as the way people worshipped had to be significantly altered, even during major festivals. This documentary, filmed in part by the story�s characters, offers an intimate account of how religion was practiced under safe distancing measures. Devotees and elders from Singapore�s 10 most practiced faiths tell of how they adapted and built on the foundations of their faith to serve themselves and society as a whole.

teaserVideo.caption: Elders and devotees from 10 faiths in Singapore adapt to new ways of worship during the COVID-19 pandemic. In the process, they find new meaning in their faith in a time of crisis.
teaserVideo.title: Faith Over Fear: Religion In A Time Of COVID-19

tvShows.description: Elders and devotees from 10 faiths in Singapore adapt to new ways of worship during the COVID-19 pandemic. In the process, they find new meaning in their faith in a time of crisis.
tvShows.title: Faith Over Fear

tvShows.teaserText: Fake news may not be new but it has certainly been claiming the headlines in recent years. And much has been said about how social media has assisted in its rise. Over time, information has even been weaponised and fake news now can be a threat against national security. Many governments have recognised the need to come up with legislation and safeguards to combat fake news. In Singapore, a Select Committee has been formed and it will hear from interested parties, both local and international. We bring you highlights from the public hearings.

teaserVideo.caption: Fake news has been claiming the headlines in recent years. Many governments see the need for legislation to combat its effects. In Singapore, a Select Committee has been formed and it will hear from interested parties. We bring you the highlights.
teaserVideo.title: Fake News - S1: Highlights From The Select Committee Hearings

tvShows.description: Fake news has been claiming the headlines in recent years. Many governments see the need for legislation to combat its effects. In Singapore, a Select Committee has been formed and it will hear from interested parties. We bring you the highlights.
tvShows.title: Fake News

tvShows.teaserText:
When a global pandemic hits a culinary paradise, an island-nation must confront a serious issue. How will Singapore grow and sustain its food supply into the future?

Feeding A City looks at how a diverse group of food warriors: scientists, farmers, entrepreneurs and policymakers are coming together to find solutions to expand Singapore's fight for food resilience. We traverse farmlands, go inside factories, visit importers and tackle food waste to bring the big picture of Singapore's food story. What does it take to keep a city of 5.6 million fed?

teaserVideo.caption: During COVID-19, tons and tons of staple foods like eggs, milk and fresh vegetables were thrown away or destroyed. See how a complex and interconnected global food supply chain led to this catastrophic problem.
teaserVideo.title: Feeding A City - S1: Why Tons Of Food Were Dumped During The Covid-19 Pandemic

tvShows.description: Feeding A City looks at Singapore's fight for food security amidst a global pandemic. Find out how scientists, farmers, entrepreneurs and policymakers are creating a more sustainable food future.
tvShows.title: Feeding A City

tvShows.teaserText: On 1st April 2019, the proposed Protection from Online Falsehoods and Manipulation Act (POFMA) was tabled in Parliament. Since then, there have been many questions about it. The Singapore Law Minister, Mr K Shanmugam, explains the intent and thinking behind the proposed Protection from Online Falsehoods and Manipulation Act (POFMA), and answers some tough questions on CNA.

teaserVideo.caption: The Singapore Law Minister explains the intent and thinking behind the Protection from Online Falsehoods and Manipulation Act (POFMA), and answers tough questions on CNA.
teaserVideo.title: Fighting Fake News: An Interview With Singapore Law Minister K Shanmugam

tvShows.description: The Singapore Law Minister explains the intent and thinking behind the proposed Protection from Online Falsehoods and Manipulation Act (POFMA), and answers some tough questions on CNA.
tvShows.title: Fighting Fake News

tvShows.teaserText: With the tabling of the Protection from Online Falsehood and Manipulation (POFMA) Bill, there has been some concerns and confusion over how the bill will affect publishers, platforms and people. This 30-minutes special seeks to analyze the various discussions and debates that have come out since the bill was tabled.

teaserVideo.caption: From bloggers to consumers, what does the Protection from Online Falsehoods and Manipulation Bill mean for you?
teaserVideo.title: Fighting Falsehoods - S1: Understanding POFMA

tvShows.description: With the tabling of the Protection from Online Falsehood and Manipulation (POFMA) Bill, there has been some concerns and confusion over how the bill will affect publishers, platforms and people. This 30-minutes special seeks to analyze the various discussions and debates that have come out since the bill was tabled.
tvShows.title: Fighting Falsehoods

tvShows.teaserText: Singapore's people and companies are seeking opportunities abroad in exciting new frontiers. And it's not just for business. Finding Singapore is a 2-part documentary series that examines the work of Singaporean outfits in India and Rwanda and its potential impact to millions there.

teaserVideo.caption: Rwanda, a nation which witnessed the horrifying genocide of 1994. 20 years on, it is shedding its past and surging forward economically and socially. Find out how the Singapore brand and Singaporeans' expertise in governance, education, urban planning, and entrepreneurship have played a part.
teaserVideo.title: Finding Singapore - S2E2: Rwanda

tvShows.description: Singapore's people and companies are seeking opportunities abroad in exciting new frontiers. And it's not just for business. Finding Singapore is a 2-part documentary series that examines the work of Singaporean outfits in India and Rwanda and its potential impact to millions there.
tvShows.title: Finding Singapore

tvShows.teaserText: Singapore is witnessing a gastronomic explosion. In the recently-announced Michelin Guide Singapore, Singapore's home-grown culinary masters took coveted spots on the list. In this lovingly-shot series, we find out how some of our most innovative chefs and restaurateurs are working their magic.

teaserVideo.caption: He heads a restaurant voted one of 10 Restaurants in the World Worth a Plane Ride. How does chef Andre Chiang innovate consistently? And what are the pressures behind running the third-placed restaurant in Asia?
teaserVideo.title: Food Heroes - S1E8: Andre Chiang, Restaurant Andre

tvShows.description: Singapore is witnessing a gastronomic explosion. In the recently-announced Michelin Guide Singapore, Singapore's home-grown culinary masters took coveted spots on the list. In this lovingly-shot series, we find out how some of our most innovative chefs and restaurateurs are working their magic.
tvShows.title: Food Heroes

tvShows.teaserText:
Cooking is Andre Chiang's life purpose, but he is hungry for more. He embarks on a culinary exploration, across 4 continents and 8 countries, to seek a deeper meaning of food and unearth the forces that shape how we eat, in this 3-part series.
In his first destination Oymyakon, the coldest inhabited place on Earth, Andre discovers a whole new culinary culture born out of human resilience. Andre meets Michelin starred chef Virgilio Martinez, who is passionate in uncovering Peruvian ingredients across different altitudes. Here, Andre deeply comprehends how a plate of food enshrines a remnant of a country's history and tradition.
Lastly, Andre examines what defines the future of food, he meets up with the mercurial Italian chef - Massimo Bottura who actively seeks to address hunger and food waste in his pursuit. And through French food scientist Prof Herve This, Andre experience how culinary activities are experienced at the scientific level and takes a glimpse at the future of food.

teaserVideo.caption: With an average of -50 degrees Celsius in winter, frostbite can set upon an unprotected face in mere seconds. Andre discovers how the Yakut people live and eat in such extreme conditions.
teaserVideo.title: Food In Our Time - S1E3: Legacy

tvShows.description: Chef Andre Chiang embarks on a culinary exploration, across 4 continents and 8 countries, to seek a deeper meaning of food and unearth the forces that shape how we eat, in this 3-part TV series.
tvShows.title: Food In Our Time

tvShows.teaserText: COVID-19 is the worst crisis to hit the global food system: farmers saw their produce left to rot, shortages sparked panic buying in the supermarkets, and thousands of restaurants closed for good. While the food disruptions have eased, COVID-19 has woken us up to the many things that are wrong with how our food is brought from farm to fork. With his own restaurant business on the line, Chef Ming Tan goes on a mission to find out what needs to change, and uncovers a system ripe for a shake-up.

teaserVideo.title: For Food's Sake! - S3: Young people in Malaysia protest delay in plans to lower voting age | Video

tvShows.description: Food disruptions triggered by COVID-19 spur Chef Ming Tan to go on a mission to find out what's wrong with the way we feed ourselves and uncovers a system ripe for a shake-up from farm to fork.
tvShows.title: For Food's Sake!

tvShows.teaserText:
On October 13, 2016, Thailand�s King Bhumibol Adulyadej passed away at the age of 88. A year of mourning was declared for the world�s longest-reigning monarch, the end of which will be marked by his final funeral rites, held over five days.

We go behind the scenes as Thailand makes ready for one of the most lavish and extensive state funerals to be held in the modern day. In the centre of old Bangkok, an engineer works on the royal crematorium�a depiction of heaven that looms over 50m, and the tallest built in a hundred years. Members of the royal family prepare for their role in the funeral procession as troops practise the ceremonial drawing of a 222-year-old royal chariot. Sculptors work to bring a mythical Buddhist mountain to life as traditional khon dancers practise for the performance of their lives. Over a year, we witness their personal challenges as they prepare to bid a final farewell to their beloved king.
tvShows.description: On October 13, 2016, Thailand�s King Bhumibol Adulyadej passed away at the age of 88. A year of mourning was declared for the world�s longest-reigning monarch, the end of which will be marked by his final funeral rites, held over five days.
tvShows.title: For The King

tvShows.teaserText: The legacy of the Japanese Occupation of Singapore still resonates today. But what of those from the island who fought on battlefields thousands of miles from home? Forgotten Heroes follows the stories of four courageous individuals from Singapore who found themselves in far-flung theatres of war. From the blood-soaked beaches of Northern France to the icy waters of the North Atlantic Ocean, from the violent skies over southern China to the brutalities of a Japanese POW camp in Java, this documentary recounts the incredible true stories of Singaporeans who lived through turbulent times. Forgotten Heroes features an interview with one of the world's last remaining �Flying Tigers�, along with moving testimonies from our heroes� families and leading WW2 experts. Stylish cinematography and bold animation bring these daring wartime stories to life.

teaserVideo.caption: Singapore�s Japanese Occupation still resonates today. But what of those who fought battles thousands of miles from home? True stories of Singaporeans in combat across Europe and Asia.
teaserVideo.title: Forgotten Heroes: Fighting World War II Abroad

tvShows.description: Singapore�s Japanese Occupation still resonates today. But what of those who fought battles thousands of miles from home? Tales of heroism from Singaporean pilots and sailors in combat overseas.
tvShows.title: Forgotten Heroes

tvShows.teaserText:
After a year-long battle against COVID-19, we look back at how Singaporeans adapted and fast-tracked new ideas.

Go beyond the blueprints of homegrown technologies, borne out of the pandemic, and meet thinkers and tinkerers who worked hard to devise smart solutions that helped Singaporeans mitigate challenges created by the health crisis.

From enhanced contact tracing tools and accelerated virus testing, to the digitalisation of essential services, we examine how this new turbocharged pace of technology adoption, has inspired radical and irreversible changes in the way we live, work and learn.

teaserVideo.caption: One year into the pandemic, we look back at how Singapore adapted and fast-tracked new ideas. Get the lowdown on local thinkers and technologies that helped the country during the COVID-19 crisis.
teaserVideo.title: From Crisis To Catalyst: Innovations Amid COVID-19

tvShows.description: One year into the pandemic, we look back at how Singapore adapted and fast-tracked new ideas. Get the lowdown on local thinkers and technologies that helped the country during the COVID-19 crisis.
tvShows.title: From Crisis To Catalyst

tvShows.teaserText: Discover how Singapore�s architects and futurists plan to radically transform the city in response to the daunting challenges it faces of a rapidly growing population, and accelerating climate change. Singaporeans future will be one of living high in the sky, on the sea or possibly in space?

teaserVideo.caption: The second episode of Futuropolis journeys out to sea. By 2065 the waters surrounding the island may be dramatically transformed. Living on the sea in floating communities might be commonplace and growing massive crops of food and generating power may be pivotal to Singapore's survival.
teaserVideo.title: Futuropolis - S1E2: Keeping Afloat

tvShows.description: Discover how Singapore�s architects and futurists plan to radically transform the city in response to the daunting challenges it faces of a rapidly growing population, and accelerating climate change.
tvShows.title: Futuropolis

tvShows.teaserText:
Preston Lim, GovTech computer scientist and self-confessed geek, is back at it again, and on a mission to use tech to bring meaningful changes to people�s lives.

Technology has changed our world, made it more efficient, productive and borderless. But has it done enough in empowering those with disabilities and mental conditions?

In this series, Preston goes on a search for all kinds of science and tech - from connected smart homes and intuitive wearable devices, to humanised chatbots that bring cheer and comfort - to look for tech that can help empower those struggling with autism, dementia, depression and physical disabilities.

teaserVideo.caption: He's able to pick up languages like Russian, German and even the Jawi alphabet; to recognise lift brands like Otis and Kone immediately - and he's on the autism spectrum. While his condition could be viewed as his superpower, the flip side means that he struggles to perform simple tasks, like crossing the road, without the guidance of his parents. *2:36: Family photos should be credited to KC Wong
teaserVideo.title: Gadg(AID) - S1: What's the future for our Autistic son?

tvShows.description: Computer scientist Preston Lim hunts for tech to empower those who are disabled - from connected smart homes and intuitive wearable devices, to humanised chatbots that bring cheer and comfort.
tvShows.title: Gadg(AID)

tvShows.teaserText: This 5-part series is about business people who have revolutionized the way things are done in order to survive in this new economy. They all face the same conundrum - reinvent or die. In the face of the crisis, they create a new trend and change the face of the industry.

teaserVideo.caption: Without prior experience, a local entrepreneur is turning the logistics industry upside down. Together with a troop of tech-savvy staff, Ninja Van CEO Lai Chang Wen attempts to build service quality into the courier business. He claims to have changed the way parcels arrive at your door step.
teaserVideo.title: Game Changers Singapore - S1E5: Lai Chang Wen

tvShows.description: This 5-part series is about business people who revolutionize the way things are done in order to survive in this new economy. They all face the same conundrum - reinvent, or die. In the face of the crisis, they create a new trend, and change the face of the industry.
tvShows.title: Game Changers Singapore

tvShows.teaserText:
Meet six of Singapore�s most promising eSports players as they shatter stereotypes with their passion and gumption.

GAME NATION goes behind-the scenes for an exclusive look at what it takes to be part of this booming eSports industry, estimated at more than SG$1 billion. Investors, industry experts and supporters provide perspectives and context to eSports� incredible potential, and why it is a vital part of Singapore�s sporting future.

teaserVideo.caption: Lysander is one of Singapore�s shoutcasters. A shoutcaster takes you through the game, the action and tells you what to be excited about and why it's so exciting. After shoutcasting in Seattle for one of the biggest game titles, Lysander is now working with GYM.GG hoping to build something that all Singaporeans can be proud of.
teaserVideo.title: Game Nation: The Pro Shoutcaster: Lysander Xonora

tvShows.description: This is a sport that does not play by traditional rules. And it�s a multi-billion dollar industry. These are the cyber gladiators leading the charge as Singapore takes on the biggest eSports players.
tvShows.title: Game Nation

tvShows.teaserText: With an uncertain economy in Singapore, intrepid entrepreneurs are searching for new pastures overseas, and sometimes in the most unlikely of places. This series follows the trials and triumphs of 5 Singaporeans who are risking it all to set up businesses overseas.

teaserVideo.caption: An architect with a Master�s in business, now farmer. Driven by her desire to offer local farmers a solution to poor harvest caused by harsh weather conditions, Renee relocated to Kazakhstan to manage the country�s first aquaponics greenhouse. Will Renee successfully simulate the optimum conditions for crop growth?
teaserVideo.title: Going Places - S1E5: Renee How

tvShows.description: This series follows the trials and triumphs of 5 Singaporeans who are risking it all to set up businesses overseas.
tvShows.title: Going Places

tvShows.teaserText: The tiny island nation of Singapore may be running out of space. To make way for rapid urbanization and to maximise its space, the city has set its sights on moving underground. Deep beneath the surface lies a subterranean world few have seen or heard of before. From an enormous life-saving structure under a UNESCO World Heritage site and long-lost military bunkers getting a second lease of life, to laboratories underground for psychological experiments, and secretive rave parties set underground, we follow a series of intrepid explorers, urban farmers, engineers, scientists and clandestine party-goers as they re-discover and re-imagine what life underground in Singapore could be like.

teaserVideo.caption: Deep beneath the bustling streets of Singapore lies a subterranean world that few have seen or heard of before.
teaserVideo.title: Going Underground: What Lies Deep Beneath Singapore?

tvShows.description: Singapore may be running out of space, and it is rapidly building underground. Enter a subterranean world that few have seen or heard of before.
tvShows.title: Going Underground

tvShows.teaserText:
Life has gotten more digital than ever before. And the plusses of that for the environment has been clear�as in clear skies and clean air. What is not so clear however is this: when it comes to greenhouse gases, the Internet is responsible for 2% of global emissions. If the Internet were a country, it would be ranked as the sixth largest polluter in the world.

But the Internet is here to stay, so what can be done to make it greener? From individuals not hitting Reply All on emails or turning off Auto Play for videos, to data centres running on green energy and search engines giving back to the environment, host Prerna Pant looks at all the various ways we are Greening The �Net.

teaserVideo.caption: Life has gotten more digital than ever before. But when it comes to greenhouse gases, the Internet is responsible for 2% of global emissions. What can be done, is being done to green the �net?
teaserVideo.title: Greening The 'Net: The Internet's Unseen Carbon Footprint - How Can We Reduce It?

tvShows.description: Life has gotten more digital than ever before. But when it comes to greenhouse gases, the Internet is responsible for 2% of global emissions. What can be done, is being done to green the �net?
tvShows.title: Greening The Net

tvShows.teaserText: The American spirit made the U.S. a world superpower. Now it's turning men on the streets into superheroes. From thriving metropolis to small cities, ordinary Americans are fighting back against an unprecedented pandemic right in their own communities, defending the very values they hold dear. This intimate account reveals their battles and what it means to them to bleed red, white and blue.

teaserVideo.caption: The COVID-19 pandemic is devastating the U.S. like never before. But ordinary Americans are fighting back and emerging as everyday heroes where hope is needed the most.
teaserVideo.title: GRIT: Inside The U.S.' Battle Against COVID-19

tvShows.description: The COVID-19 pandemic is devastating the U.S. like never before. But ordinary Americans are fighting back and emerging as everyday heroes where hope is needed the most.
tvShows.title: GRIT

tvShows.teaserText: Airlines are facing an unparalleled challenge in aviation history � keeping their planes grounded, which is almost as complicated as keeping them in the air. What do airlines have to do to protect their planes as they go into suspended animation? We profile three aircraft engineers � the unsung heroes from regional airlines, SIA, PAL and AirAsia � as they undertake the unprecedented feat of keeping their fleet viable even as almost all travel is curtailed.

teaserVideo.caption: With pandemic travel restrictions in place, where have planes like Singapore Airlines or AirAsia�s fleets gone? Here�s an exclusive look behind the scenes, at the complex operations to park hundreds of planes on taxiways, runways and cargo terminals at airports like Kuala Lumpur International and Singapore�s Changi Airport.
teaserVideo.title: Grounded - S1: What happens to planes grounded during COVID-19?

tvShows.description: Airlines are facing the unparalleled challenge of keeping their planes grounded, which is almost as complicated as keeping them in the air. SIA, PAL, AirAsia share what their unsung heroes are doing.
tvShows.title: Grounded

tvShows.teaserText:
Green corridors and green spaces, Singapore has it in spades. Yet our relationship with nature is predicated on an ad-hoc basis, seeking it only when a detox from city-life is necessary. Does this portent well for society?

Nature takes time, and we should introduce it into our habits before it�s too late, urges Chris Leow, an urban farmer who is on a mission to fix the broken food system.

Whether you�re a plant snob, chlorophyll killer, or simply ascribe to the Cottagecore aesthetics, there�s something wild for everyone. And in growing so, we each begin to assume control of understanding our food source, well-being, and communities.

Every mission started out as a hobby, green shoots, so is there a gateway plant with which city-dwellers can cultivate a habit?

teaserVideo.caption: More and more Singaporeans have taken up urban farming. Healthy and contented, have folks who have gone green found the happy medium between the city and the soil?
teaserVideo.title: Growing Wild - S1E3: Growing Together

tvShows.description: Plants invade our personal space and we couldn�t be happier! In addition to spending time in nature, how can we bring more nature into our lives? Foodie? Artist? There�s a gateway plant for everyone.
tvShows.title: Growing Wild

tvShows.teaserText:
This 2-part documentary series examines why hawkers and hawker centres are such an essential part of the Singaporean DNA.

The series looks at the parallel history between Singapore's development, and the emergence of our hawker culture, with hawkers feeding Singaporeans for over a century to date. Our story starts off with a look at the history, from how early settlers took to the trade, to the urgent construction in the 1970s of our "community dining halls" - the hawker centres.

Hawker culture soon emerged, much to the benefit of Singaporeans from all walks of life. But what about the future of hawker culture? With veteran hawkers nearing retirement, and few among the young generation keen to carry on the traditional trade, the future of Singapore's beloved hawker heritage is looking precarious.

Hawkers, architects, celebrities, artists, a diplomat, and other Singaporeans share stories, ideas, and insights into lesser-known aspects of this unique Singapore way of life.

teaserVideo.caption: With veteran hawkers retiring and few young people entering the trade, how can Singapore keep our hawker culture alive? Will we lose part of our heritage?
teaserVideo.title: Hawkers In Our Centre - S1E2: Save Hawker Culture. Save Hawkers

tvShows.description: From street peddlers to food masters in hawker centres, hawkers have been feeding Singaporeans for over a century. How did this humble trade become our national culture? Can this heritage survive?
tvShows.title: Hawkers In Our Centre

tvShows.teaserText: Singapore has become a sought-after destination for foreigners who are keen to work and live in this multicultural environment. After living here for several years, many of them have found their place in the city, establishing their families here. This series looks at the lives of expatriates from different countries, as they share their experiences in Singapore.

teaserVideo.caption: Italians Fabrizio Righi and Ifeoma Ubby both find ways to promote their distinctive cultures here in Singapore. How are they blending their heritage with their life here?
teaserVideo.title: Home Away From Home - S1E3: Home Away From Home: The Italians

tvShows.description: Many foreigners make Singapore home. This series looks at the lives of expatriates from different countries, as they share their experiences in Singapore.
tvShows.title: Home Away From Home

tvShows.teaserText:
Building up Singapore�s Smart Nation strategy by inspiring commercial digitalisation. SPTel supports SMEs in their next-generation tech projects, through the network service provider�s business-class offerings such as EDGE Cloud, Software as a Service and flexible, uninterrupted and secure fibre services.


Presented by SPTel.

teaserVideo.caption:
SPTel is a home-grown network service provider which leverages on the strength in infrastructure of Singapore�s SP Group and ST Engineering�s expertise to offer to inspire SMEs to commercial digitalisation. Working with Sheng Siong, it has helped the supermarket chain maintain smooth operations with Network as a Service that�s uninterrupted and flexible, scaling up bandwidth when needed and paying only for the extra hours and bandwidth. 

Diverse proof of concept projects include secure and localised EDGE Cloud computing for data collection and analytics, with organisations such as Singapore Pools in its efforts to support charities in their public outreach programs and growing agritech�s potential using IoT and LoRAWAN for roof-top urban farmers, Abyfarm.

Parents want their babies to be super smart, super talented and super successful� and there is a multi-billion dollar industry of products and services promising all that. How do we navigate this confusing landscape of scientific claims and conflicting fads to find out what claims actually deliver?

Peter Davis � MMA fighter with two young kids � is a father who is �tough� to convince. But armed with surprising insight into a baby�s development, he is going to dive deep and sort out what works and what�s just hype.

teaserVideo.caption: Can you start preparing your child for career success at age 3? Peter travels to ultra-competitive China to find out how the formative years of 3 to 7 could be the best time to shape your child into a charming CEO or top super star.
teaserVideo.title: How To Raise A Super Baby - S1E3: How To Raise A Super Prepared Baby?

tvShows.description: Armed with surprising insight into a baby�s development, Peter Davis pries into claims in the multi-billion baby enrichment industry to sort out what is hype� and what could really make a super baby out of your child.

tvShows.teaserText:
In the oddest of places, ideas can sometimes form. Despite the shadow that the pandemic cast on our lives, people in Singapore from different walks of life found their creative spark to solve the problems we all faced.

From a gutsy aqua fitness instructor faced with the closure of swimming pools, who figures out a way to put food on the table for her three kids, out of the water. To a 10-year-old boy who helps his friends remember how to keep safe from the virus by making a toy, using materials he scavenged around his house. And amidst the grim pressure of climbing death tolls around the world, a scientist races against time to find a treatment against the ever-mutating COVID-19 virus.

We follow 8 individuals who forged their way to make their quirky, ingenious solutions to the pandemic�s problems a reality, in spite of the odds stacked against them.

teaserVideo.caption: Sometimes ideas come from the oddest places. Meet the people in Singapore who found a creative spark in the darkness of the pandemic to find quirky, ingenious solutions to the problems we all faced.
teaserVideo.title: Ideas vs Pandemic: Innovations Amid COVID-19

tvShows.description: Sometimes ideas come from the oddest places. Meet the people in Singapore who found a creative spark in the darkness of the pandemic to find quirky, ingenious solutions to the problems we all faced.

Maya Hari, Twitter�s Vice President for Asia Pacific, answers on In Conversation.

tvShows.teaserText: As Singapore emerges from the circuit breaker and activities gradually resume under the cloud of COVID-19, what will our new normal look like? How will Singapore manage the realities of living with the virus while we wait for a viable vaccine? How do we reckon with the numerous economic and social challenges that lie ahead? And how can we turn adversity into opportunity? In this special In Conversation series, Diana Ser sits down for candid one-on-one chats with Ministers K Shanmugam, Desmond Lee and Vivian Balakrishnan. They talk about Singapore's future and life after the pandemic, with topics ranging from social cohesion to social welfare to geopolitics. Each minister shares his thoughts and insight gained from the crisis and his vision for what is to come.

teaserVideo.caption: Relief measures, social cohesion, fake news... In the first of three special episodes of In Conversation, Diana Ser chats with Minister for Law and Home Affairs, K Shanmugam, about life under the shadow of the pandemic.
teaserVideo.title: In Conversation Special - S1E1: In Conversation Special with Minister K Shanmugam

tvShows.description: Diana Ser sits down for one-on-one chats with Ministers K Shanmugam, Desmond Lee and Vivian Balakrishnan to talk about Singapore's future and life after COVID-19.

So, you think you know everything about the sixties, seventies, and eighties? Or the nineties and �noughties�?

As we celebrate the start of a new decade, this 5 part documentary series offers �a companion version� of history.

See how the everyday lives of ordinary citizens transform, as a tiny little island spreads its wings out its global aspirations.

Discover how regular Singaporeans also contributed, in their own way, to transform the way Singaporeans worked, lived� and partied.

teaserVideo.caption: Singapore in the 1980s. An era marked by rapid progress and urban development, with bouts of tragedy testing a nation's resolve.

tvShows.description: Rediscover the decades that shaped a nation, and  Singaporeans' stories behind the Singapore story.

tvShows.teaserText: In Pursuit of Magic: Glamping Adventures is an 8-part travel lifestyle series exploring sustainable tourism through luxury camping or "glamping" in exotic places across Asia. In each episode, we are led on these escapades by pairs of glampers from diverse backgrounds. They pursue exciting adventures in locations such as Mongolia, Cambodia, China, Sri Lanka, Indonesia and Turkey while experiencing back-to-nature living. The series features fascinating glamping sites from mobile yurts to floating tents, in settings ranging from lush jungles and arid deserts, to tropical beaches and ancient ruins. In each episode, the glampers find out about the inspiration and philosophy behind each glamping style. To delve into the culture of each place, they engage in hands-on activities with the locals. Over the course of their journeys, they also learn how eco-tourism and glamping are helping local communities.

teaserVideo.caption: Zoo design consultant Bernard Harrison, and his actress daughter, Sharda, embark on a safari-style journey into the heart of Sri Lanka's national park. The pair bond over their love for animals and nature as they experience adventures and encounters in the wild.
teaserVideo.title: In Pursuit of Magic - S1E8: Leopard Trails Camp, Sri Lanka

tvShows.description: In Pursuit of Magic is an 8-part travel lifestyle series about luxury camping or 'glamping' in destinations across Asia. Each episode follows the unique journey of duo glampers from diverse backgrounds travelling to the various glamping sites to find out more about sustainable tourism.
tvShows.title: In Pursuit of Magic

tvShows.teaserText:
Gemstone dealer and jeweller Shahzeem Pasha is the third generation to take up the family trade.

Shahzeem gets a deal to source for a Colombian Emerald. Due to COVID-19 travel restrictions, Shahzeem gets in touch with an old contact, Jeffrey Bergman, an Emerald dealer based in Bangkok, Thailand.

Shahzeem then sources for a Pigeon�s Blood Ruby. He negotiates for the red stone with his uncle. Meanwhile, his cousin Imran based in Jakarta visits a Black Opal mine to get a sample for future dealings.

Next, Shahzeem attempts to get a Royal Blue Sapphire from Sri Lanka. Shahzeem works with gemstone dealer Munzir who is based in Colombo.

In the final episode, Shahzeem gets in touch with an old classmate, Rashad, who deals with rough Diamonds out of New Delhi, India. He needs to get the rough stone cut and polished in order to deliver a flawless Type 2A Diamond for his client. Artisanal Diamond mining in Sierra Leone is revealed.

teaserVideo.caption: Shahzeem secures a Type 2A flawless Diamond from India. As the stone gets processed in Surat, India, Shahzeem learns about lab-grown Diamonds that match the same quality.
teaserVideo.title: In Search Of Precious Stones - S1E4: In Search Of Precious Stones: The Flawless Diamond

tvShows.description: Gemstone dealer and jeweller Shahzeem Pasha sources precious stones � Emeralds, Rubies, Sapphires and Diamonds from around the world and sets them in bespoke jewellery pieces for selected clients.
tvShows.title: In Search Of Precious Stones

tvShows.teaserText:
In 1991, South Korea is preoccupied with its first democratic elections in 30 years. But in a village in Daegu, 5 fathers are facing their worst nightmare. Five young boys go on a romp in the mountains. They never return.

At first, the media is too caught up with the elections to cover this as news, and the local police treat it as a runaway case � until it attracts attention on a TV show. Soon the �frog boys� become national news. But with no credible leads, the wait turns out to be a long one.

A decade later, the bodies are found near a military shooting range. But to this day, the case has never been fully investigated.

In this special, the fathers of the missing boys recount the events from the day the boys go missing, to the conspiracy theories and bizarre twists and turns in the ensuing years.

At its heart, this is the story of 5 heartbroken parents and their missing children. But it also tells the wider story of societal changes over 3 decades.

teaserVideo.caption: In episode 2, the bones of the five boys are finally found. The authorities come up with an unconvincing theory. Why are they not investigating what everyone is talking about?
teaserVideo.title: In Search Of The Frog Boys - S1E2: Bones And Bullets

tvShows.description: Five boys disappear into a mountain near their homes, never to return. We investigate one of South Korea�s most famous cold cases, as we track down the fathers of the missing boys for their account.
tvShows.title: In Search Of The Frog Boys

tvShows.teaserText: Umami is the 5th basic taste after sweet, sour, bitter and salty but unlike the others, it�s hard to define. Often described as savoury, meaty deliciousness, it comes down to the taste of glutamates on our tongue. Often misrepresented as the chemical MSG, Umami sensations are created when certain natural ingredients combine and synergize. The term was coined in the 20th century by a Japanese chemist but the concept of savoury deliciousness has been understood by cooks throughout the world and through history. Now we want to explore the Umami secrets of some popular Asian foods. Host Robert Allison, trained chef, food stylist and cookery book writer from the UK travels from Seoul and Busan, to Hanoi, Singapore, Kelantan and Kuala Lumpur to peel open the umami secrets of home-grown dishes, local condiments and sauces. This series gives audiences a comprehensive idea of how certain ingredients have been traditionally used to produce the sought-after savoury-delicious taste.

teaserVideo.caption: High cooking heat - that�s what Kuala Lumpur's Hokkien Mee, Claypot Rice, Char Siu and Roti Canai can�t do without. The Maillard reaction is the science behind how high heat transforms proteins and sugars into colour, aroma and flavour.
teaserVideo.title: In Search of Umami - S1E6: Kuala Lumpur - The Maillard Reaction

tvShows.description: Umami, a term often used to describe a savoury deliciousness. Host, Robert Allison, takes us on a journey to discover how ingredients are used to produce this sought-after flavour.
tvShows.title: In Search of Umami

tvShows.teaserText:
India on Film explores the earliest footage of India dating back to 1899. Much of this archive has never been seen before, now expertly restored and digitized by the British Film Institute, and shown for the first time.

This fascinating archive paints India as a gigantic melting pot. We see rickshaw pullers, maharajahs, British colonialists and missionaries through the lens of professional and amateur filmmakers. We experience major events and rituals as if we were there � including the famous Delhi Durbars and some of the earliest films ever shot of Gandhi.

India on Film is part of the trilogy which includes China on Film and Singapore on Film. This exclusive two-parter contains contributions from a wide range of world-renowned experts, including historians and writers William Dalrymple and Manu Pillai. The series is narrated by Bollywood actor, Rahul Bose.

teaserVideo.caption: This film shows the British�s railway network across India. The excitement of children running alongside trains is just one snapshot of this complicated legacy the British left behind.
teaserVideo.title: India on Film - S1: Railways: A Complicated Legacy

tvShows.description: India on Film explores the earliest footage of India. Restored by the British Film Institute, it reveals an India bursting with colour and history, and brought to life by world renowned experts.
tvShows.title: India on Film

tvShows.teaserText:
Inside Our Factories is a feature documentary that celebrates the gamut of factories from the 1960s to present-day Singapore, tracing how factories have evolved with the economy over the years.

The film gains access to six factories that manufacture very different products - from humble wooden pallets that can serve as an "economic indicator", to high-end memory chips that power our modern lives. There are lesser-known stories like an ammunition factory that produces a world-class grenade, and a printing firm still producing old-school accounting books.

The film places the people in these factories front-and-centre. We hear their personal stories, collective memories, and aspirations. And come to understand why factories are more than just a place of work for many of them.

Shot in a cinematic style, the film shows Singapore factories in a way that�s never seen before.

Also, don't miss the short clips that provide an intimate look into how things are made (in "Extras").

teaserVideo.caption: Ever wondered what it is like inside some of Singapore's biggest factories? This feature documentary gains access to 6 factories to show us life on the factory floor.
teaserVideo.title: Inside Our Factories - S1: Inside Our Factories

tvShows.description: Ever wondered what it is like inside some of Singapore's biggest factories? This feature documentary gains access to 6 factories to show us life on the factory floor.
tvShows.title: Inside Our Factories

tvShows.teaserText: For four months, CNA gained unfiltered filming access to a group of social workers in Singapore, whose job is to protect children. This 3-part observational documentary series features stories of these Child Protection Officers as they battle hostility from parents, scrutiny of every unpopular decision they make on behalf of the child, and the emotional weight that comes from witnessing abuse, neglect and violence inflicted on vulnerable minors - all to ensure that every child can live a safe and happy life in their own homes.

teaserVideo.caption: Both mothers' kids were removed from their care for abuse or neglect. A year since the events in the documentary Inside The Child Protective Service, we find out: How have these families fared?
teaserVideo.title: Inside The Child Protective Service - S1: Children Under The Child Protective Service, One Year On: Where Are They Now

tvShows.description: For 4 months, CNA gained filming access to Child Protection Officers. Witness how CPOs face hostility and scrutiny for their work to rescue children, who are abused or neglected by their own parents.
tvShows.title: Inside The Child Protective Service

tvShows.teaserText:
Unprecedented access was given to Channel NewsAsia inside the Children�s ICU at KK Women�s and Children�s Hospital.

This five-part series documents life inside the Children�s ICU � the daily struggle of children as young as three years old who have to fight for their right to live; the emotional turmoil this elicits in their parents; and the men and women in white who stoically wage wars against life-threatening diseases so that these children can grow up.

teaserVideo.caption: Inside the ICU, three children have just completed difficult medical procedures. They survived, but the road to recovery is just beginning. Tantrums, uncertainty, and waiting are all par for the course. How do doctors and parents cope?
teaserVideo.title: Inside The Children's ICU - S1E5: Road To Recovery

tvShows.description: This series documents the daily struggle of children inside the Children�s ICU � who have to fight for their right to live, the emotional turmoil this elicits in their parents and the men and women in white who wage wars against diseases.
tvShows.title: Inside The Children's ICU

tvShows.teaserText:
The current hype about bitcoin and other cryptocurrencies as millions are made and lost make for great headlines, but misses the far more interesting story about the technology that allows them to exist, namely, blockchain. This series dives into the cryptokingdom to understand the technology and why we should all care about how it develops. Just as it�s difficult to do anything without the internet today, in 10 years, we might very well be saying the same thing about blockchain.

The series travels through a landscape where the virtual and the physical intertwine, where seemingly abstract concepts like bitcoin, cryptocurrency, and blockchain have inspired libertarians, financiers and entrepreneurs to throw themselves into the technology and explore its potential for the future. Some see it as a revolution, others see the prospect of great profits, and many get lost in between - prey to scams, hacks, or naivet�. We travel across Latin America and Asia in search of the truth behind the hype.

teaserVideo.caption: Pioneers of blockchain technology and crypto-currencies have bold visions of an increasingly virtual future. Will it be a tech-rich utopia? The science-fiction future may be closer than we realise.
teaserVideo.title: Inside The Cryptokingdom - S1E4: The Machine Ordered Universe

tvShows.description: The rise and fall of cryptocurrencies make for great headlines, but misses the story about blockchain, the technology behind it, and the pioneers redesigning our future for a potentially revolutionary way of living.
tvShows.title: Inside The Cryptokingdom

tvShows.teaserText: When the Courts decide to keep offenders out of jail, it�s up to the Probation Service to find out how these probationers can be rehabilitated. Understand what leads these youths to go astray and what it takes to stop them from ever becoming a menace to public safety again. An unprecedented look into the inner workings of Singapore's probation service.

teaserVideo.caption: �He�s constantly talking about the past. I�ve been clean for two years plus. If he wants to see changes in me, maybe he should start opening his eyes.� This is the story 20-year-old Lisa (not her real name), a former drug abuser on probation.
teaserVideo.title: Inside The Probation Service - S1: Dad, Why Can't You See I've Changed? A Probationer's Cry

tvShows.description: Understand what leads youths to go astray and how to bring them back on track, in this unprecedented observational documentary that pries into the inner workings of Singapore's probation service.
tvShows.title: Inside The Probation Service

tvShows.teaserText:
Five of the world's biggest brands reveal intimate details on how major companies are run and how, in times of crisis, they survived, adapted and merged to compete better.

With interviews from C-suites, executives and industry analysts, Inside The Storm provides the inside story to the high pressure decisions and risks taken in company boardrooms every day.

teaserVideo.caption: How Japan�s flagship airline nearly went bust � and was saved by a Buddhist monk turned CEO Dr Inamori Kazuo.
teaserVideo.title: Inside The Storm - S4: Saving Japan Airlines

tvShows.description: The life and death battles of global businesses. The crucial decisions, the risks taken and the mistakes made. Inside the Storm explores the many reasons behind the struggles of five major global companies: Grab, Apple, Haier, Japan Airlines and Starbucks.
