tvShows.teaserText: We rarely see them. We often ignore them. But whether we know it or not, tiny superheroes live all around us. From the black soldier fly with an insatiable appetite, to the mantis shrimp with a Thor-like thunderstrike, these marvellous mini-heroes possess powers that human beings can only dream of. This is the story of the ground-breaking and occasionally insane-sounding research being conducted by Singapore's science community on the world�s tiniest critters. The scientists' mission - to harness the powers of these critters to beat cancer, make unbreakable bones, and even help us all live longer and better. Voiced by naturalist Nick Baker, Our Tiny Superheroes is an incredible introduction to the mini-marvels living among us, and the maverick scientists trying to unlock the secrets of their superpowers.

teaserVideo.caption: In Singapore, seven scientists are harnessing the superpowers of some unexpected species to solve mankind�s greatest challenges. Their discoveries might change our world forever.
teaserVideo.title: Our Tiny Superheroes - S1: Our Tiny Superheroes

tvShows.description: Superheroes don�t just exist in comic books because some of them live right in our midst. Meet the tiniest heroes of our natural world whose incredible powers might just change our world forever.
tvShows.title: Our Tiny Superheroes

tvShows.teaserText: In early February 2020, the Diamond Princess cruise ship was quarantined off the coast of Yokohama, Japan. Hundreds of passengers tested positive for the coronavirus and fourteen people died. As Chinese authorities were just beginning to deal with the outbreak of the disease in Wuhan, the Diamond Princess became the largest site of infection outside China. Coronavirus tore through the ship as authorities desperately scrambled to curb the spread of the infection by confining over 2500 passengers to their rooms. Within two weeks passengers and crew members were pleading with their governments to be taken off the ship. Outbreak Onboard is the story of how a luxury cruise liner turned into a floating epidemiological disaster- taking an in depth look at how the authorities responded to an unprecedented situation when there were still so many unknowns. Leading infectious disease experts weigh in on the drama- offering their take on how the infection was managed and why it spread so rapidly.

teaserVideo.caption: Outbreak Onboard is the story of how a luxury cruise liner, The Diamond Princess turned into a floating epidemiological disaster- taking an in depth look at how the authorities responded to an unprecedented situation when there were still so many unknowns. Leading infectious disease experts weigh in on the drama- offering their take on how the infection was managed and why it spread so rapidly.
teaserVideo.title: Outbreak Onboard: Inside The Diamond Princess COVID-19 Infection

tvShows.description: Outbreak Onboard is the story of a luxury cruise liner turned floating epidemiological disaster- surviving passengers and leading experts recount how the Diamond Princess Covid-19 outbreak unfolded.
tvShows.title: Outbreak Onboard

tvShows.teaserText: A double blow of disaster leaves the island of Palu in devastation and disarray. In a span of one month, Channel NewsAsia�s documentary filmmakers meet survivors coping with the enormous aftermath - losing livelihoods, homes and loved ones. We meet brave individuals - an air traffic controller with a comrade killed in the line of duty, a shopowner placing solar panels on survivors' homes, parents with children swept away by the tsunami and other desperate townsfolk struggling to salvage whatever pieces remain of their lives. Volunteer rescuers step in from all across Indonesia, drawn to the plight of their countrymen. Aftershocks continue as the islanders face the greatest test of human resilience.

teaserVideo.caption: Palu is hit by a double blow of disaster. Channel NewsAsia's documentary filmmakers profile survivors and rescuers facing the greatest test of human resilience.
teaserVideo.title: Palu: A Month After: Double Blow Of Disaster

tvShows.description: Palu is devastated by a earthquake and tsunami in quick succession. This is an intimate profile of the people of Palu, as they struggle to rebuild.
tvShows.title: Palu: A Month After

tvShows.teaserText:
The COVID-19 pandemic threatens Singapore�s very existence as a global trade hub.

In this two-parter, we see how the island is keeping its borders open, to keep goods and people flowing, while keeping the virus and its deadly variants at bay.

We spotlight the everyday heroes at our borders that take on the risk of contracting a mutating virus. We talk to the insiders contending with the precarious balancing act of opening borders wide enough to prevent economic collapse, while ensuring the virus would not bring everything to a standstill.

We uncover the little-known role that Changi Airport plays in organ transplants and in keeping global sea routes running. And we go inside a hotel turned Stay-Home-Notice quarantine facility to see how they maintain the movement of people without compromising safety in this new COVID normal.

teaserVideo.caption: When more than 300 guests confined to their rooms have to be fed 3 times a day. And what happens to the dirty laundry of guests who test positive for COVID-19?
teaserVideo.title: Pandemic Borders: Turning a Singapore 5-star luxury hotel into a COVID-19 Stay-Home Notice facility

tvShows.description: In a city-state built on trade, global border closures trigger a battle for survival. Witness the unseen struggle to keep people and goods flowing through Singapore, while keeping the community safe.
tvShows.title: Pandemic Borders

tvShows.teaserText: Highlights from the Singapore Parliament.

teaserVideo.caption: Singapore Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong speaks in Parliament on the country's response to COVID-19 and life beyond the pandemic.
teaserVideo.title: Parliament Specials - S1: Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong Addresses Singapore's 14th Parliament

tvShows.description: Highlights from the Singapore Parliament
tvShows.title: Parliament Specials

tvShows.teaserText: The World Health Organization puts the number of deaths from climate change at 250,000 by 2050. Droughts, wildfires, floods, and catastrophic rains only lead to one question: Has the politics of climate change finally reached the tipping point? CNA traverses around the world to investigate Australia's coal conundrum, Pakistan's Himalayan meltdown and Brazil Amazonian battle. Along the way, we meet people and activists trying to find ways to tackle the biggest issue of the 21st century. A combination of bad policies and political apathy is speeding up climate change. Have we reached the tipping point? Can it be reversed?

teaserVideo.caption: Deforestation in Brazil has skyrocketed. The size of 8.4 million fields have been chopped down. We investigate the need for gold that is forcing people to burn the trees down.
teaserVideo.title: Politics Of Climate Change - S1E3: Brazil's Amazonian Battle

tvShows.description: Droughts, bushfires and floods wreak havoc on communities and destroy environments. A toxic mix of greed, imprudent politics and apathy are to blame in exacerbating the effects of climate change.
tvShows.title: Politics Of Climate Change

tvShows.teaserText: Across the world, passionately held religious faith inspires conflict and violence. From Yangon to Utah, some believers preach intolerance � even murder. Mobeen Azhar is a journalist and film maker: his Muslim family is from Pakistan but he grew up between two worlds in Britain. He has seen first-hand how beliefs can fuel intolerance. In this 5-part series, Mobeen embarks on an epic journey to find out why religious beliefs that preach a message of compassion, can be harnessed to serve very different ends.

teaserVideo.caption: In this episode, Mobeen Azhar investigates the resurgence of Hindi nationalism in India in journey from Varanasi to Mumbai. He reveals how the spirit of Hindutva threatens tolerance and diversity in the world�s biggest democracy.
teaserVideo.title: Power And Piety - S1E5: Saffron Revolution

tvShows.description: In this four episode series we look at Islamic radicalism, Hindu nationalism, Buddhist fundamentalist and Christian extremism - in an attempt to understand if religion is a faith of violence, or, if religious conflict is embedded in socio-economic factors.
tvShows.title: Power And Piety

tvShows.teaserText: Power List Asia returns for a sixth season. The series continues to build on the list of who�s who in Asia�s business circles � the men and women with the power to influence markets, shape consumer habits and inspire lifestyle changes; as well as tell us a thing or two about why they are at the top of their game. Karen Lam hosts this intimate and insightful series seeking to learn and understand how these influential founders, charismatic managers, and maverick CEOs navigate the fast-changing business trends and dynamics in Asia. Audiences will find out what it takes to run some of the biggest and best companies in Asia, and get a glimpse of the less-often exposed sides of these movers and shakers.

teaserVideo.caption: One of the oldest industries today, shipping is not a business for the faint of heart. But the second generation leader of Singapores Pacific International Lines, S. S. Teo is bent on riding the high seas for years to come.
teaserVideo.title: Power List Asia - S1E12: S.S. Teo (Singapore)

tvShows.description: Power List Asia returns for a sixth season. The series continues to build on the list of who�s who in Asia�s business circles � the men and women with the power to influence markets, shape consumer habits and inspire lifestyle changes; as well as tell us a thing or two about why they are at the top of their game.
tvShows.title: Power List Asia

tvShows.teaserText: Singapore is looking to secure its energy future. With fossil fuels, it is banking on LNG, with plans to be an LNG hub in Asia Pacific. With renewable sources of energy, solar is what we are investing in. What are the steps being taken to ensure that these two sources of energy will provide for our growing energy needs into the future?

teaserVideo.caption: Singapore is investing in solar, with plans to have it make up 20 percent of our energy pie by 2050. We look at where solar research stands in Singapore, some of the innovations in the pipeline and what is being done to address the challenges before solar can ensure our energy security.
teaserVideo.title: Powering the Future - S1E2: Lighting up with Solar

tvShows.description: What are the steps taken to ensure that LNG and solar can provide for our growing energy needs into the future?
tvShows.title: Powering the Future

tvShows.teaserText:
�Pride Over Prejudice� is a two-part documentary that uncovers the roots of prejudice between ethnic & immigrant communities in Singapore and explores how pride in multicultural identity, values & heroes can overcome differences.

The first episode �Pride in an Unnatural Nation� unpacks the hope and challenge of growing a Singaporean identity in a multicultural nation which inherited age-old ethnic prejudices from its colonial past as well as competing nationalisms from the motherlands of its immigrant citizenry.

The second episode �Prejudice in a Global City� investigates problems absorbing newer waves of immigrants into the social fabric of post-independence Singapore. In 2020, over 1 in 3 persons in Singapore wasn�t a citizen. Crises like the COVID-19 pandemic reveal underlying fear and discomfort among native-born Singaporeans about the many �strange, new faces� in their midst.

teaserVideo.caption: In this reaction video, Singaporeans read out comments made by respondents in a 2014 Institute Of Policy Studies (IPS) study on the integration of new immigrants in the Singapore heartlands. How resonant are these sentiments today in 2021?
teaserVideo.title: Pride Over Prejudice: Singaporeans react to comments by and about new immigrants

tvShows.description: The two-part documentary uncovers the roots of prejudice between ethnic & immigrant communities in Singapore and explores how pride in multicultural identity, values & heroes can overcome differences.
tvShows.title: Pride Over Prejudice

tvShows.teaserText: Recent racist incidents draw attention to the state of Singapore�s multiracialism and social cohesion. It is necessary to better understand how we can sustain dialogue on race beyond trigger events, how we might enable constructive discussions about race across social segments and whether we should arrive at a collective consensus on what is considered acceptable or unacceptable behaviour in relation to race. Minister of Finance, Lawrence Wong, was the keynote speaker at the IPS-RSIS forum on Race and Racism in Singapore. He addressed those topics in his speech and in a dialogue with Dr Shashi Jayakumar, Head of RSIS� Centre of Excellence for National Security.

teaserVideo.caption: Recent racist incidents draw attention to the state of Singapore�s multiracialism and social cohesion. Minister of Finance Lawrence Wong addressed the issue at a forum on race and racism in Singapore.
teaserVideo.title: Race & Racism in Singapore: A Forum

tvShows.description: Recent racist incidents draw attention to the state of Singapore�s multiracialism and social cohesion. Minister of Finance Lawrence Wong addressed the issue at a forum on race and racism in Singapore.
tvShows.title: Race & Racism in Singapore

tvShows.teaserText: December 2019 in Wuhan, central China.The epicentre of a dangerous new viral outbreak - COVID-19. In a space of just three months, a global pandemic is declared. Healthcare systems are overwhelmed, economies are disrupted and governments impose lockdowns to contain the spread of the virus. Where did this novel coronavirus come from? In what way was it manifesting itself in humans? How was it being spread? We uncover the vital questions scientists ask as they grapple to understand this new virus, and its potential threat. We also speak to the scientists and experts leading the fight against this latest pandemic to develop vaccines and treatments in a bid to halt the coronavirus' relentless spread.

teaserVideo.caption: Lockdowns. Curfews. Quarantines. How did a coronavirus bring the world to a standstill? We delve into the science of viral outbreaks and track the world�s race against the latest pandemic.
teaserVideo.title: Race Against Pandemic: The Search For A COVID-19 Vaccine

tvShows.description: Lockdowns. Curfews. Quarantines. How did a coronavirus bring the world to a standstill? We delve into the science of viral outbreaks and track the world's race against the latest pandemic.
tvShows.title: Race Against Pandemic

tvShows.teaserText:
In the next 30 years, we need to produce more food than we have ever produced in human history. But Asia's food security is already under immense pressure. Land scarcity, climate change, plagues and diseases are reducing yields, devastating food supplies and taking away livelihoods. Yet, there is still hope.

Across Asia, there are scientists, farmers, entrepreneurs and activists racing to provide the food of the future. From China to the Philippines, Indonesia to India, meet offshore seaweed farmers, women activists, quirky entrepreneurs, cultured meat scientists and locust hunters as they push themselves to find new and innovative ways to farm and produce food. Each person has a different background, story and personal motivation, but all are united by the same goal: averting a major food crisis in the years to come.

teaserVideo.caption: Increasing disease outbreaks and diseases are pushing our food security to breaking point. Meet those fighting to protect us against the locust swarms, plagues and pandemics of the future.
teaserVideo.title: Race To Feed The World - S1E3: How Do We Deal With Disease And Outbreaks?

tvShows.description: Asia�s food security will soon reach breaking point. Meet the scientists, farmers, entrepreneurs and activists as they race to feed our rapidly growing population to avert a looming global crisis.
tvShows.title: Race To Feed The World

tvShows.teaserText:
Since workplaces reopened a year after COVID-19 was first detected in Singapore, a lot of focus has been placed on safety and individual well-being. Mitigating risks for employees and customers to safely return to work on site is paramount. Beyond safe distancing measures and wearing your masks, contact tracing is key to tracking and breaking the chains of transmission of COVID-19.

Race to Trace spotlights the extensive technology behind a light and wearable contact tracing device, called BluePass. Delving into different use cases, the three-part series examines how BluePass is helping individuals, companies and nations stay safe from COVID-19.

Brought to you by T-Pride, Temasek Holdings

teaserVideo.caption: The final episode looks at how BluePass is suitable to be deployed at scale for enterprises in the region, improving contact tracing and minimising work disruptions.
teaserVideo.title: Race To Trace - S1E3: The Long War Against COVID-19

tvShows.description: Race to Trace delves into the different use cases of the light and wearable contact tracing device, BluePass, and how it is helping individuals, companies and nations stay safe from COVID-19.
tvShows.title: Race To Trace

tvShows.teaserText: Raffles Revealed is a landmark series packed with adventure, intrigue, conflict and tragedy. Exploring the untold story of Sir Stamford Raffles, founder of modern Singapore, presenter Dr Julian Davison follows his footsteps around the world. We travel along the cobbled streets of London, the windswept mountains of Scotland, the steamy jungles of Sumatra, the sprawling temples of Java and the faded colonial glory of Penang. In Singapore we discover how Raffles used his cunning to establish a trading settlement, and his explosive fallout with old friend Major William Farquhar. Dr Julian hunts down long-lost documents to unravel the real Raffles - the man behind the legend. This series features rare archive materials, on-location filming at iconic world landmarks, and interviews with leading international experts. For the very first time on television we uncover Raffles' stunning triumphs, dark deeds, romances, tragedies, failures and glories. Hero or villain? Dr Julian reveals all.

teaserVideo.caption: Raffles Revealed is the untold story of Sir Stamford Raffles - high adventure, romance, conflict, tragedy and death. Presenter Dr Julian Davison follows his astonishing life around the world - from social climbing clerk in London to ambitious official in Penang and all-powerful governor of Java.
teaserVideo.title: Raffles Revealed - S1E1: Great Expectations

tvShows.description: Raffles Revealed is a landmark series packed with adventure, intrigue, conflict and tragedy. Exploring the untold story of Sir Stamford Raffles, Dr Julian Davison follows his footsteps around the world. Examining Raffles' greatest achievements and darkest deeds, we uncover this extraordinary life.
tvShows.title: Raffles Revealed

tvShows.teaserText: In the heart of one of the world�s most modern cities stands an iconic structure synonymous with refinement, elegance, and top-notch service unchanged for more than a century. But even icons need a makeover. Filmed over more than 2 years, this documentary goes past the hoardings to show the sheer magnitude, unanticipated obstacles, and careful deliberation needed in restoring a 132-year-old heritage hotel. We catch up with well-loved characters from the previous episode � Bernd, the hands-on front office manager turned director of rooms; Kaeley, the affable and newly-minted executive housekeeper; and the sweet and unexpected friendship between long-time guest, Mdm Schoof, and duty manager, Roslee. We also get introduced to some new characters � Grace, the head butler in charge of steering a new team of Raffles butlers; and Kevin, the handsome chef de cuisine representing Anne-Sophie Pic, a chef with 7 Michelin stars to her name.

teaserVideo.caption: What does it take to restore a 132-year-old heritage hotel? Hard work, plenty of surprises and a 9-month delay. This is an exclusive look at Raffles Hotel's first major overhaul in 30 years.
teaserVideo.title: Raffles: An Icon Reborn - S1E2: Raffles: An Icon Reborn

tvShows.description: This is an exclusive and intimate behind-the-scenes look at the most ambitious restoration project undertaken at the 132-year-old Raffles Hotel, and the people driving it.
tvShows.title: Raffles: An Icon Reborn

tvShows.teaserText: This observational documentary series puts the spotlight on auctions of the rare and rarefied, as it goes beyond the intensity of a bidding war to uncover the real deal. The 5-part series uses the auction as a springboard to focus on one valuable commodity in each episode. This one-hour programme is not just about the drama that unfolds at the auction block, but the whole journey that ultimately starts from how these objects of desire are found, cultivated or groomed, to how and where they are sold. As much as the story is built on how and why big money change hands over these commodities, the programme also reveals the history and phenomenon behind these auctions and focuses on the people whose labour of love created these products. The series features the sale of the world�s most expensive grapes and bluefin tuna in Japan, thoroughbred yearlings at the Tattersalls auction in England�s Newmarket, Hanwoo which is Korean beef in South Korea and white truffles in Alba, Italy.

teaserVideo.caption: Tokyo's brand-new wholesale fish market, Toyosu, rings in 2019 with the auction of the world's most expensive fish. We witness the hardship fishermen face as the prized bluefin tuna becomes scarce.
teaserVideo.title: Real Deal - S1E5: Tuna

tvShows.description: This ob-doc series puts the spotlight on auctions of the rare and rarefied and uncovers how these objects are found, cultivated or groomed.
tvShows.title: Real Deal

tvShows.teaserText: Over the past few years, the issue of refugees has become highly politicised. Refugees are seen either as victims or aggressors to be kept out. Yet there are groups of refugees who have trumped the odds. In this series, we feature an earlier wave of refugees who haven�t just survived, but are thriving today and giving back to their communities. Our culinary heroes originated from every part of Asia and fanned out across the globe in search of new lives. Today, they are using food in powerful ways and reshaping the way people see Asia. Behind each dish is a story of survival - stories of refugees who seek freedom from societies in conflict, of people who struggle to build new lives with treasured family recipes, and cities that have been enriched by their presence. This series proves that food can truly break down walls, and help us find the commonality across different people.

teaserVideo.caption: Haunted by the horrors of being jailed, tortured and losing his family in Syria, Ahmad finds refuge in London. To survive, he does anything and everything, including cook. As word-of-mouth of his home cooking spread, he started Aleppo Supper Club, a pop-up restaurant and catering service.
teaserVideo.title: Refugee Chef - S1E6: Aleppo Supper Club

tvShows.description: Refugee Chef features a group of Asian refugees who have survived the impossible odds of wars and strife. These culinary hereos use family recipes to make their own tale of rags to riches come true and are reshaping how people see Asia.
tvShows.title: Refugee Chef

tvShows.teaserText: CNA flagship series, 'Regardless of' examines faultlines in our society. Through candid conversations and social experiments with people from different walks of life, we reveal class inequalities, racial prejudice, and generational gaps. Fronted by Janil Puthuchary, chairman of Onepeople.SG, we always come back to the heart of the matter � what will it take for us to stay united?

teaserVideo.caption: Does majority privilege exist, how should we feel about the term, and what can those who enjoy it do? And for Singaporeans of the minority races, have things gotten better or worse for them - in terms of mcro-aggressions or outright discrimination they face?
teaserVideo.title: Regardless Of...: Race, racism, privilege � What has changed in Singapore?

tvShows.title: Regardless Of...

tvShows.teaserText:
From the trendy to traditional, radical to revolutionary, the award-winning series features inspiring stories about gastronomy, design, artistry and architecture in Thailand, Taiwan, Turkey and Singapore.

This season�s curation reflects trends of sustainability, heritage and craftsmanship. Female artisans featured prominently as we get to meet a Thai goat cheesemaker, a Singaporean floral artist, Taiwanese wood maker and Turkish glass artists.

Other fascinating personalities include a Taiwanese bamboo artist, a Dutch watchmaker from Patek Philippe and Singapore�s cheongsam maestro, Goh Lai Chan. And get exclusive access to unique destinations and spectacular houses in Asia.

teaserVideo.caption: Visit a home in Thailand that is a �plus� in more ways, meet the chef behind some of Singapore�s most-inventive cuisine, and get to know a floral artist who creates whimsical arrangements.
teaserVideo.title: Remarkable Living - S4E5: A Love Letter To My Family

tvShows.description: Remarkable Living features a curated selection of exceptional lifestyle visionaries across the globe. These are their inspiring stories on craftsmanship, gastronomy, design, artistry and architecture.
tvShows.title: Remarkable Living

tvShows.teaserText: After receiving a mysterious envelope of cash from a clan association after his grandfather�s death, documentary filmmaker Douglas Lan begins his quest to discover what Singapore Chinese clans are and what they were for. Learning about the heritage of these centuries-old institutions, Douglas searches for the relevance of these ancient guilds through young members who are sustaining the legacy of their clans. Lynn Wong is a researcher on a mission to document and salvage the memories of clans in Singapore before they disappear. Jolie Yin was the youngest youth president in Singapore clan history and an active member of Chung Shan Association. And Richard Zheng is a new citizen with a young family, finding ways to give back and modernize the clan that has given him a community. Gaining access to their clans and more, Douglas embarks on a journey to understand the purpose of clans today, their struggles, and how they are fighting to stay relevant in the midst of modernity and apathy.

teaserVideo.caption: After receiving a mysterious envelope of cash from a clan association after his grandfather�s death, documentary filmmaker Douglas Lan embarks on a journey to uncover clan houses in Singapore today.
teaserVideo.title: Remember Our House: Legacy Of Chinese Clan Houses

tvShows.description: After receiving a mysterious envelope of cash from a clan association after his grandfather�s death, documentary filmmaker Douglas Lan embarks on a journey to uncover clan houses in Singapore today.
tvShows.title: Remember Our House

tvShows.teaserText: These days, subcultures such as decluttering and biohacking have all "gone viral", thanks to the Internet. They all tout various kinds of benefits but are they really legit? Stand-up comics Rishi and Sharul are a married couple. In this fun but informative series, they investigate these practices, immersing themselves in each community to learn about the origins and attractions of each trend, as well as speaking to experts to try and establish the validity of the claims.

teaserVideo.caption: We've heard of Life Hacks, but what about Body Hacks? Rishi and Sharul dip their toes into Biohacking, where people are manipulating their bodies in the quest to live better and longer.
teaserVideo.title: Rishi & Sharul Try... - S1E4: Rishi And Sharul Try� Biohacking

tvShows.description: Stand-up comics Rishi and Sharul try subcultures that have gone viral - such as decluttering and biohacking - to see if the benefits are as touted.
tvShows.title: Rishi & Sharul Try...

tvShows.teaserText: COVID-19 has had a huge impact on SMEs in Singapore. Many are struggling. And yet, even as some companies have had to take significant action to remain viable, they are doing more than just staying afloat. They are reaching out and helping the community during this crisis. In this heartwarming programme, we look at some SMEs who have resisted letting go of staff and have instead tweaked their original business and are contributing to the fight against the pandemic, not only with their new products but with their generosity in distributing these products.

teaserVideo.caption: COVID-19 has had a huge impact on SMEs in Singapore. But some companies have taken action. They are not only staying afloat but are reaching out and helping the community during this crisis.
teaserVideo.title: Rising To The Challenge: How Are SMEs Coping This COVID-19?

tvShows.description: COVID-19 has had a huge impact on SMEs in Singapore. But some companies have taken action. They are not only staying afloat but are reaching out and helping the community during this crisis.
tvShows.title: Rising To The Challenge

tvShows.teaserText: What does it take to write songs about Singapore that are real, raw and resonant? Singaporean artists Benjamin Kheng, Aisyah Aziz and Wang Weiliang go on a journey to rediscover their city and themselves in order to compose honest, heartfelt anthems that are a ROAR from the gut of the Lion City. In the first episode, they explore challenging Singapore issues they�re passionate about - the pressure to succeed in school, the struggle for acceptance and overcoming past crimes and mistakes. In the second episode, they speak with songwriting pioneers and take the stage to present their new songs to a live audience. Will they strike a chord?

teaserVideo.caption: In the second episode, as artists Benjamin Kheng, Aisyah Aziz and Wang Weiliang take on the challenge of creating songs about these real Singapore issues, they speak with songwriting pioneers and take the stage to present their new songs to a live audience. Will they strike a chord?
teaserVideo.title: Roar! - S1E2: Hear Me Roar! (Finale)

tvShows.description: Singaporean artists Benjamin Kheng, Aisyah Aziz and Wang Weiliang go on a journey to rediscover their city and themselves, in order to compose heartfelt anthems that are a ROAR from the gut of the Lion City.
tvShows.title: Roar!

tvShows.teaserText: Savouring the Future is an eight part series about the future of Singapore food SMEs. The success of SMEs is vital in generating jobs and economic growth. In Singapore's case, it is particularly pressing as the city state seeks to add depth to its economy. This then, is the focus in the series: Singapore food SMEs that are innovating to cope with the challenges posed by the local market and from there, to become globally competitive. Beyond automation and new products, this series discovers how innovation is very much a human enterprise. Consistently, it is the dreams and visions, the determination and the difficult decisions, that drive the innovators, and which spurs the progress.

teaserVideo.caption: Dian Xiao Er and Pu Tien are well known amongst Singaporeans but how well do they fare outside of our shores? In this episode, Bjorn travels to Shanghai to see if these two local popular restaurant chains can survive and thrive in the huge China market.
teaserVideo.title: Savouring The Future - S1E8: Going Global: Restaurants & Franchise

tvShows.description: In Savouring The Future, host Bjorn Shen goes in search of Singapore food SMEs who are innovating beyond automation and new products to cope with challenges posed by the local market, and from there, aim to become globally competitive.
tvShows.title: Savouring The Future

tvShows.teaserText: Follow food writer Aun Koh as he tours Asia in search of off-menu items, hidden food gems and coveted access to spots that are completely off-the-radar. In each city, Aun introduces us to chefs, restaurant owners, mixologists and other food bloggers who show him the most exclusive and hidden spots in town. We unravel what happens when a foodie hits town. Throughout his journey, Aun learns about the history and traditions of certain foods, and takes us behind the scenes to forage for ingredients that make these dining experiences so special.

teaserVideo.caption: Aun Koh navigates the tightly-packed city of Hong Kong to uncover an exotic snake dish and a secret custard called the Egg Opera. He discovers 'invisible cocktails' through the hidden bar scene.
teaserVideo.title: Secret Delicious - S1E6: Hong Kong

tvShows.description: Food writer Aun Koh explores six Asian cities in search of off-menu items, hidden food gems and coveted access to Asia�s most exclusive spots, in hopes of uncovering some of the best dining secrets.
tvShows.title: Secret Delicious

tvShows.teaserText: Cyberspace is a hidden battlefield where nations wage secret wars. Nations use cyber operations to steal information, spread falsehoods, puppeteer societies into conflict and disrupt the infrastructure, businesses and services we rely on. In today�s interconnected society, no one is safe from cyber warfare. Discover Singapore�s response to a world of cyber threats, establishing digital defence as a new pillar of its total defence strategy. Can the country hold steadfast to its �Smart Nation� vision in the face of cyber risks?

teaserVideo.caption: The line between cyber and physical worlds are blurred as state-led cyber warfare lacks rules. Amidst calls for laws, alliances and enterprises, Singapore is growing its cyber defence ecosystem.
teaserVideo.title: Secret Wars - S1E2: Conflict In Cyberspace

tvShows.description: Cyberspace is a hidden battlefield, where nations steal, disinform, disrupt and destroy. Discover secret cyber wars that endanger open and connected countries like Singapore.
tvShows.title: Secret Wars

tvShows.teaserText: Joshua is a computer geek. He�s also a sought after speaker and soon-to-be Youtuber. He�s currently working on his first two videos � blind guy puts on makeup and blind guy folds paper aeroplanes. Joan is hardcore. 2 weeks after fracturing her cheekbone, she was back to running 10 kilometers on the track and lifting weights at the gym. Her aniridia and glaucoma hasn�t stopped her from being a national para-athlete. Liana is a self-confessed shopaholic. Her quirky style of fashion means that you�ll often see her in things that don�t seemingly match. She may not be able to see, but she can tell you when her Rendang is perfectly cooked. Rendi and Bo Sheng are brothers. They may not always see eye to eye, but at the end of the day they have each other�s back. Mihran is 6 years old. He suffers from Leber congenital amaurosis, which affects both his vision near and far. But with the help of assistive technology, he�s about to enter a mainstream primary school. These 6 extraordinary individuals invite you into their lives for an intimate look at what it means to live with blindness in Singapore. What will it take for the visually impaired to enjoy art on their terms? Are there limits to what they can achieve in sports? From YouTube to Instagram, from the sports hall to the Singapore Art Museum, our 6 protagonists challenge everyone to think differently about people with visual impairment. For the first time, you can also watch a special edition of the documentary with Audio Descriptions.

teaserVideo.caption: What kind of sport puts sighted athletes on a level playing field with blind ones? Welcome to the world of Goalball where we challenge you to think differently about people with visual impairment.
teaserVideo.title: Seeing Is Believing - S1E2: Seeing is Believing � We�ve Got Game (with Audio Descriptions)

tvShows.description: What�s it like to live with blindness in Singapore? Look through the eyes of 6 visually impaired individuals and see for yourself.
tvShows.title: Seeing Is Believing

tvShows.teaserText:
In recent years, Asia has been trying to clean up its reputation as the world�s most polluting region. This documentary series casts the spotlight on a new breed of eco-warriors who are driving a green revolution in the region. They are neither activists, nor scientists but heirs to prominent family empires. These successors are less concerned with their inheritance, than the world, which future generations will be inheriting.

The series profiles three young scions who are seeking to transform their family businesses into models for sustainable development. We follow them as they overcome obstacles � sometimes from within their ranks, to implement industry-wide solutions and prove that sustainability and profitability can indeed go hand-in-hand.

teaserVideo.caption: Eight years ago, Kia Jiehui left her father�s engineering firm to join an NGO. She�s now back with her dad, and with a mission. To green the industry, not just for the environment, but workers too.
teaserVideo.title: Sense and Sustainability - S1E2: A Cleaner Future

tvShows.description: Follow three successors of family empires, on their quest to green their businesses and build a more sustainable future.
tvShows.title: Sense and Sustainability

tvShows.teaserText: Four artists are given mysterious missions to create new works of art based on the forgotten journeys of four 19th century ships that forever changed Singapore's history. From the swashbuckling tales of Singapore's first anti-piracy steamship, to a haunting vessel that brought the first convicts to Singapore to serve as laborers, the task has fallen on these artists to unearth the stories of these ghost ships from the past, and bring them back to life as unique pieces of art. What will they learn, and through that, what will they create? What will looking through the portholes of history tell us about our own past and how we've come to be? Weigh the anchor, raise the sails, and prepare for one hull of an adventure into the past.

teaserVideo.caption: Digital illustrator Andre Wee reconstructs the Fame, the ship that carried all of Raffles' belongings when he left SE Asia for good. What can this ship tell us about the man who founded Singapore?
teaserVideo.title: Ships That Shaped Us - S1E4: Restoring The Fame

tvShows.description: Videos on demand. Watch the best of CNA documentaries and current affairs programmes on Singapore, Asia-Pacific and elsewhere in the world.
tvShows.title: Ships That Shaped Us

tvShows.teaserText:
COVID-19 has proven to us that human beings yearn to be part of nature, and being in the great outdoors is also much safer than enclosed spaces.

Show Me the City: On the Wild Side highlights the hidden wonders of nature in Singapore. We showcase the city�s lesser-known and surprising green side, uncovering nature-filled nooks and crannies while profiling quirky individuals who love nature.

From an obstacle course set in a jungle that was previously home to a horse racing track to essential bushcraft skills and even macrophotography of the scariest critters ever, the series has something for everyone!

teaserVideo.caption: Daniel Sid turns nature into a playbox by enjoying Forest Play with little adventurers, being awed by stunning macrophotography of insects and kayak fishing at a secret spot.
teaserVideo.title: Show Me The City - S2E2: Let�s Play Outside

tvShows.description: Show Me the City is back � this time, on the wild side! Through nature�s hidden wonders, we play, explore our heritage, heal our soul and see how nature and science comes together.
tvShows.title: Show Me The City

tvShows.teaserText: Singapore is a very different city by night. Using special night-sensitive cameras, we take you on a jaunt from dusk to dawn to meet a unique cast of characters. For them, the night is their special playground. Filmed over a span of five months, this 90-minute feature documentary takes us into the lives of cheerful club bouncers, obsessive durian-hunters, dedicated wildlife biologists, and other colourful characters who inhabit the night. Hear from one of the last remaining fishermen in Singapore and an astronomer looking for the darkest spots in the world's most light-polluted country - and you will understand why the night has a special charm for them. Let's not forget some very special folks, our very own "superheroes" of Singapore. Find out why Antman, Catwoman, Moonlighter, Sabermom, and Freegan love the night. Check them out in "extras".

teaserVideo.caption: Using new night-sensitive cameras, we take you on a jaunt across the island from dusk till dawn to meet some unique Singaporeans who reveal themselves only at night. You will see the places they live, work and play in an entirely different light.
teaserVideo.title: Singapore After Dark: Where Night Is Their Playground

tvShows.description: Using new night-sensitive cameras, we take you on a jaunt across the island from dusk to dawn to meet some unique Singaporeans who reveal themselves in the night. You will see the places they live, work and play in an entirely different light.
tvShows.title: Singapore After Dark

tvShows.teaserText:
In a city where many are workaholics, Singapore is often touted as boring with �no life�. Singapore After Work dispels the notion by featuring the lesser-known stories of ordinary salary folks and how they pursue unique passions outside office hours.

Among the myriad of anecdotes: a software developer hunts down tiny creepy crawlies after dark. A graphic designer takes makes time beyond work to clean and groom terminally ill patients. A marketing consultant tries to keep the food heritage of indigenous people alive, and an oncology nurse makes dreams come true for children with critical illnesses.

teaserVideo.caption: Food technologist Samantha Liew volunteers for Back Alley Barbers to serve migrant workers while award-winning photographer Edwin Koo runs a community project taking portraits of the elderly.
teaserVideo.title: Singapore After Work - S1E5: Community Calls

tvShows.description: Singapore After Work uncovers the intriguing worlds of ordinary salary folks who pursue unique passions outside office hours.
tvShows.title: Singapore After Work

tvShows.teaserText: Can our rich culinary heritage evolve with Singapore's rapid modernisation? Hear it from the people behind Singapore's food scene. We delve into their struggles, success and the realities of running a food business.

teaserVideo.caption: For Quan Fa and Edible Gardens, morning rush hour means working before sunrise to harvest fresh produce. This has been their routine for years. Bigger challenges are coming their way especially with Quan Fa's lease of contract ending. Is there still a future for organic farming in Singapore?
teaserVideo.title: Singapore Food Stories - S1E8: Super Foods

tvShows.description: Can our rich culinary heritage evolve with Singapore's rapid modernisation? Hear it from the people behind Singapore's food scene. We delve into their struggles, success and the realities of running a food business.
tvShows.title: Singapore Food Stories

tvShows.teaserText: The Singapore Green Plan 2030 is a whole-of-nation movement to advance the national agenda on sustainable development. It will chart Singapore�s green targets over the next 10 years. Divided into five pillars, it will be led by five ministries. Ministers from these ministries as well as Senior Minister Teo Chee Hean, Chairman of the Inter-Ministerial Committee on Climate Change, delivered speeches under a Joint Segment on Sustainability in Parliament. Their speeches addressed some of their targets and their initiatives. We bring you the highlights.

teaserVideo.caption: How will the Singapore Green Plan 2030 help spark the mindset change needed to ensure a resilient future for Singapore?
teaserVideo.title: Singapore Green Plan 2030: Highlights from Parliament - S1: Singapore Green Plan 2030: Highlights from Parliament 2

tvShows.description: What does the Singapore Green Plan 2030 mean for Singapore? What are the initiatives planned by the five ministries behind the five pillars of the Plan? We bring you highlights from Parliament.
tvShows.title: Singapore Green Plan 2030: Highlights from Parliament

tvShows.teaserText: Beyond Singapore�s main ethnic groups of Chinese, Malays and Indians, there are many smaller groups who have been part of our rich cultural heritage going back to the 1800s. As Singapore celebrates her bicentennial, we look at four such communities � the Arabs, Parsis, Jews and Armenians � who form a tiny but important part of our vibrant mosaic. The series will provide a peek inside the lives of eight individuals, showcasing how they have integrated into Singapore society while still preserving their own cultural identity.

teaserVideo.caption: For 200 years, the Arabs and the Armenians have built a bond with Singapore. We examine what it takes for them to preserve that legacy and heritage today.
teaserVideo.title: Singapore Mosaic - S1E2: Arabs & Armenians

tvShows.description: On Singapore's bicentennial year, we look at four communities that have helped make up our vibrant mosaic - the Arabs, Parsis, Jews and Armenians.
tvShows.title: Singapore Mosaic

tvShows.teaserText:
Singapore on Film explores the earliest footage of Singapore, dating back to 1900. The films include 'Coolie Boys' and 'Ananas', filmed more than 100 years ago by the Pathe Brothers. Much of this remarkable archive has never been seen before, and has been specially restored and digitised by the British Film Institute.

This fascinating archive shows that Singapore was a multi-cultural melting-pot, but life was grindingly hard for the majority. We see coolie dockers, rickshaw pullers, Sikh policemen and child labourers. Rare films of a grand Peranakan funeral and Hindu fire-walking show scenes both familiar and unfamiliar. Newly-discovered home movies shine an intimate light into the lives of the elite.

Through interviews with historians, writers and filmmakers, we reveal stories both epic and intimate. The programmes are narrated by renowned British actress Jenny Agutter, with the archive brought vividly to life through cutting-edge graphics and an evocative, specially-composed score.

teaserVideo.caption: Singapore in the early 1900s, the height of colonial rule. We see coolies sharing lunch, mourners at a grand funeral and Europeans having tea - brought vividly to life in these rare archival films.
teaserVideo.title: Singapore on Film - S1E1: A Vanished World

tvShows.description: This 2-part special brings to life the earliest footage of Singapore from 1900. Specially restored and digitised by the British Film Institute, this is Singapore history that's never been seen before.
tvShows.title: Singapore on Film

tvShows.teaserText: Minister of Education and Second Minister of Finance, Lawrence Wong, participated in a dialogue session at the Institute of Policy Studies� Singapore Perspectives Conference 2021. He spoke on the many challenges which have arisen from the COVID-19 pandemic and how these have been and are being dealt with as well as the possible pathways ahead as we look to the future.

teaserVideo.caption: A dialogue session with the Minister of Education Lawrence Wong on the many challenges which have arisen from COVID-19, the disruption caused by the pandemic, and how these have been and are being dealt with.
teaserVideo.title: Singapore Perspectives 2021: Dialogue With Minister Of Education Lawrence Wong

tvShows.description: Minister Lawrence Wong participated in a dialogue session at IPS�s Singapore Perspectives Conference 2021. He spoke on the challenges presented by the COVID-19 pandemic and the pathways ahead.
tvShows.title: Singapore Perspectives 2021

tvShows.teaserText: In the four years since Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong announced Singapore's Smart Nation plan, the city has placed considerable resources into making this a reality. Infrastructure has been built, ecosystems have been developed and the framework for innovation has been laid out. At the same time, technological advances in the fields of robotics, artificial intelligence, bio-technology, the Internet of Things, quantum computing and virtual reality are already changing the way human beings live, work, play and communicate. In this one-hour special, we take a look at what the Smart Nation initiative means to the people whose ideas and ideals pave the way for Singapore's smart future. What would an APP that chats with you in Singlish, while predicting bus arrival times, look like? How can citizens co-create their neighbourhood? How are data scientists helping local NGOs do their work better? How is Singapore contributing to the quantum revolution? Find out in Singapore Reimagined.

teaserVideo.caption: Singapore Reimagined is a stock-take of the country's Smart Nation initiative, and what it means to the people whose ideas and ideals make up the city's smart future.
teaserVideo.title: Singapore Reimagined - S1: Transforming Singapore Through Technology

tvShows.description: Singapore Reimagined is a stock-take of the country's Smart Nation initiative, and what it means to the people whose ideas and ideals make up the city's smart future.
tvShows.title: Singapore Reimagined

tvShows.teaserText:
From business to politics, health to technology, we bring you up-to-date with the latest news on Singapore and analyze how these events may affect you tomorrow.

Daily 10 � 11pm (SIN/HK)

teaserVideo.caption: From business to politics, health to technology, we bring you up-to-date with the latest news on Singapore and analyze how these events may affect you tomorrow.
teaserVideo.title: Singapore Tonight - S1E11: Tue 11 Jan 2022

tvShows.title: Singapore Tonight

tvShows.teaserText:
More open-minded, driven and idealistic than their predecessors.
These are synonyms to describe Millennials � those born between 1991 and 2001. With more than 1.2 million of them in Singapore, they are destined to change the way we live, work and play.

What does this mean for the rest of us as we navigate alongside them? From designing mobile applications to better the lives of senior citizens, to bringing gourmet cuisine in a traditional hawker setting as well as getting down and dirty repairing vintage vehicles. Watch how they inject new life, reinvent old classics and defy all odds to achieve their goals.

Experts and parents weigh in as to how they tackle unconventional ideas when handling Millennials who challenge the status quo.

Slackers, Shockers, Suits and Superheroes explores the psyche of 8 aspiring young Singaporeans from different industries, all geared up to be game changers and trendsetters of their generation.

teaserVideo.caption: Millennials have been described as more open-minded, driven and idealistic than their predecessors. With more than 1.2 million of them in Singapore, what does this mean for the rest of us?
teaserVideo.title: Slackers, Shockers, Suits and Superheroes: Understanding Our Millennials

tvShows.description: Millennials have been described as more open-minded, driven and idealistic than their predecessors. With more than 1.2 million of them in Singapore, what does this mean for the rest of us?
tvShows.title: Slackers, Shockers, Suits and Superheroes

tvShows.teaserText: Embark on a mouth-watering journey through the slums of Asia, the last places on earth you would expect to find delicious foods. This unique documentary series celebrates the flavourful, and often unknown dishes made by talented cooks in the slums of Manila, Bangkok, Mumbai, Jakarta, Phnom Penh and Kota Kinabalu. Using cheap and overlooked ingredients, they cook up scrumptious dishes that are famous within the slums. Their passion and resilience prove that good food need not be expensive. From waterfall pork to sea urchin rice and even grilled stuffed frogs with pork, a gastronomical adventure awaits you. The cooks will even take you on a tour of their lives in the hoods. So what are you waiting for?

teaserVideo.caption: Meet Dharavi slum's most famous Chinese-Indian cook serving delectable fusion treats with his signature sauce, and an idliwalla who shares his secret recipes for fluffy idlis and crunchy vadas.
teaserVideo.title: Slumfood Millionaire - S1E6: Dharavi, Mumbai

tvShows.description: Does good food have to be expensive? Meet talented cooks from slums in the region and discover how they turn cheap and sometimes overlooked ingredients into delicious meals.
tvShows.title: Slumfood Millionaire

tvShows.teaserText: Today, more than half of the world's population live in cities, and this number keeps on growing. If we want to continue enjoying life in cities then cities have to become smarter. In Smart Cities 2.0, architect Jason Pomeroy travels to 8 distinct cities to find out just how smart these cities are.

teaserVideo.caption: Amsterdam, The Netherlands
teaserVideo.title: Smart Cities 2.0 - S1E8: Amsterdam, The Netherlands

tvShows.description: Today, more than half of the world's population live in cities, and this number keeps on growing. If we want to continue enjoying life in cities then cities have to become smarter. In Smart Cities 2.0, architect Jason Pomeroy travels to 8 distinct cities to find out just how smart these cities are.
tvShows.title: Smart Cities 2.0

tvShows.teaserText:
One in four people in the world suffer from mental health issues at some point in their life. It�s an elusive and lonely battle that few wish to talk about; but many form opinions on. So, what constitutes our mental health? Why does society shun conversations about and around the states of mental health?

To find answers, we step into the world of four individuals dealing with different mental health issues, and listened. Strangers In My Head is a 4-part documentary series that journals the perspective of each individual as they reveal the layers of their relationship with mental health issues and what being �normal� means to them.

This is an intimate introspection, an attempt to articulate the frustration, the guilt and the fatigue. Ultimately, through the many confusing voices and labels, they seek to assert their strength, identity and place in society.

teaserVideo.caption: Jess has reconciled with the difficult childhood years that triggered co-morbid mental health issues. As her outlook in life transforms, she is ready to accept herself and celebrate her journey.
teaserVideo.title: Strangers In My Head - S1E4: The Mind�s Chaos

tvShows.description: Follow four individuals as they quietly examine and search for their identity and place in society, amidst their ceaseless strife with different mental health issues.
tvShows.title: Strangers In My Head

tvShows.teaserText:
Earlier this year, netizens caught a composer from India plagiarising a Singapore national day song - "Count on Me, Singapore". His claim that he came up with the tune first, sparked incredulity in most Singaporeans but also planted the seeds of doubt in others: Could our beloved national day song possibly be a copycat? The doubt betrays just how little some Singaporeans know about the backstory of our national songs.

In this two-parter, award-winning singer-songwriter and one of lead singers of the 2021 national day theme song, Shabir, goes on a journey to document the origins of some of Singapore's most beloved national tunes. He uncovers how, from next to nothing, the republic came to possess such a repertoire of national songs and exposes a few skeletons in the island's collective closet along the way.

teaserVideo.caption: Home�s melancholic tune and opening lyrics, �Whenever I am feeling low�, got NDP organisers in 1998 thinking it was too much of �a downer� for a National Day song. But it�s become many Singaporeans� favourite. What�s yours?
teaserVideo.title: Striking A Chord: The Songs That Made Singapore - S1E2: Kit Chan on NDP song Home: �Whenever I am feeling low' was  thought a terrible start

tvShows.description: Singer-songwriter Shabir traces the genesis of Singapore�s most beloved national tunes and exposes a few skeletons in our closet along the way.
tvShows.title: Striking A Chord: The Songs That Made Singapore

tvShows.teaserText:
Terrorism around the world has been perpetrated by different kinds of extremist actors, with different ideologies and different methods of attack. But they have the common aim to break down unity, to sow discord and distrust among communities. Regardless of attacker and victim, the result is not only the devastation of lives and frequently, property but potentially, the destruction of community, the shared sense of identity. Here in multi-cultural, multi-ethnic Singapore, if and when we face a terror attack, can we recover from it successfully? Do we have what some other communities have, such as Manchester, Surabaya and Christchurch which have all demonstrated resilience and cohesion in rebuilding after horrific and tragic attacks? What can we learn from them?

Brought to you by Ministry of Home Affairs (MHA)
tvShows.description: A common aim of terrorism is to sow discord and distrust among communities. In Singapore, do we have what some other communities have, to be resilient and to recover from an attack successfully?
tvShows.title: Stronger Together

tvShows.teaserText: Singapore is facing a new threat. The infection has a name - COVID-19, but nobody really knows how it started and where it is going to strike next. But Singapore is rallying together to fight this invisible enemy. From everyday heroes on the frontline to businesses keeping it going, the island is fighting back. Because in such a battle, we will only be stronger, if we stay together.

teaserVideo.caption: How do you respond to an enemy that you can't see? A look at how Singapore is uniting to take on the new threat of COVID-19.
teaserVideo.title: Stronger: The Battle Against COVID-19: Singaporeans Unite Against Virus Attack

tvShows.description: How do you respond to an enemy that you can't see? How Singapore is uniting to take on the new threat of COVID-19.
tvShows.title: Stronger: The Battle Against COVID-19

tvShows.teaserText: Is 80 the new 50? Super Octogenarians tracks down spunky seniors who are working way past their retirement age, and redefining the notion of active ageing. We travel across Asia to witness how these gutsy seniors are debunking the stock images we have of the old, and inspiring all with the tremendous energy they put into their extended professional lives. From Singapore, Japan, China, India, Indonesia, Taiwan and Thailand, 8 octogenarians show us how age is just a number, and the world is still their oyster - 8 decades and more later. In the series, we also invite 8 of Asia�s most exciting photographers to share the compelling worlds of these super octogenarians. The photographer�s task: to come up with a series of photographs based on the theme NEVER TOO OLD. Through this collaboration, they befriend each other, and the young come to see the world through the eyes of the old. The end result is often heartwarming as it is meaningful. And the photographs will surprise everyone.

teaserVideo.caption: Once a runner in her teens, Pan Shiu-Yu picked up the sport again in her 60s to strengthen her ailing knees. Against the odds, she trained her muscles well enough to avoid surgery, and even took up competitive running once again. Her plan is to keep running and breaking records into her 90s.
teaserVideo.title: Super Octogenarians - S1E8: The Unstoppable Granny

tvShows.description: Across 8 episodes, Super Octogenarians track down spunky seniors working way past their retirement age and redefining ageing. How will their collaboration with younger photographers change our perceptions of growing old?
tvShows.title: Super Octogenarians

tvShows.teaserText:
More than 9 million people worldwide are affected by COVID-19, stretching health systems and changing our way of life. But how are vulnerable economies with limited resources responding to this battle of survival?

CNA traverses the globe, to Pakistan, Philippines and Bangladesh to discover harsh realities confronting societies that are embattled by the deadly virus.

We investigate the economic, social, political and psychological impact of the pandemic, while observing communities fighting back through technology and human ingenuity.

teaserVideo.caption: Thousands of deaths, crumbling economies and the social fabric of society shattered. Can the developing world survive COVID19?
teaserVideo.title: Survival: Developing Countries On The Frontline: The Impact Of COVID-19

tvShows.description: Thousands of deaths, crumbling economies and the social fabric of society shattered. Can the developing world survive COVID19?
tvShows.title: Survival: Developing Countries On The Frontline

tvShows.teaserText: Newly-appointed Deputy Prime Minister Heng Swee Keat sits down with members of the Singapore media to talk about his priorities as DPM, the areas of focus with the 4G, and his plans to strengthen our relationships in the region as well as internationally, all in order to take Singapore forward.

teaserVideo.caption: Newly appointed Deputy Prime Minister Heng Swee Keat sits down with members of the Singapore press to talk about his priorities as DPM, and the areas he will be focusing on to take Singapore forward.

tvShows.description: Newly-appointed Deputy Prime Minister Heng Swee Keat sits down with members of the Singapore press to talk about his priorities as DPM and the areas he will be focussing on to take Singapore forward.

She picks out a pair of jeans, a long-sleeved black top, a midi floral skirt, a jade formal long-sleeve shirt and a little black dress. With accessories and layering, she creates 10 different #OOTDs (Outfits Of The Day).

teaserVideo.title: Talking Point 2021/2022 - S1E33: Should We Ban Smoking In Homes?

tvShows.description: With a fresh approach to tackling the issues of the day, Talking Point investigates a current issue or event- offering different perspectives to local stories and reveals how it all affects you.

tvShows.teaserText:
This five-part travelogue television series celebrates the diversity of ASEAN�s 10 member states. Join us as we take you on a journey that traverses across the region - on new roads and ancient paths - to locations outside ASEAN capitals.

Explore a side of the regional bloc not often seen by outsiders as our two Channel NewsAsia correspondents Jackson Board and Pichayada Promchertchoo delve into issues that are close to the hearts of the ASEAN people - innovation and entrepreneurship; nature and conservation; communities and culture; textiles; as well as agriculture and food security.

There�s no better way to experience one of the world�s most vibrant and dynamic regions. So come with us on this remarkable journey that captures the stories and lives of the many different people who have made their homes in Southeast Asia a rich tapestry.

teaserVideo.caption: In rapidly developing ASEAN, agricultural development is still transforming lives and communities - from growing coffee to beat back opium production and poverty in Northern Thailand to tapping research to improve food security in Singapore.
teaserVideo.title: Tapestry: The Heart of ASEAN - S1E5: ASEAN's Bountiful Harvest

tvShows.description: Celebrate the diversity of ASEAN's 10 member states with this five-part series. Journey on new roads and ancient paths to a side of the regional bloc not often seen by outsiders, and delve into issues that are close to the hearts of the ASEAN people.
tvShows.title: Tapestry: The Heart of ASEAN

tvShows.teaserText: Commentators, journalists, TV producers and content creators from the region will share their take on what ASEAN means to them. What are the similar threads and distinct differences of the ASEAN narrative that is home to more than 620 million?

teaserVideo.caption: Film maker Abdul Zainidi�s dream � to place his short films and Brunei on the world map. He is joined by entrepreneurs like Ho Jia Jian at Viddsee, a Singapore based start-up, who are streaming ASEAN films to audiences and bring the world to Southeast Asia.
teaserVideo.title: The ASEAN I Know - S1: Films � a window to ASEAN

tvShows.description: Commentators, journalists, TV producers and content creators from the region will share their take on what ASEAN means to them. What are the similar threads and distinct differences of the ASEAN narrative that is home to more than 620 million?
