tvShows.teaserText: From drug trafficking to gold smuggling to dealing in battlefield weapons, there was no criminal venture that Paul LeRoux would not embark on. We reveal for the first time how one man ran a criminal empire spanning the globe from his penthouse in the Philippines, and became the world�s most prolific, yet least known crime boss. For too long LeRoux was able to hide behind a cloak of computer encryption, protected by corrupt officials and an army of hired killers. We reveal the astonishing sting operation that brought elite law enforcement agencies from the USA and Southeast Asia together to take down the Big Boss.

teaserVideo.caption: The chase is on to catch Southeast Asia�s biggest crime boss. This is the story of how the US and Southeast Asia's elite law enforcement agencies joined forces to take down The Big Boss and his global empire.
teaserVideo.title: The Big Boss: A 21st Century Criminal - S1E2: Well Played Gentlemen

tvShows.description: How one man ran a global empire from Southeast Asia, wreaking death and destruction. Watch the rise and fall of the most prolific criminal kingpin of the 21st century.
tvShows.title: The Big Boss: A 21st Century Criminal

tvShows.teaserText:
The Big Questions is an investigative series that explores some of the most pressing issues of our time. Anchored by a different expert host each week, the episodes pose the big questions centred on one big topic to some very original thinkers across the world to uncover their perspectives and predictions for the future.

In episode 1, we explore if the Internet of Things will become the Internet of Everything? Will it make life better for most of us, or will it be too much of a good thing? Host Gwendolyn Regina chats with some leading thinkers for answers.
In episode 2, we look at the future of work. Is complete automation inevitable, and are machines destined to take over all our jobs? What will it take for Singaporeans to remain relevant in the future?

Host Aaron Maniam talks to Stephen Wolfram, Frederick Laloux, and Ong Ye Kung to find out.

Lastly, is there enough care in healthcare? Host Rebekah Lin finds out if the Singapore healthare system is still fit for purpose.

teaserVideo.caption: Is the Singapore healthcare system still fit for service? Join host Rebekah Lin as she travels from Washington to Singapore to spend time with doctors, experts and policymakers to look for answers to her Big Question - Is there enough care in healthcare?
teaserVideo.title: The Big Questions - S1E3: The State of Healthcare

tvShows.description: What is the future of work? Will the Internet of Things become the Internet of Everything? Is there enough care in healthcare?  These are The Big Questions raised by hosts Aaron Maniam, Rebekah Lin and Gwendolyn Regina as they dig deep into these issues with some of the world�s original thinkers.
tvShows.title: The Big Questions

tvShows.teaserText: There�s a dark side to the internet, and you probably don�t even know it exists. Go behind the positive veneer of social media, communication apps and platforms that have made our lives easier and more connected, and you�ll find criminals using the same apps and platforms to run illicit and dangerous activities. Sextortion syndicates target global victims through social media. Illegal wildlife trades thrive on social consumer marketplaces. Digital black markets operate anonymously using software designed for press privacy and freedom. Secret child pornography rings run rampant in secret, closed groups and private chats.

teaserVideo.caption: It was one of 640 million closed groups on Facebook. Hiding behind the anonymity, the creator of child pornography group Loli Candy and its 7,000 members hid their activities on Facebook and WhatsApp.
teaserVideo.title: The Dark Web - S1E4: The Candyman

tvShows.description: There�s a dark side to the internet. Look deeper and discover sextortion syndicates, black markets, illegal wildlife traders and secret child pornography rings that thrive on social media and apps.
tvShows.title: The Dark Web

tvShows.teaserText:
Singapore has plans to phase out petrol vehicles and their internal combustion engines by 2040. The nation's only female race car driver and mother of two, Claire Jedrek, goes on a journey to find out what this means for not only car owners but the public transport and commercial sectors.

What are some of the common concerns over EVs and how will they be addressed? What are the benefits beyond environmental ones? And more personally for Claire, will her kids enjoy the EV ride and will she still get as much thrill and joy out of driving a EV as she did with petrol cars? Expect a fun ride as she lifts the bonnet, kicks the tyres and gets behind the wheel of various EVs.

teaserVideo.caption: Singapore�s race car driver and mother of two, Claire Jedrek, goes on a journey to find out what the nation�s plans to switch from petrol vehicles to EVs will mean for all drivers and commuters.
teaserVideo.title: The Electric Race: Inside Singapore's Electric Vehicle Switch

tvShows.description: Singapore�s race car driver and mother of two, Claire Jedrek, goes on a journey to find out what the nation�s plans to switch from petrol vehicles to EVs will mean for all drivers and commuters.
tvShows.title: The Electric Race

tvShows.teaserText:
The concept of the family is often intrinsically linked to the fundamental trait of being Asian. In fact, some research has even proposed that the Asian family is �an individual�s religious, economic, political, and social core�. But how much of this still holds true today?
Set in the world�s fastest growing region, Asian families are changing along with the economic landscape. In some, gender roles have been reversed. In others, societal needs have had an impact. Yet, in all parts of the region, the need to hold on to the family as the core of the Asian existence continues amidst this struggle.
In a world�s first, we bring our cameras into the homes of families across the Asian region, and record these families through the course of 2 weeks. We witness their conversations, their struggles, their aspirations, their conflicts � all in the name of maintaining the family core.

teaserVideo.caption: Revelations unfold and new challenges emerge as we revisit the families more than two months after our last visit. In Singapore, the Su boys are back at school but mother Lesley faces the possibility of losing her job. In Delhi the Guptas' isolation is brightened up by unexpected news. In Wuhan, Wang Bin wants to expand his business due to cheaper shop spaces but his wife objects.
teaserVideo.title: The Family Affair - S5E5: Back Together Again

tvShows.description: Asian families norms and values are changing. The Family Affair, an experimental documentary, captures life as it happens in four homes across the region. The result - a truthful portrayal of how families are struggling to keep it together in these evolving and challenging times.
tvShows.title: The Family Affair

tvShows.teaserText:
It�s not YOLO. Neither is it FOMO.

The new type of travel � global experiential adventures that relieves a burn-out in life. A holiday that is equal part exploration of the world and equal part re-discovery of oneself.

Join Chef Anthony Yeoh as he embarks on an adventure not at tourist hotspots but real life destinations that shake him out of his comfort zone.

In Sri Lanka, he learns how to ride the waves and care for elephants in a sanctuary. Deep in the Royal Belum Rainforest in Perak, the Jehai Tribe imparts blowpipe wisdoms. Inspired by the lessons gleaned on his adventures, he returns to Singapore and sets himself up for what might be his biggest challenge yet � a half marathon.

teaserVideo.caption: Since losing about 60kg some years ago, jogging has been a huge part of Chef Anthony�s life. Now, he wants to up his game and attempt an ultramarathon. Will he be able to make it to the finish line?
teaserVideo.title: The Great Escapade - S1E4: The Finish Line

tvShows.description: Chef Anthony Yeoh gears up for an epic adventure. From sea surfing to working in an elephant sanctuary, from living with a Jehai tribe to running a half-marathon; will the journey make or break him?
tvShows.title: The Great Escapade

tvShows.teaserText:
Returning from his previous escapades in invigorating Sri Lanka and a historic Malaysian rainforest, Chef Anthony Yeoh embarks on new adventures at but one location - home.

In a time of where global travel is almost non-existent, Anthony finds alternative retreats and continues his explorations in Singapore. He steps out of his comfort zone and immerses in the lives of Singapore�s diverse communities.

He undergoes training with award-winning bodybuilders, joins a wildlife team on rescue and care missions, and rediscovers nature through forest bathing and foraging. Each experience is augmented with a dish that he celebrates with his newfound friends.

teaserVideo.caption: Pierogi - an elusive traditional Polish dumpling dish in Singapore's diverse gastronomic scene, and yet a staple at Chef Anthony's family gathering. He makes new Polish friends as they go in search of ingredients and discovers more about the provenance and culture of the dumpling that unites his family.
teaserVideo.title: The Great Escapade: Homebound - S1E4: The Polish Dumpling

tvShows.description: In a time of where global travel is almost non-existent, a new homebound escapade emerges. Chef Anthony continues his explorations as he gets acquainted with some of Singapore�s diverse communities.
tvShows.title: The Great Escapade: Homebound

tvShows.teaserText:
After almost 50 years, Jurong Bird Park is preparing to move to a new home in Mandai.

This is an exclusive behind-the-scenes look at the keepers tasked with planning the move for almost 4,000 birds, and the designers and engineers endeavouring to build them a one-of-a-kind home. It's an ambitious plan - a never-attempted-before design that involves immersive aviaries built with giant columns and a massive mesh. How will the architects and project managers navigate this challenge � and stay sane as problems mount and deadlines loom?

While construction goes on at Mandai, it�s business as usual at Jurong. Beyond the doors marked �Staff Only�, we meet the passionate keepers, curators, and veterinarians who nurse precious newborn King Penguins, match-make endangered eagles, while planning the big move down to the last detail.

teaserVideo.caption: The beloved Jurong Bird Park is moving to a new home in Mandai. With exclusive behind-the-scenes access, we meet the colourful residents and keepers as they take the first steps towards the big move.
teaserVideo.title: The Great Migration: A New Home For Asia's Largest Bird Park

tvShows.description: The beloved Jurong Bird Park is moving to a new home in Mandai. With exclusive behind-the-scenes access, we meet the colourful residents and keepers as they take the first steps towards the big move.
tvShows.title: The Great Migration

tvShows.teaserText: The real-life superhero might not be what you expect. They are in fact a pioneering class of scientists, clinicians continuously tinkering in tech labs across Singapore. Meet the heroes facing off against the world�s most pressing health issues, harnessing the incredible power of Artificial Intelligence.

teaserVideo.caption: The real-life superhero might not be what you expect. They are in fact a pioneering class of scientist, continuously tinkering in tech labs across Singapore. Meet the heroes facing off against the World's most pressing health issues, harnessing the incredible power of Artificial Intelligence.
teaserVideo.title: The Hidden Layer: Healthcare Trailblazers: Using AI To Battle Chronic Diseases

tvShows.description: Meet the medical heroes facing off against the world�s most pressing health issues, harnessing the incredible power of Artificial Intelligence.
tvShows.title: The Hidden Layer: Healthcare Trailblazers

tvShows.teaserText:
Up till the 1970s, Singapore's southern islands had vibrant island communities with unique identities. But today, names like Pulau Tekukor and Pulau Seringat have become largely unfamiliar to Singaporeans. Likewise, while reclamation has increased Singapore's land area by 25% in the last 200 years, some islands like Pulau Seking have been merged with other islands, and their names are now confined to history.

But there is still much to be learnt from the 40-plus islands making up Singapore today, and the people passionate about them. Dr Hamzah Muzaini is doing research on St John's Island and Lazarus Island to get people interested in cultural history; wildlife enthusiasts Ria Tan and Subaraj Rajathurai want to get Singaporeans excited about the diversity we still have; and ecologist Dr Lynette Loke has found a perfect way to marry development with sustainability. We also revisit traditions like kolek racing and bubu fishing to remind us about life as true-blue islanders.

teaserVideo.caption: Singaporeans don't often think of themselves as islanders - but the outlying islands are rich in cultural and social history. This feature gives us access to some of Singapore's most unique islands.
teaserVideo.title: The Islands That Made Us: The Forgotten Islands

tvShows.description: Singaporeans don't often think of themselves as islanders. But the outlying islands are rich in cultural and social history. This feature gives us access to some of Singapore's most unique islands.
tvShows.title: The Islands That Made Us

tvShows.teaserText: The bigger, grander, or more elaborate, the better. Even in funerals. Asian funerals are more than just status symbols for the living and deceased. The rituals also reveal secrets of what a culture cherishes in life - values, attitudes and beliefs. This two-part documentary examines sweet, sacred and shocking traditional Asian funeral practices. It also observes the people whose lives and livelihoods revolve around the business of grief. Professional mourners act as "cheer leaders" for the dead in Taiwan, while a community in the Indonesian highlands perform unusual death rites, where the dead "live" on as part of the mourning process.

teaserVideo.caption: We follow two icons of Taiwan's grief industry. One sells her tears. The other is a "cheerleader" for the dead. Nowadays, their craft seems a little at odds with society's more progressive outlook.
teaserVideo.title: The Last Rites - S1E2: Death For A Living

tvShows.description: We dig "six feet under" into the cultural meanings behind different death practices in Asia and meet the stars of these funerals.
tvShows.title: The Last Rites

tvShows.teaserText:
Climate change is more than a set of abstract projections and statistics. It is the daily reality for millions of people in Asia�s cities, villages and coasts. Witness how people on the frontlines of climate crisis confront the many challenges as it unfolds over 24 hours.

We follow these people as they deal with water shortage in the Mekong Delta and Jakarta, what coastal communities in Indonesia's Sumba island and the Sundarbans are doing as they face rapidly rising sea levels, the farmers in Vietnam looking for solutions to unprecedented long droughts, and families struggling with extreme heatwaves in Delhi's slums.

The Longest Day is a snapshot of Asia today - told through the voices of farmers, health workers, city residents and displaced families. By emphasising on-the-ground responses to complex challenges, the series is an empowering and relatable portrait of a diverse and resilient region.

teaserVideo.caption: The past five years have been the hottest ever recorded on our planet and global warming is only set to increase. By the end of the century, 75% of the world�s population will experience extreme heat and if current trends continue, whole regions of Asia will be rendered uninhabitable by direct heat. But for many, deadly heat is already part of their everyday lives.
teaserVideo.title: The Longest Day - S1E4: Heat

tvShows.description: Climate change is a daily reality for millions of people across Asia. This series captures life on the frontlines of water shortage, rising seas, drought and heatwaves as it unfolds over 24 hours.
tvShows.title: The Longest Day

tvShows.teaserText: Singaporean curator and scholar Peter Lee explores the history of four Southeast Asian empires that made their mark on the world. Travelling from Thailand, Myanmar, Cambodia to Indonesia, Peter explores ancient ruins, epic legends and vibrant traditions to chart the rise and fall of four distinct empires, and how their legacy still shapes cultures and identities in the region today.

teaserVideo.caption: 700 years ago, the Majapahit united Indonesia's isles to found a trading empire whose networks stretched across the globe. Curator and scholar Peter Lee charts its milestones and enduring legacy.
teaserVideo.title: The Mark Of Empire - S1E4: Majapahit

tvShows.description: Singaporean scholar and curator Peter Lee explores the rise and fall of Southeast Asia�s great empires and the mark they made in the region today.
tvShows.title: The Mark Of Empire

tvShows.teaserText:
A new breed of business minds discovers emerging opportunities in one of the fastest growing regions in the world. Like the traffic jams of Bangladesh, the fashion runways of Indonesia espousing modest fashion, the Esports arenas of Tokyo, high-tech sustainability farms of Singapore and the mammoth food manufacturing factories of Vietnam.

Five successful millennial CEOs and investors meet a wide spectrum of locals from the man on the street to big conglomerates and even legislators to discover the next big drivers of growth. Not your strawberry generation, they are entrepreneurs with a difference:

- Former private banker, Anna Haotanto, founder of three companies including The New Savvy and ABZD Capital

- Elijah Yang, founder of three companies including Launch I/O which invests in emerging technology

- Dinesh Balasingam, Regional Head of Business at Chope

- Hao Tran, CEO of Vietcetera Media

- Chris Chong, serial entrepreneur of Beeconomic fame

teaserVideo.caption: Necessity is the mother of invention in Singapore where sustainability tech is emerging as a vibrant sector. Dinesh Balasingam of Chope uncovers meat alternatives, food biotech and finance solutions.
teaserVideo.title: The Millennial Investor - S1E5: Sustainability Tech Singapore

tvShows.description: A new breed of business minds discovers emerging opportunities in unexpected industries like the halal economy, Esports and sustainability tech in one of the fastest growing regions globally.
tvShows.title: The Millennial Investor

tvShows.teaserText:
Negotiations are part of everyday life. From haggling at the market, asking for a pay raise, to navigating relationship issues, we do it all the time. But there are a few exceptional people who are trained in the art of negotiation - when the stakes are high. What secrets can the men and women who negotiate under the most extreme circumstances reveal?

Across four episodes, we meet negotiators who can talk down people armed with explosives, bargain with ruthless Somali pirates, deal with rebels who have stormed an embassy, and confront a notorious criminal threatening to kill a family of five. We get into the minds of the mediators involved in these life-and-death situations to understand what it takes to navigate a crisis, where one wrong move could prove deadly.

Each episode reconstructs the hostage crisis, retracing the thought processes of master negotiators as they buy time, build rapport and weigh their options as tensions escalate and nerves unravel.

teaserVideo.caption: This was one of Taiwan's biggest news stories ever - a South African diplomat's family taken hostage at home by Taiwan�s most wanted killer.
teaserVideo.title: The Negotiators - S1: Held hostage by Taiwan�s most wanted serial killer

tvShows.description: They face high-pressured situations as part of their job. Meet the uniquely-skilled people who have mastered the art of negotiating in high-stakes situations.
tvShows.title: The Negotiators

tvShows.teaserText: China's trillion dollar Belt and Road Initiative is already changing the world in profound ways, and this year, CNA continues its coverage of this monumental plan in the China-Russia economic corridor. China, Mongolia, Uzbekistan and Russia were once strong allies in the Cold War. Now, rapid transformation is happening in these countries, some of whom are still struggling to emerge from their communist past. How will the Belt and Road Initiative impact Mongolia and integrate it into China�s masterplan for the 21st century? How will the Stan countries go from land-locked to land-linked countries? What is the nature of the new strategic partnership between Russia and China? An alluring cocktail of travel intrigue, business stories and geopolitical analysis will be served up in this dynamic new series that undresses just what the BRI means for countries along the China-Russia economic corridor. Access all previous episodes of The New Silk Road Here

teaserVideo.caption: From strengthening their defences, to dominating the arctic. Russia and China are ramping up cooperation in a variety of areas. Their hardening alliance has raised eyebrows around the world.
teaserVideo.title: The New Silk Road - S5E4: China & Russia: Allies In A Contested World

tvShows.description: CNA's award-winning documentary series returns, uncovering developments on China's Belt and Road Initiative, along the China-Russia economic corridor.
tvShows.title: The New Silk Road

tvShows.teaserText:
Millennial Parents. Eco-consumers. Middle-Aged Men In Lycra (MAMILs).

Meet the next wave of consumers with a rising spending power.

In each episode, we explore a fast-growing consumer demographic in Asia, and gain intimate insights into the trends surrounding them:

- Why is the male grooming industry on the rise?

- How are companies bridging the divide to reach consumers in rural areas of China and India?

- What are the opportunities in Asia's Silver Economy?

- How are brands empowering today's tech savvy parents to raise their kids?

- What makes avid middle-aged cyclists attractive to lifestyle marketers?

Find out how businesses are developing a long-term brand relationship with these groups, with specific marketing strategies and product development with a digital twist.

teaserVideo.caption: Consumers all around the world are going green, and businesses are paying attention. From Singapore to Indonesia, check out how sustainable businesses are rising to the challenge.
teaserVideo.title: The Next Wave - S1E6: Eco-Consumers

tvShows.description: Millennial Parents. Middle-Aged Men in Lycra. Eco-consumers. New demographic groups with a rising spending power. Brands are stepping up their game in addressing their consumer needs.
tvShows.title: The Next Wave

tvShows.teaserText:
More than 60 million people infected and more than one and a half million dead, and then there is the economic devastation. Countries around the world are facing their biggest downturns in history, resuming international travel and trade is key to saving millions of jobs.

It's going to take the global village working together like never before to overcome COVID-19. What will it take to chart a course out of the pandemic? Join our correspondents in Asia for a look at a year none of us will forget.

teaserVideo.title: The Pandemic: One Year On - S1E5: Vaccine

tvShows.description: What will it take to chart a course out of the pandemic? Join our correspondents in Asia for a look at a year none of us will forget.
tvShows.title: The Pandemic: One Year On

tvShows.teaserText:
Archaeology is not only the study of the past, but also of the future.

Two hundred years on from Raffles' landing, a team of archaeologists are digging deep to unearth new artefacts that will reshape what we think we know about Singapore. The bicentennial commemoration has given them rare access to historical sites. From uncovering evidence of an ancient 14th century settlement at Fort Canning, to discovering forgotten relics of life in colonial Singapore at the Padang, and exploring forsaken ruins of World War 2, they are looking at Singapore with a long view, and adding to the national narrative for future generations.

In this series, we go into the field with these archaeologists - looking to the land and the seas in search of the chapters of history buried underwater, and deep below ground.

teaserVideo.caption: Buried beneath modern Singapore are physical scars from the battlefields of WW2 - corroded bullets, cartridges and personal artefacts that tell us about the fall of Singapore.
teaserVideo.title: The Past Beneath Us - S1E3: The War Years

tvShows.description: What stories lie buried beneath our feet, waiting to be revealed? 200 years from Raffles' landing, archaeologists are digging deep to unearth new artefacts, reshaping what we know about Singapore.
tvShows.title: The Past Beneath Us

tvShows.teaserText:
The Institute of Policy Studies' Singapore Bicentennial Conference examines the nation's 700 years as a bustling emporium connected to regional trade networks as well as the evolution of governance in a successful post-colonial state.

Historians and thought leaders discuss the global context of Singapore's history in light of the uncertain age that the world seems to have entered.

teaserVideo.caption: Highlights from the Singapore Bicentennial Conference, featuring Prof Wang Gungwu, Mr Ho Kwon Ping, Prof Farish Noor, Prof Tommy Koh.
teaserVideo.title: The Singapore Bicentennial Conference - S1: Highlights

tvShows.description: In light of the uncertain age that the world seems to have enter, historians and thought leaders at the IPS Singapore Bicentennial Conference discuss the global context of Singapore's history.
tvShows.title: The Singapore Bicentennial Conference

tvShows.teaserText:
Harlequin Ichthyosis is a rare genetic disorder that causes thick and scaly skin that is prone to cracking and constant infections. In the past, babies born with this condition rarely live beyond the first few days. Today, sufferers are able to lead normal and productive lives - but not without obstacles. From 2-hour long oil baths and constant moisturising, to stares and judgement from strangers, their struggles are physical, social and emotional.

Enter the lives of four individuals coping with Harlequin Ichthyosis in Singapore, Hong Kong and Vietnam. Three-year-old Zoe may have lost all her fingers due to the condition, but she's not lost her joy for life. Despite being visibly different, 13-year-old Aliya navigates the teenage years with grace. Two-year-old Ngoc Bich is an orphan in Vietnam, waiting for a family to adopt her. And 26-year-old Mui Thomas' achievements are proof that a fulfilling life is possible even with a lifelong condition.

teaserVideo.caption: Four individuals born with Harlequin Ichthyosis, a rare genetic disorder that causes thick and scaly skin prone to cracking and infections, find strength and hope in the face of the unknown.
teaserVideo.title: The Skin We Wear: Living With A Rare Skin Disorder

tvShows.description: Four individuals born with Harlequin Ichthyosis, a rare genetic disorder that causes thick and scaly skin prone to cracking and infections, find strength and hope in the face of the unknown.
tvShows.title: The Skin We Wear

tvShows.teaserText: They're scions of long-established family businesses in Asia who are charting their own course and raising the cachet. What motivates these heirs and younger leaders? How do they cope with family dynamics and transform old management wisdom into exciting new vision? Catch The Successors season 6, an insightful documentary series with 8 captivating stories. Meet Isabel Beng Tesoro who keeps younger customers hooked on heritage gift wares in the Philippines; Ee Soon Wei of The Royal Press who transforms one of the oldest surviving polyglot letterpress printing houses in the world to a hip hangout joint for creative entrepreneurs in Malaysia; Tan Yong Shao of Mahota Commune who creates a new holistic lifestyle retail concept in Singapore; rebellious successor Angjolie Mei who redefines funeral business while competing alongside with her mother; reluctant successor Fong Loo Fern of Singapore's oldest custom shirt maker CYC who wants to be a cut above others with her new online strategy.

teaserVideo.caption: The Ee family has been in the printing business since 1938. Ee Soon Wei, third generation heir, joined the company when the print business was in a decline. He took drastic actions to reimagine the stagnating print business and turned the aging factory into a creative hub.
teaserVideo.title: The Successors - S6E8: APW

tvShows.description: Catch The Successors season 6, an insightful documentary with 8 captivating stories on scions of long-established family businesses in Asia. What motivates these heirs and younger leaders? How do they cope with family dynamics and transform old management wisdom into exciting new vision?
tvShows.title: The Successors

tvShows.teaserText:
Channel NewsAsia Producers travel to the frontlines of terror in Asia to investigate the political, social and economic nerve centres of radicalism, and unearth the reasons fueling militancy and the aiding of non-state terror outfits in the region.

Our journey begins in Pakistan where a US-designated terrorist, Hafiz Saeed, is being mainstreamed through an election battle against progressive politicians aiming to stop him from winning constitutional power.

We then travel to Indonesia, the most populous Muslim country, where cyber radicalization of the Islamic State is being fought in schools and the web. Can they succeed?

Finally, we journey to the Philippines where a failure to rehabilitate internally displaced people of Marawi might spark a new wave of religiously motivated violence. Can economic programmes started by the military win the hearts and minds of the people to stop the re-emergence of the Islamic State?

teaserVideo.caption: Will a failure to reconstruct Marawi after the 5 month seige against the Islamic State fuel another ideological battle between local Muslims displaced by the war?
teaserVideo.title: The Terror Trail - S1E3: The Ashes of Marawi

tvShows.description: We journey to the front lines of terror in Asia to investigate how radical narratives are being countered through political, social and economic measures in a 3-part special.
tvShows.title: The Terror Trail

tvShows.teaserText: National war time hero Lim Bo Seng was on a daredevil mission to retake the Peninsular from the Japanese, a plot with the British Allies, when it was cut short by a betrayal. An investigation into the double agent, who leaked information on the Force 136's secret mission, to the enemy. Lim Bo Seng was to die in captivity after Japanese intelligence caught up with him and his men.

teaserVideo.caption: Lim Bo Seng and his men in Force 136, in a daredevil mission to retake the Peninsular from the Japanese, was cut short by a betrayal. An expose of the double agent, in a conspiracy with the Japanese, whilst still in the pay of his British masters, leading to the capture of Lim Bo Seng.
teaserVideo.title: The Traitor Within: The betrayal of Lim Bo Seng

tvShows.description: Lim Bo Seng and his men in Force 136, in a daredevil mission to retake the Peninsular from the Japanese, was cut short by a betrayal. An expose of the double agent, in a conspiracy with the Japanese, whilst still in the pay of his British masters, leading to the capture of Lim Bo Seng.
tvShows.title: The Traitor Within

tvShows.teaserText: It has been 2 years since Donald Trump was elected America�s 45th president. And with that, the term Fake News entered the public consciousness in a big way. Why are fake news stories so pervasive, popular and problematic? Is it because, as some experts suggest, fake news supports a strain of tribalism, an us vs them world view where consumers use fake news to reject views they do not agree with? From Europe to Southeast Asia, we look at how social fault lines (race, religion, social class, nationalism) can be further widened by disinformation and what we are doing about it.

teaserVideo.caption: How one of the poorest cities in Europe became the 'fake news capital of the world' - and (it's said) helped get Donald Trump elected.
teaserVideo.title: The Truth About Fake News - S1: Meet the trolls

tvShows.description: Fake News has entered public consciousness in a big way. Why are such stories so pervasive and problematic? How are social fault lines widened by fake news and what are ways to mitigate its effects?
tvShows.title: The Truth About Fake News

tvShows.teaserText:
Last year, the search for a vaccine for COVID-19 got underway worldwide, including here in Singapore at the Duke-NUS Emerging Infectious Diseases Programme.

The process is part detective work, part onerous research, part trial-and-error, with many moments of trepidation and some moments of triumph too. And the work isn�t over, even as some vaccines get approval and are being rolled out.

This programme tells the story of how vaccines are developed and addresses some of the facts and fictions, the issues and the collaborative efforts. Following closely the Singapore team, it will also incorporate the stories of some of the doctors and researchers working to save the lives of millions.

teaserVideo.caption: Human trials have started in Singapore and the Duke-NUS team is one step closer to producing a viable COVID-19 vaccine. However other researchers in other parts of the world are ahead in the race.    As the world waits with bated breath for a possible end to the pandemic, is a viable COVID-19 vaccine the answer? But creating a viable vaccine is just the first step; producing enough for everyone is a different mountain to climb. As Pfizer-BioNTech, Moderna and other first-generation vaccines become available, what happens to the ones that are a step behind?    Meanwhile, vaccine hesitancy and an ever-growing anti-vaccine movement could threaten to derail our path towards herd immunity through vaccination. Could this lead to prolonging the coronavirus pandemic?
teaserVideo.title: The Vaccine Quest - S1: Episode 2

tvShows.description: The development of vaccines for COVID-19 continues worldwide, including here at Duke-NUS. We follow the team of doctors and researchers and showcase the work that will save the lives of millions.
tvShows.title: The Vaccine Quest

tvShows.teaserText:
We film with US army veterans from Afghanistan and Iraq as they unpack the War on Terror. We also investigate why after trillions of dollars spent on the war; the US government is signing a deal with the Taliban. What caused this military stalemate? The hasty withdrawal has left a poorly trained Afghan Army incapable to fight the Taliban, who now control vast swathes of Afghanistan.

A wave of disappointment has swept across 800,000 Americans who served in these unwinnable wars since 2001. Countless American veterans now battle against the physical and mental scars of these wars on their own. This lack of support has translated into suspicion and hatred for their own government, leading to January 6th Insurrection Day riots.

Why are veterans joining white militias resulting in the FBI declaring them the biggest threat facing the United States today? We find out if America�s global wars have radicalized its own military men who are now bringing the war back home.

teaserVideo.caption: Through personal accounts of US war veterans from Afghanistan, we investigate why Afghanistan has been left at the mercy of the Taliban.
teaserVideo.title: The War Comes Home: The Cost of America's War on Terror

tvShows.description: Through personal accounts of US war veterans from Afghanistan, we investigate why Afghanistan has been left at the mercy of the Taliban.
tvShows.title: The War Comes Home

tvShows.teaserText: The Worlds of Georgette Chen is the first docudrama series on the influential Singapore artist. Starring Rui En as the titular character, go on a voyage across continents, spanning Shanghai, Paris, New York and Singapore and discover how Chen became a remarkable artist ahead of her time
tvShows.description: The Worlds of Georgette Chen is the first docudrama series on the influential Singapore artist. Starring Rui En as the titular character, go on a voyage across continents, spanning Shanghai, Paris, New York and Singapore and discover how Chen became a remarkable artist ahead of her time
tvShows.title: The Worlds Of Georgette Chen

tvShows.teaserText:
The COVID-19 pandemic is again bringing uncertainty, following the emergence of the Omicron variant in late 2021. Countries had been opening up and emerging from lockdowns, only to reimpose restrictions and closures.

But one exception is China, with its zero-tolerance approach. Beijing is determined not to let the pandemic affect its hosting of the Winter Olympics. 2022 sees another momentous event - the twice-a-decade party congress, expected to extend President Xi Jinping�s tenure for an unprecedented third term.

Countering China and building alliances in the Indo-Pacific continues to be a major focus for US President Joe Biden. We also examine Washington�s priorities in strengthening ties with its major allies - Japan and South Korea, as they in turn consider their bilateral relationship in the face of new leadership.

Leadership is in the spotlight too in Southeast Asia. The Philippines goes to the polls to elect a successor to President Rodrigo Duterte. In Malaysia, there are expectations that a general election will be called in 2022 to end the current political uncertainties. But for Myanmar, the way ahead remains unclear, a year after the military seized power.

teaserVideo.caption: With Singapore moving steadily towards a New Normal after some two years of COVID-19, how much will life change for people, businesses and industries? CNA's reporters look into what the future holds in 2022 and beyond.
teaserVideo.title: The Year Ahead 2022 - S1: The Year Ahead 2022: Singapore

tvShows.description: Our correspondents look ahead to the likely dominant issues of 2022 - from living with COVID-19 to China�s major year in sports and politics, and from building alliances to leadership challenges.
tvShows.title: The Year Ahead 2022

tvShows.teaserText: Discover the wild and surprising history of the Orchard precinct back in the 1960s, as never before. Our guides to this iconic precinct are 3 young, intrepid hosts � a musician, a fashion designer and a chef � who take us on their deep dives into the past to dig up insider secrets about its music, fashion and food scenes. Was there really a topless cabaret along Scotts Road? How did trendsetting boutiques and supermodel sisters start Orchard�s reputation as a shopping district? And did Singapore�s first unofficial hawker centre really start in a Orchard carpark? Our hosts turn their history lessons into original creations inspired by the good old days of Orchard�by writing a song and shooting a funky music video, designing a retro fashion collection and launching a fashion show, and lastly curating an unforgettable dinner experience for a select few that marries Indian Mee Siam, Loh Gai Yik, Shashlik Kebab and many more.

teaserVideo.caption: Was Singapore�s first hawker centre really a carpark on Orchard Road? Chef Ivan Yeo goes back into the precinct�s food history to curate a dinner experience that captures these flavours on a plate.
teaserVideo.title: There's Something About Orchard - S1E3: Downlow On Foodie History

tvShows.description: Discover the wild history of the Orchard precinct. 3 intrepid hosts, a musician, a fashion designer and a chef take us into the past as they dig up secrets about its music, fashion and food scenes.
tvShows.title: There's Something About Orchard

tvShows.teaserText:
Four hard-of-hearing individuals � a boy going for ear surgery, a teenage athlete rising in her bowling career, a young dancer, and an accomplished pianist � let us into their lives to understand the challenges and misconceptions of the world of the deaf.

Four-year-old Dylan is scheduled for an ear implant surgery that could change his life forever, and his parents are filled with trepidation. Kimberly is a rising bowler from the Singapore Sports School who is competing at the biggest national tournament for the abled. Roseanne breaks new barriers for her community as a deaf dancer. And Dr Azariah is an accomplished performing musician who is coping with ongoing hearing loss.

The series is a quiet study of their everyday lives and struggles, as well as their triumphs and observations. The episodes are accompanied by a special soundscape to draw us closer into their world, and to appreciate what it is that they really hear.

teaserVideo.caption: �Of all things, he had to choose something that he was weakest in.� As a young boy, music was Azariah Tan�s passion � and he wasn�t going to let his disability get in the way of becoming an internationally lauded pianist.
teaserVideo.title: This is What I Hear - S1: Music of the heart

tvShows.description: Four hard-of-hearing individuals � a boy going for ear surgery, a teenage bowler, a young dancer and an accomplished pianist � help us navigate the misconceptions of their world.
tvShows.title: This is What I Hear

tvShows.teaserText: Koreans are one of the fifty-six ethnic groups in China. A good number of them live in the northeastern part of China, right at the border with North Korea. With tensions rising between the two long-time allies, what is life like in the border regions? Has the North Korean missile and nuclear tests raised fears? Do the residents� Korean roots and ties affect how they see the threat of conflict? Jeremy Koh, CNA�s China correspondent, makes a trip to the Changbai Korean Autonomous County in Jilin Province to see the human impact of the deteriorating relations.

teaserVideo.caption: With tensions rising between North Korea and the world, here�s what life is like for China�s ethnic Koreans living � literally � a stone�s throw across the river. Watch the full episode of #ThisSideOfTheBorder here.
teaserVideo.title: This Side of The Border - S1: Living across the river from North Korea

tvShows.description: Koreans belong to one of the fifty-six ethnic groups in China. A good number of them live in the northeastern part of China, right at the border with North Korea. With tensions rising between the two long-time allies, what is life like in the border regions?
tvShows.title: This Side of The Border

tvShows.teaserText: You need a break. You have a free weekend. And you�re in a mood for something different. You�re thinking river surfing in Riau, or maybe canyoning down a waterfall in Dalat. This Weekend is an essential travel guide for those looking for unique getaways in off-the-grid places around Asia.

teaserVideo.caption: On a Singapore staycation, model and online personality Fiona Fussi scares herself silly climbing a ship�s mast, cable skiing at night and getting airborne with a hydro jet.
teaserVideo.title: This Weekend - S2E6: Singapore Adventure Staycation

tvShows.description: The definitive travel guide for short weekend getaways in Asia. Features unique places, some off-the-beaten track where adventurous hosts explore and have fun over a weekend.
tvShows.title: This Weekend

tvShows.teaserText: We have arrived at a decisive moment in history. In the name of development and progress, Man�s relationship with the environment has gone beyond co-existence and co-operation, to exploitation and manipulation. Uncontrolled human intervention on the environment is pushing what was once a harmonious balance between Man and Nature to a precarious tipping point � one that will decimate the environment and humankind along with it. Clear evidence of the degradation can already be seen at the furthest reaches of civilization - in Antarctica. Now, citizens and states seek to tip the scales back to Earth�s favour. A global movement to reverse the damage and repair the earth needs to gain momentum� Or we risk destroying the very conditions that have enabled mankind to prosper.

teaserVideo.caption: Cities go carbon-free; trains run by wind energy and roads harness solar power. A global energy revolution has begun - to slow climate change and secure mankind�s survival.
teaserVideo.title: Tipping Point - S1E3: Power Trip

tvShows.description: An expedition to Antarctica galvanises eco-advocates in missions to battle climate change. Elsewhere, states and citizens across Asia and Europe face up to threats to water, food and energy resources.
tvShows.title: Tipping Point

tvShows.teaserText: To Live is an eight-part series about Asians who have overcome harrowing or life-threatening experiences. Our profiles have survived crashes, natural disasters, kidnapping, human trafficking and disease. We hear their accounts of what they went through and we see what their lives are like today.

teaserVideo.caption: What does it take to survive when nature unleashes hell?  Tsao was buried in the rubble of her home after an earthquake hit Taiwan. Her story is both tragic and inspiring. Devine battled the raging waters of a cyclone in the Philippines that engulfed her family�s home. Not everyone made it out alive.
teaserVideo.title: To Live - S1E8: Disaster

tvShows.description: To Live is an eight-part series about Asians who have overcome harrowing or life-threatening experiences. Our profiles have survived crashes, natural disasters, kidnapping, human trafficking and disease. We hear their accounts of what they went through and we see what their lives are like today.
tvShows.title: To Live

tvShows.teaserText: The road to the Olympics is paved with years of meticulous planning and a lot of discipline and effort. It is no different for para-athletes aiming for the Paralympics. How has the postponement of Tokyo 2020 due to the COVID-19 pandemic affected first-timers from Singapore? How do they feel about the �simplified� Olympics that�s on the cards? Meet five athletes and para-athletes aiming for their first Olympics and Paralympics. See how they are dealing with the situation and what drives them to continue aiming for their dreams.

teaserVideo.caption: The road to the Olympics is paved with lots of meticulous planning and a lot of discipline and effort. It is no different for para-athletes aiming for the Paralympics. But in this year of the COVID-19 pandemic, how has the postponement and possible cancellation of Tokyo 2020 affected those first-timers from Singapore? How do they feel about the "simplified" Olympics that is on the cards? We look at four athletes and para-athletes aiming for their first Olympics and Paralympics respectively, and see how they are dealing with the situation and what drives them to continue aiming for their dreams, through all the hard work, sacrifices and uncertainties.
teaserVideo.title: Tokyo Dreams: The Road To Tokyo 2020

tvShows.description: In this year of the COVID-19 pandemic, how are our athletes and para-athletes dealing with the uncertainties over Tokyo 2020? 5 first timers show us how they keep their Olympic and Paralympic dreams alive.
tvShows.title: Tokyo Dreams

tvShows.teaserText:
Singapore is geologically challenged and with climate change, a growing population and economic competition � the country needs land to develop. To overcome the pervasive space challenge, the country is investing in megaprojects that will help overcome these problems and take it into the next century.

In the first episode, we tunnel under and feature the USD $10 billion Deep Tunnel Sewerage System as it enters its second phase of construction. But tunnelling on such a scale comes with challenges and to build within such a restricted space, the team has to employ state of the art machinery and technology. Next, the series takes a closer look at Singapore�s solar masterplan. Renewable energies like solar require land and to meet its targeted energy output by 2030, planners have to relook how space can be utilized more efficiently. Lastly, the city of tomorrow is working to secure its economic future, by building the multi-billion dollar Tuas megaport that will rule them all.

teaserVideo.caption: Singapore has to secure its water supply for many generations to come but time is running out. AI-powered Tuas megaport and nature-imitating water filter innovations lead the way.
teaserVideo.title: Tomorrow City - S1E3: Water

tvShows.description: Singapore�s drive to remain competitive is hindered by land scarcity. This series explores the megaprojects that are changing Singapore�s physical landscape to create more space.
tvShows.title: Tomorrow City

tvShows.teaserText: What happens to all the waste we discard? Not everything lands up in the incinerator. Stuff like our mobile phones, refrigerators, e-waste or clothes? We imagine them being reused or recycled. But that's one side of the story. Presenter Jason Godfrey is on a mission to find out where our trash goes.

teaserVideo.caption: In this final episode, we go on a different kind of trail. We store our data on our hard drives and on cloud. Passwords, photographs, work documents. When you delete them, are they completely gone? What happens if you can't?
teaserVideo.title: Trash Trail - S1E5: Data

tvShows.description: What happens to all the waste we discard?
tvShows.title: Trash Trail

tvShows.teaserText: Meet China's biggest movers and shakers. They are ordinary men and women who have broken new grounds to transform the face of one of the world's oldest civilizations. But they're not just rags-to-riches businessmen - they are pioneers of new trends and technologies; razor sharp business moguls who saw a different future for China during some of its hardest times.

teaserVideo.caption: At 73, he entered a new business world and made a fortune - Lui Che Woo, the second richest man in China has made its latest fortune from the gambling business. But that's been just the last of a long list of ventures.
teaserVideo.title: Tycoons China - S1E8: Lui Che Woo, Galaxy Entertainment Group

tvShows.description: Tycoons China brings you into the lives of the contemporary business visionaries who are shaping the face of China and the world beyond.
tvShows.title: Tycoons China

tvShows.teaserText: CNA's award-winning investigative series Undercover Asia returns for the eighth season to uncover the hard truths in the underbelly of Asia, and help us understand the plight of the disenfranchised and the displaced.

teaserVideo.caption: In what is being called �The world�s biggest grave robbery�, more than 40 shipwrecks serving as mass graves to thousands of World War II soldiers have been illegally plundered by salvage crews.
teaserVideo.title: Undercover Asia - S8E10: Shipwreck Robberies (Indonesia)

tvShows.description: CNA's award-winning investigative series Undercover Asia returns for the eighth season to uncover the hard truths in the underbelly of Asia, and help us understand the plight of the disenfranchised and the displaced.
tvShows.title: Undercover Asia

tvShows.teaserText: Singaporeans may be familiar with world-beaters like Joseph Schooling. But there are many others whom we can be proud of too. These are individuals and groups - sportsmen, performers, artists - who have struck out on paths less travelled and made a name for themselves in their respective fields. They may not be recognised in Singapore but they are no less stars in their own right. This series unveils some of these lesser known high-achievers and looks at the passion that drives them and the commitment that makes them special.

teaserVideo.caption: They'd shed blood for their craft, defied gravity and fear, and almost given up in dejected exhaustion. But these two young men had a partnership forged in courage and determination, and the hearts of champions.
teaserVideo.title: Unusual Suspects - S1: Lion hearts: A partnership of two Singapore champions

tvShows.description: Singaporeans may be familiar with world-beaters like Joseph Schooling. But there are many other stars whom we can be proud of too. This series unveils some of these lesser known high-achievers and looks at the passion that drives them and the commitment that makes them special.
tvShows.title: Unusual Suspects

tvShows.teaserText: As the U.S. and Singapore commemorate 55 years of bilateral relations, we look at how this partnership has played a significant role in Singapore�s growth and progress. Even as the economy boomed with American MNCs setting up shop here, Singapore also collaborated with the U.S. in security and defence matters. Analysts, observers, and politicians discuss how bilateral relations have grown from strength to strength.

teaserVideo.caption: As the U.S. and Singapore commemorate 55 years of bilateral relations, we look at how this partnership has played a significant role in Singapore's growth and progress. Even as the economy boomed with American MNCs setting up shop here, Singapore also collaborated with the U.S. in security and defence matters. Analysts, observers, and politicians discuss how bilateral relations have grown from strength to strength.
teaserVideo.title: US-Singapore Relations At 55: US-Singapore Relations At 55

tvShows.description: Looking at 55 years of strong bilateral relations between the United States and Singapore.
tvShows.title: US-Singapore Relations At 55

tvShows.teaserText: As Asian societies hurtle towards urbanisation and modernisation, the chase for greater convenience, speed and efficiency never ends. Where then, does that leave our tradtional culinary heirlooms? Century-old dishes that demand time and patience, yet trigger collective memories of delight, and espouse the wisdom of health and nutrition. Aun Koh, better known for his moniker, Chubby Hubby, and one of Singapore�s foremost food bloggers, tracks down the guardians of these disappearing recipes. He uncovers the stories behind our changing food culture, as he learns to cook these dishes. Through creativity, Aun pays homage to these traditions by giving the foods a modern twist - entrenching them not only in history, but also in the here and now.

teaserVideo.caption: Made with a sauce that takes 30 days to perfect. An ingredient, 'grago' shrimp, that money often can�t buy because of sporadic supply. All the reasons why a Singapore Peranakan braised pork dish, Babi Tohay, is vanishing. Chef Malcolm Lee of Michelin-starred Candlenut Restaurant, shares his secrets.
teaserVideo.title: Vanishing Foods - S1E8: Pork Perfection - Babi Tohay

tvShows.description: Food blogger Chubby Hubby aka Aun Koh tracks down the guardians of heirloom recipes to learn how to cook the dishes before they vanish forever. He pays homage to these traditions with a modern spin on the dishes, to showcase how they have a place not only in history, but also in the here and now.
tvShows.title: Vanishing Foods

tvShows.teaserText: VenturePreneurs looks at the challenges that fledgling ventures face if they choose to go global and why some companies take the leap. Each of the 6 episodes follows one start up or small enterprise, making a foray into Asian countries and beyond. The series will look at the pivotal factors that entice them into this new environment. We will follow the founders of each company as they navigate key goals and examine whether they succeed in meeting the real-time challenges of product development and sales that they set for themselves. Each episode will get advice from venture capitalists and host a branding clinic to see if the founders are on the right track with their vision. Find out what it�s like for 6 companies doing business in 12 new cities while chasing a dream of creating a successful Asian brand.

teaserVideo.caption: Vault Dragon, a digital health solutions company, is expanding into three cities and launching two new services with only one person, the founder, at the helm. Will he succeed?
teaserVideo.title: Venturepreneurs - S1E6: Portable Healthcare Data

tvShows.description: VenturePreneurs looks at the challenges that fledgling ventures face if they choose to go global and why some companies take the leap.
tvShows.title: Venturepreneurs

tvShows.teaserText: Singapore's history began neither at independence in 1965, nor when Raffles stepped onto our shores in 1819. Between these two milestones, 19th century Singapore has a backlog of fantastical stories of vice and virtue - from colonial power struggles between the British and the Dutch to government sanctioned drug cartels and prostitution rings; Singapore was at the nexus of drug trafficking and yet is home to some of the earliest printed religious tomes in Southeast Asia. It is also the birthplace of the first English scientific journal of the region, and a social awakening autobiography written by a Malay scholar whom some saw as brown-nosing the British. Vice and Virtue uncovers forgotten stories of politics, opium trading, literature and prostitution through Singapore's first, earliest and extraordinary maps, letters, newspapers, journals and books in the National Library Board's Rare Collection.

teaserVideo.caption: From colonial power struggles to government sanctioned drug cartels and prostitution rings, 19th century Singapore is full of fantastic stories of vice and virtue. Academic and history buff Dr. Farish Noor takes us on a journey to uncover forgotten stories.
teaserVideo.title: Vice & Virtue: 1800s Singapore - S1: Forgotten stories from 19th century Singapore

tvShows.description: From colonial power struggles to government sanctioned drug cartels and prostitution rings, 19th century Singapore is full of fantastic stories of vice and virtue.
tvShows.title: Vice & Virtue: 1800s Singapore

tvShows.teaserText: From mountain peaks to underwater caves; to volcanic lakes and forest trails, join our hosts as they travel across six countries in Asia the way our forefathers did: on foot. Trekking off the beaten path, they discover and experience cultures and landscapes from an authentic perspective. Experiencing life like the locals, we pick tea leaves on a Sri Lankan plantation; venture into one of the world�s largest cave systems in Vietnam; walk with the Igorot in Philippines, where coffins hang off the cliffs. In Laos, embark on a deeply reflective journey through the Plain of Jars, and meet survivors of the world�s most bombed nation. Trek through giant cedars in Akita Japan, and follow the ancient path used by Samurais, and encounter the elusive Matagi hunters. This is Asia by foot. Join us and Walk This Way.

teaserVideo.caption: Deep within the mountains of Akita, Japan, lies a village of ancient hunters. Join Sharda Harrison on a journey to explore the Matagi way of life, meet expert craftsmen and get close to its famous mascot: the Akita dog.
teaserVideo.title: Walk This Way - S1E6: Japan Akita Hunters

tvShows.description: Feet on the ground and eyes to the sky. Explore Asia the way our forefathers did: on foot. Travel off the beaten path across six countries, and discover their native cultures and landscapes.
tvShows.title: Walk This Way

tvShows.teaserText: Just as the pundits think they�ve cracked the millennial conundrum, guess what - there�s a whole new puzzle waiting to be unravelled with a whole new cohort - Gen Z. So, what makes them tick? How do they see the world? As we attempt to decode a generation that is poised to steal the thunder from the world�s current obsession � Millennials � we will hear from stakeholders and experts, many of whom are still scratching their heads, trying to understand this new generation. And we will hear from the Gen Zs themselves, as they give us a first-hand account of how they are upsetting the current status quo, whether at work or at play.

teaserVideo.caption: Gen Zs want fun. Lots of fun. But Gen Zs are also serious about their fun and getting them to open their wallets won't be easy. What will it take?
teaserVideo.title: We Are Gen Z - S1E2: Gen Z... @Play

tvShows.description: Move over Millennials, make way for Gen Z. This is a generation that�s shaking up the status quo whether at work or at play. Join us as we hop across Singapore, Manila and Mumbai to decode Gen Z.
tvShows.title: We Are Gen Z

tvShows.teaserText: US China relations are at its worst in modern history. How are the historical forces of pride and shame driving the conflict? Understand China�s Century of Humiliation and discover how poverty in America is invoking anti-China public sentiment. As ties worsen, we discover communities in disarray, companies on the brink and countries compelled to thread a tightrope.

teaserVideo.caption: In 2019, Chinese students made up a third of the 1.1 million foreign students in the US. But with the US-China rivalry and racism on the rise, the visas of many Chinese students and scientists are now in danger.
teaserVideo.title: When Titans Clash - S1: Life for Chinese students and scientists in the US, amid tensions with China

tvShows.description: There are historical forces at play in ongoing US-China tensions. How do sentiments of pride and shame fuel the rivalry? And how might a Biden administration confront Beijing?
tvShows.title: When Titans Clash

tvShows.teaserText: Many of our childhood memories are filled with playing and playgrounds are a big part of this recollection. The wind blows through our hair while we are on a swing, the sudden rush of excitement going down a slide, bumps and bruises, friends and foes. The rapid urbanisation of Asia is spurring on the growth of playgrounds and play spaces where children and communities experience, learn and reimagine urban life. This five-part documentary series ex-amines how such play spaces impact the communities they are built for and reflect on the urban environments they exist in. Each hour-long episode journeys through various playgrounds and play spaces in Asia�Bangkok, Hanoi, Hong Kong, Sapporo, Seoul, Suncheon, Singapore, Tainan, Taichung and Taipei�to explore the role of play in cities. How do playgrounds reflect our society today and how do children play?

teaserVideo.caption: Playgrounds have evolved dramatically over the last two centuries. In this episode, we look at new age playgrounds that embody ideas about how children should have fun while preparing for the future.
teaserVideo.title: When We Play - S1E5: The Future of Play

tvShows.description: The series examines the importance of outdoor play, how play spaces impact our society and explores the role of play in cities. How do playgrounds reflect our society today and how do children play?
tvShows.title: When We Play

tvShows.teaserText:
The white supremacist movement is getting increasingly violent and anti-Muslim rhetoric is spreading fast across the world.

The most recent case in point- Christchurch killer Brenton Tarrant drew inspiration from white extremist attacks against Muslims in Norway, the United States, Sweden and the United Kingdom.

What are the reasons for this exaggerated fear, and at times hatred and hostility toward Islam and Muslims in white-majority countries? Research Institute New America Foundation says two in five Americans say Islam 'is incompatible with US values'.

CNA goes on a journey from Australia, Europe and America to investigate the specific methods these white supremacist groups rely on to appeal to their followers to subscribe to their chilling worldview.

Along the way, we embed with white Christian militias in America that perpetuate the fear of Muslims, and lax gun laws aiding such attacks. Can Muslims in the West reclaim their personal freedoms against rising mistrust?

teaserVideo.caption: What prompted white supremacist Brenton Tarrant to kill 50 Muslim worshippers in a mosque in Christchurch? We investigate the ideological structures that recruit and radicalise white men into saving �Western civilisation� from a foreign �invasion".
teaserVideo.title: Whiter Shade Of Terror - S1: The Rise Of Islamophobia

tvShows.description: What prompted white supremacist Brenton Tarrant to kill 50 Muslim worshippers in a mosque in Christchurch? We investigate the ideological structures that recruit and radicalise white men into saving "Western civilisation" from a foreign "invasion".
tvShows.title: Whiter Shade Of Terror

tvShows.teaserText:
The future is here. And it�s getting more complicated.

To help make sense of it all, host Joshua Lim returns with a brand-new season of Why It Matters.

From cheating death, to imitating nature, to roaming the brave new world of the metaverse, our inquisitive host explores the emerging technologies and trends on the horizon that would transform our lives.

Join him as he helps us decode the future, and uncover what matters in our increasingly complex world and why it matters.

teaserVideo.caption: Nature's genius has enriched mankind since ancient times. Joshua Lim goes on a journey to learn about innovations that have been inspired by nature. He meets researchers studying butterflies, termites and bats, and realises how their findings from the natural world could help us colour fabrics without dyes, cool our buildings sustainably, and build our immunity to infections.
teaserVideo.title: Why It Matters - S5E5: Nature To The Rescue!

tvShows.description: Acclaimed series Why It Matters returns with a brand-new season to decode the future.
tvShows.title: Why It Matters

tvShows.teaserText: A natural history event like no other, Wild City will reveal the hidden wild inside the Lion City. Deploying the latest filmmaking techniques and narrated by natural history legend Sir David Attenborough, this wildlife series will be an awakening for the eyes and the mind. See Singapore like never before!

teaserVideo.caption: Life is tough on Singapore�s waterways for wild younglings. Baby otters in the Botanic Gardens learn to swim and hunt while avoiding predators and rare ducklings struggle to survive thunderstorms.
teaserVideo.title: Wild City - S1: River World

tvShows.description: A natural history event like no other, Wild City will reveal the hidden wild inside the Lion City. Deploying the latest filmmaking techniques and narrated by natural history legend Sir David Attenborough, this series will be an awakening for the eyes and the mind. See Singapore like never before!
tvShows.title: Wild City

tvShows.teaserText: Magic happens when tech geeks get innovative. From shape-shifting robots to artificial smart skin, from souped-up helmets to supercharged houseplants, and much more. These tech wizards are working to unlock solutions to address myriad problems. And there�s so much more than meets the eye when it comes to Singapore�s pool of innovators. Quirky personalities and unexpected passions abound. This series looks at not only their quest to make the world a better place but what it is that makes them tick.

teaserVideo.caption: Associate Professor Duong Hai Minh, age 46, is a research engineer, an innovator, and a don at the National University of Singapore (NUS) with an unusual hobby his academic colleagues find odd - performing on aerial silks.
teaserVideo.title: Wizards Of Tech - S1: Why aerial silks dance inspires this engineer

tvShows.description: Magic happens when tech geeks get innovative. And there�s so much more than meets the eye with Singapore�s pool of technological talents.
tvShows.title: Wizards Of Tech

tvShows.teaserText: In an age of technological and ideological disruptions, the idea of the polymath is gaining traction. Policy-maker, scholar, and futurist Aaron Maniam tests this hypothesis, which posits that humans can thrive in the future of work - if we can gain the right supplementary skills to complement the one core skill we have. Four individuals - the managing director of Mothercare, a data scientist at dining platform Chope, a gig economy artist, and a freelance yoga teacher - take on growth hacks over four months, so that they may discover latent passions, think laterally, and connect dots to solve wicked problems in an increasingly complex world. Kevin Kelly of Wired Magazine, and Nicole Lazzaro of XEOdesign and advisor to the White House, feature.

teaserVideo.caption: Four months of growth hacks have led to this - a collaborative effort to come up with a solution that will impact the way we live. Bernard Harrison, a true polymath, takes to the stage.
teaserVideo.title: Work Is A 4-Letter Word - S1E4: Polymaths & Plastics

tvShows.description: In an age of disruption, the time of the polymath may be upon us. Aaron Maniam tests this hypothesis, which posits that humans can thrive in the future of work - if we gain the right skill sets.
tvShows.title: Work Is A 4-Letter Word

tvShows.teaserText: Work.Able is an observational documentary about young adults with special needs adjusting to work life for the first time in their lives. We follow seven profiles of different backgrounds but with one common goal - to prepare themselves to integrate into society and join the workforce. As they leave the safe environment of school and navigate through the working world, will they ever find true acceptance? We hear from them and their loved ones as they share their dreams and personal struggles. MIJ Hub, an education institution catering to individuals with learning difficulties also gives us access to their classrooms as we track how teachers and job coaches try their best to provide guidance to their special needs charges.

teaserVideo.caption: Nasir does eye contact therapy to improve communication skills. MIJ struggles financially as more students apply for financial relief. Shahir takes a final test at the studio. Will he get the job?
teaserVideo.title: Work.Able - S1E6: Do I Have A Future?

tvShows.description: Work.Able follows seven profiles with special needs as they leave the shelter of school life and navigate through the working world for the first time. Will they be accepted by the rest of society?
tvShows.title: Work.Able

tvShows.teaserText:
Imagine texting your crush, and she thinks you�re stupid because you misspelt all the words. Or going to the MRT station, and losing your way because you can't read the signs. How about trying to give your daughter a spelling test, but unable to read the words out loud?

These are the real stories of people in Singapore who struggle to read and write in English, well into adulthood.

How did they fall through the cracks, growing up with a world-class education system? And how did they end up being a hidden minority with few avenues to turn to for help?

Diana Ser gathers 5 of these Singaporeans, and give them the expert help they need over three months. This motley crew include a young engineer, an ex-gang member, a stroke victim, a hotel staffer who speaks fluent English and a mother concerned that her illiteracy is affecting her daughter.

Join them on a heartwarming journey as they set out to conquer the tasks we take for granted � from writing a love letter to singing an English song.

teaserVideo.caption: Reformed ex-gangster Jimmy, 60, is embarrassed by his poor English - and just wants to learn to sing his favourite song, Amazing Grace, in English.
teaserVideo.title: Write Of Passage - S1E1:  40 Years in & out of jail, ex-gangster struggles in English-speaking Singapore

tvShows.description: Diana Ser meets a motley crew of Singaporeans, with one thing in common - they can�t read or write. Diana is surprised one of them is a 33-year-old engineer!
tvShows.title: Write Of Passage
